text: Excellent addition to the Vegas culinary scene. Staff are helpful and expedient and the food is extraordinary. Working my way through the menu and so far each order has not disappointed. Also the soda they have is preservative free, using only natural sugar. Amazing.

This was a terrible food overall a bad experience , the cashier was rude and the place was dirty, the food prices are high and the quality is poor, the employer was cleaning the benches with the same broom the they use to sweep the floor ,and the chicken had a funny smell and it was tasteless, they want you to use their spicy sauce to compensate for flavor . 
I don't recommend this place at all  !!! 
Festival plaza Dr .
Summerlin nv.

Decided to give this a try- I got a blue ribbon sandwich and my husband got the lunch box special 5 wings, fries and a drink for 8$
You will not be disappointed

We lunched today at Blue Ribbon. We received our order 20 minutes after the time on our cash register receipt, too slow for most lunch hours.  The staff was friendly and helpful. Unfortunately the chicken was not good. The wings were doused in a salt cayenne powder that made them barely edible, and I usually add salt to 90% of my food.  There is obviously no Quality Control at this restaurant. Also they only have tenders, thighs, and wing segments. To me everything tastes heavily processed and unnatural.
The highlights were  the trash compactor and creme soda....otherwise a complete waste of time!

The staff here is extremely friendly and accommodating. The manager brought us over homemade chicken fingers with fries, because he said we miss-fired your order, which we didn't even know. The habanero sauce is absolutely incredible. We ordered the Blue cheese and bacon ranch chicken sandwiches and I am always skeptical of chicken. The chicken sandwiches were unbelievable!!! They were juicy, the chicken was breaded but not with a heavy coating. I will definitely be back here very soon and we don't even live near Downtown Summerlin. The staff took our trays, filled our drinks and was working his butt off the whole time we dined. This place is a must try!!! Their blue cheese is also incredible.

When we walked in it looked empty. The decor is nice. I think they over spent on alert ready numbers. The 4 flat screens are nice to watch sport events. The appearance of food looked great. The wings flavor of skin was good but once you got pass that nothing. I think Popeyes chicken has a better flavor. Wings felt under cooked and a lot of fat on them. Fries are ok, once they cool off the cheese hardens, sour cream cannot help the fries. The bacon being fried fresh were good. The customer service was great. They always checked on you. I do think chick filet is a lot better. I don't think I will come back. Actually my husband his fried chicken is 200% better.

The staff was very friendly and helpful gave good suggestions on menu items and checked on our table frequently. Very good food I really liked the " Kerry's Burger" I was satisfied & also loved the fact that you can have good soda combinations lol

Stopped by this place to pick up some food for a client the other day after several hours of running errands and driving around in the pouring rain. The staff was super welcoming and very friendly. While I waited for the order to be prepared, the GM insisted that I sit down and have a bite to eat on the house. This place is super clean and the food is delicious, but I was so shocked by the kindness and hospitality exhibited by the staff here. I can't wait to bring my family back to this place to eat. I loved their huge selection of beverages and sauces as well, but the service was most pleasantly surprising!

Fried Chicken was excellent-- not overwhelmingly salty at all.  Chicken Sandwich with pineapple had decent flavor but was too wet. Shoestring fries were gobbled up by the kids.  Definitely worth coming here over the overpriced food at Red Rock casino.
KFC produces better fried chicken, very expensive, never again

I really really wanted to like it since it's by the Bromberg Bro. So I ate there - twice. Had to give it another try, but they were fails both times. 

Chicken has no flavor. It was like a paprika chicken finger to me. Can you just add a simple ingredient like salt? The couple sitting next to us asked one of the workers behind the counter for some extra seasoning. And season she did! She came out with a big silver seasoning can. They even asked for more even after a couple of shakes. Sauces were...aight. Maybe we had to drench our chicken in their sauces to get the right bite? 

One star for their fries. They were thin and crispy. Very good! I would go back there just to eat their fries. And another star for their cleanliness and design concept.

Customer service was ok. They were friendly. They forgot to give us our drinks. Beer for my husband and a cup for me to make use of their fountain machine. We had to remind them...twice. And no, it was not busy. There were only 3 groups in the place at the time seated and ordered on a Friday night.
The chicken was very under-whelming and i was disappointed that there are not more side options. The overall helpfulness of the staff was good.

I thought this place  was gonna demolish all near by kfc locations. But...  i was wrong. The mashed potatoes  are similar to what school cafeterias serve in the midwest. No good!! The chicken is not fried well. They need to come up with a new dry rub. 

I can make better chicken. Marinate in buttermilk,  dip in flour that is seasoned with black pepper / cayenne / onion powder / salt.  Deep fry in corn or canola oil. Peanut is gross... 

Oh... btw... the seasoning  they put on the chicken after its cooked is so gross. But, the sodas are good.

Heard so much about his place. I think I was set-up. Aside from not being able to give less than one star, I can justify the one for the atmosphere and vibe of the dining room. That being the case, I'd rather enjoy the atmosphere with an order of KFC. This place did not fail to disappoint. Service was atrocious by front counter and non-existent by kitchen staff. Front counter had a lot of work but was rude and got orders wrong. Kitchen staff consisted of three people standing around asking each other how to make items. One guy had the nerve to make his own sandwich and began eating in the back while they were slammed!

The food was terrible. Chicken was soggy with a horribly, over-seasoned crust (use this term crust loosely) while the chicken itself had no flavor or seasoning at all. Fries sat around in a hotel pan waiting to be served, no heating lamps. Salads were pre-made in a cooler, which might have been the best way to go looking back. When my to go order was messed up, I waited 15 min for them to microwave instant gravy when I gave up and forfeited the $1 up charge for gravy fries. The best part was knowing the Mac and cheese was only available for a limited time. I was unfortunate enough to get a fresh batch and see how it was made. Pre-cooked noodles, sprinkled with yellow powder then tossed in the micro. I don't know what it was but it wasn't even cheese flavor. All that powder did was make the noodles greasy. The coleslaw would have been better if they had given me plain raw cabbage and a carrot. The slaw was watery and tasted like the inside of Panda Express spring roll mixed with a cup of sugar. Forget about the instant mashed potatoes & gravy - which made me wonder why they had gravy for mashed potatoes, but not gravy fries. 

Yes the chicken was made somewhat fresh. Mainly because they had incoming orders. Unfortunately I had to stop and wonder if I had ordered fish'n chips. Having worked in food service, I could tell they were burning oil and not changing it for at least a couple days. 

My guess is someone came in and opened a chain, gave it their best to get it off the ground and decided to sit back and collect their money without ever checking back on their investment. I hope it folds soon because that's a great location for something decent.

This is my first time here and the service was great. They even came by several times while at the table eating and offered to fill up my soda! I thought the chicken tenders were pretty good made with pure white meat and served moist with a nice lightly seasoned breading. The skinny fries were cooked good as well. They have a variety of sauces to use, but for once these are chicken tenders you can eat without drenching in sauce. My only complaint would be the price point is about $1 to $3 high for what you get.

Unfortunately I have to agree with some of the reviewers who felt that the prices  are a little high for the type and quality of the food. I understand that being in Downtown Summerlin has something to do with it, but it's still hard for me to stomach paying $14 for two pieces of chicken tenders, fries, and drink.

Its good fried chicken. Trying to differentiate it from a KFC or Popeyes (both about 14 miles closer), well, as a foodie its not worth the drive. The star rating is an accurate reflection. Its good fried chicken. Not good enough if you live by the strip. 

2ndly i thougjt there was some relation to the blue ribbon chicken served at cosmo. No. Tastes like a completely different recipie. That chicken is 5stars. 

Clean. 

Friendly service.

Be back never

Their chicken is good but it is way overpriced. I had their frenchfries too and its good but I cant seem to want to go back there even though I frequent downtown summerlin. They need a happy hour on certain days and maybe I'll go back again.

Over priced and not that great quality. I will pay a lot for good food however nothing special with the hype of Blue Ribbon chicken. Potatoes lumpy and again a large side $7??? Over priced!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
$49 for 9 chicken legs, 3 large sides and a small Cole slaw. Crazy

Looking at a number of the other reviews I would say our experience was in line with many of them. I'll start with the overall environment, which feels very open and clean for a fast casual place. Cleanliness also seemed very positive.

For the service, we were pretty pleased. Ordering was quick and easy, the 'remotes' that signal when the order is ready worked great. Then during the meal staff was very attentive to clear away trash from our table and ask if our needs were being met.

As many others have posted I think it's the food and value we were most disappointed with. We've enjoyed Blue Ribbon before, as they run the kitchen at Brooklyn Bowl, which we really like. Unfortunately we ordered the tenders which are not prepared in the same way as the wings and fried chicken, they just didn't have much going for them other than being piping hot! Looking around the room we immediately wished we had gone for the wings or actual fried chicken, it looked pretty good. We tried two sides, fries and corn. The fries were perfectly acceptable and a small fed two adults plus a toddler. The corn was a little watery and too reminiscent of something right from the can...with a little seasoning added. 

Finally on the value front, I'd agree with many reviewers in that I was a little surprised by the overall price point for what you get. It's not way out of whack, but running a little high.

We'll probably try again and definitely skip the tenders, it is great to have another option in the neighborhood.

PS - Big fan of the habanero hot sauce!
I'm not so Keen on their batter but the chicken always comes out moist and delicious. Their restaurant in Summerlin Downtown is nicely appointed and worth a quiet meal.
The chicken is juicy and tender! The food was hot and prepared quickly. The seasoning is just right. I'm definitely coming back

I am vegan, BUT the fries they serve here are the best fries I have ever had!! I literally drive across town just to get them. And they always hook me up too since I come in so much. Since I don't eat meat I don't have anything to say about any other menu items but their fries are to die for. My mouth is watering just thinking about them!

I was highly disappointed in the quality of the food. The bill was 50$ and none of us had finished the food we ordered. I had ordered the dark meat, and felt that it was undercooked. The way the chicken was breaded and swamped in season salt was disgusting. The chicken coating was very reminiscent of checkin fried in pigskin. It literally looked like a huge pieces of that fried pig skin you buy at the gas station. They get one star for the good soda machine. Please folks don't waste your money, Summerlin prices - North Las Vegas quality...

I ordered the 3 wing combo with The Works Fries which came to total of $10.54 w/ tax (no drink).  The food was seasoned pretty well.  The chicken was crispy, juicy and tasty (even without any sauce).  The sauces are served on the side and are available at each table so you can try them all or mix up your own concoction.  The BBQ sauce was the best to me.  The fries are shoestring fries and mine were slightly over cooked for my preference -- "the works" came with cheese, bacon and sour cream and were a decent portion. The restaurant was clean and bright.  The table service was exceptional, they were very attentive and even refilled my water at the table.  I would return again to try out other menu options.

When I took a bite into your chicken sandwich I actually closed my eyes and took a deep breath. It was perfect. Then when I thought it couldn't get any better I took a sip from my soda and smiled. It was a huge difference from the usual coke/pepsi products. My only call out is that everything was a little more expensive than most, but the flavors and you're great service make me forget about that.

I always enjoy trying a new fried chicken place. Blue Ribbon's Vegas location is at a shopping area on the very outskirts of town (Summerlin) which was about a 20 minute freeway drive from the strip area. 

The restaurant is bright, spacious, well-decorated and clean. Service was order-at-counter with food brought to my table in a few minutes. Food is quite pricey for fried chicken. This is clearly a 'trendy' type restaurant with prices to match. 

The chicken itself was quite good. It was breaded without being overwhelmed, very slightly spicy, fresh and juicy. It was surprisingly messy - even though there was very mild spice, my fingers got very red as if it had lots of paprika. 

There were sauces on the side, mostly mixed with honey, and since I didn't want the sweetness I didn't try most of them. The BBQ sauce was ok. I would have liked more variety - teriyaki, ranch, etc.

The fries were bad. Very thin and crispy, no real sense of potato, just sticks of bland. Would have preferred to see something fresh cut and natural.

Overall quite enjoyable but nothing earth-shattering.

Had a tender and fries meal. The chicken was good, messier than I expected. Sauces were decent. The price was ridiculous. 2 tenders, fries and a shake for $15. Next time I'm looking for over priced food, I'll head to shake shack

Ordered double dark chicken combo and soda. The amount of food was good and was full after I finished. The soda is different from the usual and delicious. The table has different types of sauces. Recommended.
Food is just ok not at all impressed nor would I eat here again. Bland taste on blue ribbon chicken sandwich.

First off you get a lot of food at this place.  We could have done with half the fries.  The chicken was juicy and cooked just right, we had the 2 piece thigh.  One thing I thought was really cool was the Boylan Soda dispenser, something different than Pepsi or Coke.  The cream soda was awesome!  We will be back.

Expect to pay way too much for this chicken. Base flavor is vinegar. Family of 3 cost was $50. 
Ordered The original, The natural, & 2 tender meals. Turned each into a combo which added shoe string fries and coleslaw.
Coleslaw was very tangy and not our kind of flavor.
Pickled cucumbers on the sandwiches were really strong. Ranch was bland and watery. 
Vanilla shake just ok
Wheat beer decent
If you like that strong vinegar flavor this is your joint otherwise we'll probably pass on this one. 
They only have one other restaurant in NY

Wow. I just ordered from Postmates because of the free sandwich promo (the delivery was great - this is just about the restaurant)...I figured that for the prices, the portions would be large...but no, everything was tiny. I ordered more things along with the free original sandwich...: firebird sandwich, mashed potatoes, coleslaw, a tender, a 'party wing', and tea.

Just so I don't have to repeat it after every item...ALL of it was small portions that the prices do not warrant!
The coleslaw was sour.
Tea was a small- for $3 bucks
The firebird just didn't taste good and was hardly spicy.
The tender and party wing were both bland and seriously MINI SIZE. I really thought they would have more flavor after seeing pics.
The original sandwich was decent.. But it was only a little bigger than a slider.
The mashed potatoes and gravy was the only thing actually good and redeeming. They were really, really good...but like everything else, it had a small portion...MAYBE a little more than a cup, if that.

No thx :/
Spending $43 for chicken fingers, a chicken sandwich and a couple of beers you'd expect a bit more.  It wasn't bad, but nothing to write home about. Staff was friendly. Definitely a one and done.

No good! Went to the location in NYC and loved it.....this vegas location is horrible.  Soda machine was broke and if you ever had Boylan black cherry than you know how mad I was.  The shakes were not good either, tasted old and stale.  The food was very average....so all in all it was a big let down.

The food was pretty good overall. I really enjoyed all the different sauces they have available. The seasoning on the chicken is just right. Not too spicy, but just enough to let you know it's there. The let downs were the soda machines and the price. I got the chicken tender combo and it was nearly $15 for that with a drink. That is too expensive in my opinion. The soda machine is not Coke or Pepsi products. It is a no name brand that doesn't taste nearly as good as real Coke or Pepsi.

Just tried this place for the first time today. The food was great, I definitely recommend it! One of the people that works there, Sam, really made the experience great. He was always checking on us, getting us refills and making sure everything was great. Thank you Sam!

Sadly I have to say, don't waste your time eating here. I appreciate good fried chicken and french fries are my life, but this place did not satisfy my taste buds at all. Everything here is seasoned with this seasoning that just tasted funky to me. I was not able to eat the battered skin of my chicken because of it. The chicken itself was moist, the flavor just didn't do it justice. I had the Gravy Fries, which sounded delicious, but again it had that weird seasoning and the gravy was not good either. Upon sitting at the table, the sauces available made me excited, but after tasting it, I could not find a sauce that suited me. The food here just didn't meet my expectations. I drove across town to try this place, but I would not go back. Beyond all the negativity about their food, there was one specific waiter walking around the dining area who was great at his job. He was very attentive to the customers, quick on his feet and he is very friendly.
Wow, Blue Ribbon's chicken is absolutely incredible!! This is our new hot spot!!! If you like chicken, than you should definitely come here!!!

Who would have known that this place has the best fried chicken! Wasn't expecting that, but once recommended was not disappointed! Ordered a bunch of sushi, all fresh and tasted great, each unique in their own way. Can't go wrong with any of dishes here.

Man oh man do I love me some dark meat. The chicken here is so crispy and seasoned so well. Their shoestring fries were just the icing on the cake. They didn't have any buffalo sauce, so I mixed their ranch with the hot sauce they have here and it's delicious. A must-try out here

I got the blue ribbon sandwhich with coleslaw and a white chocolate strawberry milkshake. It was pretty good. Chicken was soft and moist. Pretty much fell apart as i ate it. Only downside was the overall sandwhich was a bit dry. Not enough sauce. On the plus side, there were many sauces on the side to choose from. I enjoyed the habenero the most. The fries were good. Their ranch was different, but in a good way. Coleslaw was not good. It tasted like it qas missing ingredients. As for the milkshake, it was good but was too watery. Melted too quickly so i felt a little robbed. Im not sure id drive the 36 minutes across town to eat there again but if im in the area, id stop in again.

I am a fried chicken enthusiast. I love love loveeee fried chicken!! I ordered the 2 piece tenders and it wasn't so bad. I love honey and ketchup, so every bite I took had those sauces drenched on the chicken. The only reason why I didn't give them five stars is because I think it's overpriced. My two piece tenders came with fries and coleslaw with no drink. It was $9.75. Any extra sides that you wanna order is $3.75 for a small--pretty expensive to me. The adobo corn was a side and that was only okay. 

I'm still willing to come back to try more items from their menu, but I don't know if it'll be frequent visits due to their prices.

Once and done!  Customer Service terrible - only a hand full of people in BRFC and it took over 30 minutes for our food to get tabled and I had to stand over them at the counter to get them to get it out in that time!!  Food was mediocre, nothing special, and not worth the cost.  We will not be back.

Came here for the first time today.  Don't know what sets them apart.  I placed an order to go, food came out in just a couple of minutes, drove home only to find that it was the wrong order.  Came back to get the right order.  They had my bag sitting at the counter for me.  I asked if they still wanted the bag I took home back, they said that they would break it down and use it.   (I hope someone behind the counter thought better of this). Got my bag back home, order was still wrong, missing half the sides.  Wasn't going to go back again for them. 
At this point, food wasn't hot anymore.  Family was hungry.   Food was over cooked,  very salty.  Over priced for what you get.
Too bad, I was really expecting this place the be great.

Darien Worked the register both times I came here and he is very welcoming, professional and helpful. The food here surpassed my expectations as well. This marks my second time eating in and I'll be back for a 3rd! Great customer service and nice environment to dine in.
Great food, the drinks are amazing and a good change from the standard sodas everywhere else. Sweet potatoe fries were great. Good location.

Fun concept gourmet fried chicken from wings to sandwiches tired the blue bird love me some blue cheese! The chicken was nicely seasoned and the habanero hot sauce is awesome! Highly recommend nice venue as well, sit street side near large windows

Good atmosphere...chicken was well seasoned..right price for locational area...service was prompt...wasn't to crazy about the hush puppies...clean environment...next time will try the shakes looked good

Ambience is nice, and staff is very friendly. That's about all I can say positive about this place. It's very pricey (one chicken breast is $5). For the amount of money you pay, I would expect a little more flavor (doesn't seem like they season the chicken before they batter it) so remember to bring your salt and pepper shakers with you.

First timers, driving around the Summerlin area looking for something new. Heard about this place from many people, so we thought we'd give it a try. 

FOR HER: I ordered THE BLUE RIBBON -- the original with their special sauce. Came with lettuce, tomato, and pickled cucumbers (which was quite interesting). Wasn't too much of a fan of the signature blue ribbon sauce. It has a tinge of a mustard type taste... I also felt like the contents of the sandwich made the crispness of the chicken and bread go very soggy incredibly quick. Definitely no chik-fil-a. 

FOR HIM: He ordered the TENDER SUPREME -- 3 boneless tenders with a generous amount of skinny, crispy fries & a cup of coleslaw. The flavor of the batter was very tasty and paired very well with the variety of sauces, particularly the chipotle honey. I found all the sauces to be very interesting too, especially the wasabi honey and the brbbq sauce. If we ever come back, I'll probably opt to order this instead.

Bottom line: Not something I would go out of my way for, but their variety of sauces definitely was a nice signature twist. We are interested in trying the pulled chicken sandwich and the liver & onions next time if ever.

I thought I'd give this a try after all the hype. Did not make the grade. The chicken had little flavor except for the overly zealous paprika seasoning. The gravy for the mashed potatoes was oily. Was way overpriced for fried chicken.  A positive note: chicken was moist and the mashed potatoes were authentic.
The chicken wings and fries were surprisingly good. I will return so the ultimate judge can give her opinion.

I am not a big fried chicken / fried food fan so admittedly I am not the target audience for this place. That said, I was really not impressed with the food and the price points, even with not having high expectations. The service was good, but not great. It also seems like a place that does not know if it wants to be fast food, a sit down restaurant or a spot to grab a drink and watch sports. If I was a friend chicken person I would probably give it a higher rating.

This fast food chain really know how to make fried chicken. At decent prices, they make quality, juicy fried chicken with a flavorful and crispy skin. You can dip their chicken in one of their five sauces they offer, or in ranch (which is my personal fav). Their shoe string French fries are always crispy and cooked perfectly. You can get them plain or loaded; if you are a fan of cheese and bacon and having more topping than fries, definitely try their loaded fries!

I also really enjoy their line of house-made sodas. They don't come off as sweet or carbonated as the soda you would buy from the store, which I really enjoy!

Could have been a 5 star. Computers down for 20 minutes had to wait. Also it's pretty expensive for chicken. No chicken liver or gizzards at this location. The chicken wings perfect and the boneless thighs perfect also the shoe string fries tasty. Watch out for the habanero hot sauce it comes out super fast.  We will be back in a few months for more fried food... I approve this message J K KUHL....

I was very excited to see a new fried chicken joint opening up in town and quickly went there to check it out only to be underwhelmed by the quality of food and portions you get for the cost. You get a 3 piece or a 5 piece tender combo for like $14! That seems pretty crazy price wise for me, and the price for the sides was also ridiculous. We ordered two orders of chicken tenders and got a side of mashed potatoes and I can't say any of it was bad, just not great especially for how much you are spending on them. Wish the portion was right for the price. All the staff were very nice and helpful and I did love the space that its located in, very industrial but open and clean.

The price is good for its portion size and the location is great. The biggest problem, however, was both pieces of chicken I ordered was cold. The seasoning on the chicken/breading was good and was fried to a great crunch. But it being cold just puts a damper to the whole meal.

We ordered our food to go, but the place seemed nice enough inside. The associates were nice enough and the place was relatively clean for a Saturday. 

I loved the skinny french fries which were still flavorful but most importantly, the chicken tenders I had were full, and tasted of great quality. The breading was delicious and didn't slide off. I can't believe I'm writing so much about chicken, but they know what they're doing.

The only let-down was the cole slaw. I was expecting something fun and unique from a place like this (or at least with their own spin on it) but it was just regular ol' cole slaw. There are worse things!
Hands Down the best fried chicken I have ever had!  I had the original blue ribbon sandwich.  I have never had a chicken sandwich as juicy and flavorful as I had today!

Ate here the other day great service. Guy behind the counter was very friendly, and polite. Prices seemed a little high, figured it was because of the location. That's Summerlin for you. 
Ordered 3chicken strips, side of Mac-n-cheese, and of course a beer. Food took about 10-15min to arrive. But it was definitely worth it. It was seasoned with a dry rub and spice. Chicken was perfect and moist. They had 3 different BBQ sauces and 2 hot sauces. I went with ranch tho can never go wrong with ranch. 
Enjoyed the food. Tables were clean. Always nice to walk in and see a clean restaurant. They had a few tvs on the wall with some football on and the news. Would definitely come back.

I had much higher expectations of the chicken in specific here, considering the hype that I have heard about from the New York location.  Generally speaking, the chicken was pretty good and you could tell that it was good quality chicken, although I have had much better tasting fried chicken from other places (in Los Angeles); the flavor didn't leave a lasting impression for us eager to go back.  The menu options for fried chicken sandwiches are awesome and it's so hard to choose to what to order, but we ended up ordering the Rancher (I added cheddar) and chicken strips with fries.  The fries were actually my favorite type of fries -- thin and crispy -- which was a plus!  The best thing here -- THE MILKSHAKES.  The DARK CHOCOLATE shake made me drool from the first sip and I chugged the rest down so fast, and wished I could order endless amounts.  This was our first time in this area around Vegas, and the location of the restaurant was in a very nice, new spot with shopping to do and plenty of parking if you wanted to walk around!

I just tried the chicken sandwich that's all I could afford for lunch:) it's was about $8 no drink no side of fries or coleslaw:( just the chicken sandwich, it was good I tried all the sauces love honey on my chicken! But so sad that's it's too expensive, I saw they have a two piece that comes with fries and a coleslaw for $9.75 no drink, I wasn't willing to spend that much on lunch :(, place was clean and the service is good. It's just a bit pricey.

Easy to find location, easy parking
When you walk in, lots of natural light and VERY VERY clean (thumbs up)

We ordered thigh and leg combo x2 and a drink and it came out to about $27, kinda pricey from what we're used to for fried chicken

The batter felt like it was under the warmer for maybe a little too long.. It has texture but not crispy.  Batter lacked a little flavor, and the chicken isn't as juicy as we hoped.  Maybe that's why there's a good assortment of flavored honey? I don't have a sweet tooth so I omitted the honey.

Maybe the style of it is not something I'm used to, but not my taste for fried chicken.

I wanted to really like this place but the chicken needs some work. The place itself is very cute. The different flavored honeys on the table are outstanding. We loved the wasabi honey. The star of the show just did not deliver. Chicken had almost no seasoning and was a bit dry. Our Safeway fried chicken beats this easily. Please work on your recipe. The idea is great but your chicken has to be great also.

Decided tor try Blue Ribbon after a friend mentioned how good this place was. Came in and the girl at the register just stood there and didn't welcome us in or said anything as we stood looking at the menu on the wall. 

I got one of the sandwiches with the mac and cheese, the sandwich itself was ok, the sauce was good but the chicken itself was a bit bland and really lacked flavor, parts of the breading came off the sandwich so I had to piece it back together. 

The mac and cheese was also ok and not a side I would get again, the fries I tasted where good and crispy and would get those instead of the mac and cheese. Overall a ok experience not sure I would go back again anytime soon.

They fry the chicken fresh.  But about everything on the menu is fried.  Sauce action is good ... A lot of honey.  Kind of expensive for fried chicken ... 2 two piece white chicken meals w a shake was $29.

I am giving 3 starts for a few reasons...

1. Price: it cost almost $70 for 4 people to eat... at a "fast food" place. That, atleast to me, is crazy. 

2. The sodas: I know this isn't an ideal judgement, but holy sweetness. All the sodas tasted the same and as if someone had over powered the machine with sugar. 

3. Out of 4 people, only 2 really enjoyed their food. Of the two that enjoyed their food, they only like half their choices. Allow me to explain;

My parents got fried chicken, fries, and hush puppies. The fried chicken unfortunately wasn't "the best" and costed $18 for 4 medium size pieces. The flavoring was "bland" according to them. Hush puppies were extremely dry and crumbled with every bite. They were the 2 people that did not enjoy their food. 

My brother and I got The Rancher and The Firebird with Fries with the Works and a side of Smoked Mac & Cheese! The Mac & Cheese was great on the first bite (the top, crispy bite). But after that, the cheese tasted like it had been sitting for hours. The Fries didn't taste horrible, they just were not our favorite. ON A POSITIVE NOTE the sandwiches were great. 100% would return for the chicken sandwich. 

If I personally were to rate just the sandwich, this place would be a 5/5. However, when 80% of the meal isn't enjoyed by 3/4 of the people, the rating must reflect that.  

So, get the sandwich and nothing else. You'll walk out loving the place and wanting to return!
It's good. Fries were too salty. The chicken was hot and juicy but too much of the seasoning for me. Great service though.

The food is amazingly delicious.!!! The service is wonderful as well, what kills it is that music! I've never had to listen to such garbage in a restaurant before! Way too loud.!!! I'm not that old, just 53 yrs young, I listen to all sorts of music, from Christian to country to heavy metal, 5fdp my favorite group, this was too much tho! 
Next time I get Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken, it'll be take out.!!!

I was lurking social media after an appointment and the girlfriend and I agreed to stop here. We were near DT Summerlin so decided to come here.

First thing I saw was the Rancher and it sold me immediately. Continued to look but couldn't resist. We entered the restaurant and greeted nicely by everyone. Felt good and homely. Noticed the very open space, nice big windows, very retro, classy 50's theme? Correct me if I'm wrong yo. Lol.

Looked at the menu very easy to read but hard to break my decision to get the Rancher although their classic with the special sauce had me wondering what it was.. Temptations rised but I stuck to my plan. I got a PBR along with the Rancher. My girlfriend decided to get the Cheesy... One? Sorry can't remember the name 100%. I can only have an overload of cheese when I'm in the mood. We got the combos. Also two drinks. She got the honey tea and me the root beer. Paid I believe 36 for two combos. I gave her 40 and told her to keep the change. It was funny.. I guess people aren't used to getting tipped I didn't mind though. Was just hoping the meal to be good as pictured.

We sat down and they gave us the buzzer to get notice when the food was ready. I leaned it towards my girlfriend cause those buzzers be wild! Well we continued to take in the atmosphere. The drinks were even labeled in a classic feel. Cute signs everywhere. We both really enjoyed the logo because it's very simple, cute, and a very strong brand sign. We also saw their badass new age technology trashcans. 

The scary loud buzzer finally rings and I got up to get food. Sat down and we both had to angle our food to be social media worthy. I think we succeeded. I asked how my gf liked fries because she isn't used to like... Fast food type. She enjoyed then and pointed out there was no salt. They were  great but I couldn't wait for the sandwich. It wasn't exactly I saw in the picture or how I imagined. Seemed like less sauce drizzled. My girlfriends though with that cheese... It was lit. Too good looking. I bit into the sandwich and was amazing. The lacking of the sauce was. Completely worth it. The chicken was just.. Filled and compacted with flavor I couldn't believe. Following up with the pickled cucumbers it went so well togrther. It was plain out just delicious.  My gf felt the same offered me a bite and I took it. Hesitant cause she had yhe cheese I still bit into it and it was amazing as well. A gentleman walked around asking how everything was as well as delivering food to tables. I was confused because why give the buzzers if he also serves? Also asked if anyone needed ranch. Didn't ask us but we overheard the option which was fine. Grabbed some ranch from the cashier and it goes perfect with the fries.

Everything was really superb a lot over my expectations. The soda was really like soda. 50s feel as I stated earlier. Very cream feels. Not bad just not for me. The tub of fries is a lot to take in. If you can't finish one I recommend just order one combo or something. By the end of my meal I noticed TVs at the top. Sports. I didn't even realize that because I was SO into the food. My gf also pointed out an employee eating the meal. She figured if an employee can enjoy the meal it makes her feel safe. Lol.

Overall.. Enjoyed everything. Such great food. Highly recommend and will be going back to try their famous classic with their secret sauce. I can't wait! Hope my words could help anyone interested.

Peace!

Stopped in for lunch today.  The food was mediocre at best.  The BBQ chicken sandwich was dry and pretty bland tasting. For the price you would expect more flavor.  I was hoping this pace would be great but sadly it wasn't so I don't think I will return.

I was so excited to try this place! I didn't read any reviews prior as not to sway my opinions or thoughts on this location prior to trying it. 

First this place is really expensive for what it is. 3 chicken tenders will cost you nearly $13! 
It does include fries but still pretty expensive! 

The chicken was really nothing special. It was ok but really pretty dry!
The fries and chicken were both greasy and lacked seasoning. 
They have a few fun sauces to try but that's not enough to persuade me to return. 

If you want chicken fingers you are much better off at raising canes or even getting the Tyson frozen chicken fingers from the grocery store. 

I was very disappointed and won't be returning.

I was very excited to try this place, but once I received my food, that excitement turned into disappointment. 

I ordered the Natural sandwich, Mac & Cheese and a side of Mashed Potatoes and Gravy. They gave us an electronic number to put at our table. As I waited at my table for our order I noticed that the electronic numbers weren't really much help. I observed the waitresses walking around clueless trying to figure out who's order they had. When our order was ready I watched them go to several different tables before bringing it to the correct table. Just seemed unorganized.

There are several sauces on each table. They taste decent but most of them are too sweet as they are mixed with honey. 

The Mac & Cheese was absolutely awful. It was dry, over cooked and not creamy at all. The overall flavor was not good and not worth $3.99.

The Mashed Potatoes and Gravy honestly tasted like they were made of powder. Instant mashed potatoes are not worth $3.99. :(

The Natural sandwich tasted decent, but they use such large pieces of chicken strips that it makes eating it difficult. 

In my opinion this place is overpriced and not worth the hype.  I'll probably try it once more, but I'll get the chicken strips and not bother with the sandwich or the cheap sides. Hopefully next time my experience will be better. 

I wish there was a Chick-fil-A in Vegas. :/

After all the hype, my expectations were pretty high. What we got was in a word... BLAND. Hyped up, dry, absolutely tasteless chicken. Tasteless corn side dish. Tasteless mashed potatoes and gravy. The good thing is that you can mask the tastelessness with the sauces they provide at each table. Ready for more bad news? The French fries were pretty good. The prices are INSANE. $60 for me, my wife, and a baby. For $60 we got water to drink, a total of 4 chicken tenders, and 3 wings. On the upside, the French fries were okay.

Raising Cane's is probably a better alternative on every level.

It's better than McDonald's which is why this didn't get one star. As another reviewer noted, the skinny French fries were pretty good. They should change their name to "Blue Ribbon French Fries."
Soooo yummy! We come here all the time and the food never disappoints!! Best fried chicken ever!!

Really good chicken strips ...and I'm BIG on customer service and overall it was really good.  Fries were solid ... they are the skinny strip fries which normally I'm not a fan of but they pulled it off with the right amount of flavor. Coleslaw ....not over sauced, very good. 

I'll definitely be back....
Average chicken at inflated prices . Staff courteous and helpful . Chicken was tender but i didnt like the coating . Over  salted but what fried chicken isn't .

After staying under my bookmarks for awhile, I finally got to give this place a try with my siblings before heading to the movies at Red Rock. 
The setting is casual and cool. I honestly ended up being a bit disappointed though. It seemed a bit better than like going to... Let's say Raising Cane's, but eh... 
I got the Blue Ribbon sandwich and made it a combo, and while I appreciated the sandwich a lot, everyone's fries were over-salted, and there wasn't anything that made me specifically appreciate customer service.
An employee packing up take out orders was not wearing gloves. Got into contact with the general manager and she said employees were given another food safety training session.

Fried chicken and fries were really really good. Food came out fast and was fresh. 
A bit over priced 
Wish they had regular soda like coke/pepsi products (they had sugar cane soda) 
Overall really good though. Will return for more chicken!!!

We decided to give this place a second try. The first time we came in the portions were really small and the fries were kind of old. But this time I just want to say WOW! The food here is really good! Best chicken in town! And the beer is only a dollar! I couldn't resist. Plus the customer service here is terrific. The gentleman at the register was so friendly and patient with us while we decided what we wanted. Thank you Christian for walking us through the menu. You were very kind and helpful. We are now hooked on the Firebird and my husband loved the spicy coleslaw. Our overall experience here was perfect and we will be back for sure.

I went to the family and friends opening. 
When I first walked in the ambiance it's very open and refreshing. The dark meat tenders is delicious! I recommend it ! The seasoning on the chicken is good too. I honestly didn't need the sauces. But if I was to pick one, the habanero hot sauce is it !

This spot is our go to chicken sandwich place, I recommend "the pit" the chicken is always perfect and I love the crispy sweet potato fries. They also have a lot of sauce options that go very well with the chicken. I wasn't a fan of the soda, everything tasted extremely sweet.

So many people love this place... I did not feel the same way.

All of the pictures of their food just screams 'Come try me'.  I was excited to come out to Summerlin to feast on some scrumptious food.  I was disappointed.  I ordered the Blue Bird with fries and hush puppies.  The Blue Bird Crispy Chicken Sandwich was topped with red onion, smoked bacon and blue cheese.  I am totally a blue cheese lover but this had way too much.  I honestly couldn't taste the onion or bacon.  My hush puppies came out overdone.  They were dry on the inside without a wow factor flavor.  Bummer.  Yes the fries were good but that was about the only thing I enjoyed.

I also wish their sauces were better.  They have a 'Sauce Bar' close to where you order your food.  There are also the same sauces on each of the tables.  I tried all of them to see what would send my tastebuds soaring.  Well, I didn't find one.  Another bummer.

I guess we all have different opinions.  Their chicken would not get the Blue Ribbon from me.

Disclaimer: I have not tried their chicken sandwich, which looks amazing. I can't do a breaded chicken sandwich so bummer on me. What makes this place great for me is they are willing and able to do a "naked" style chicken for me. I get all their delicious cajon seasoning with none of the breading. Score! The missing star is due to their artisanal sodas instead of regular Coke products.

We got food to go and just to warn you, I don't normally eat fried chicken so I am not the best judge of fried chicken but I know what tastes good to me. 

What I did like:
-clean restaurant
-unique taste
-cool dipping sauces
-not your average fried chicken
-wings were large, but does that mean pumped with steroids!?!?! Kinda scary. 

What I did not like:
-high prices
-not many options on the combo (fries and coleslaw only?)
-the wasabi honey sauce...too much wasabi eeekkk

For 10 wings and 2 thighs it came out to almost $25. I think that is a lot for what we got. I am open to trying it again and dining in so I can pick what I want. This time my hubby chose what to get.

Saddest tenders I've ever put in my mouth...

On our first visit the chicken was so dry and flavorless that I couldn't believe a place like this was open. Seriously...

I gave it one more chance because someone else in our group wanted it and I should have known better.  Typically I don't make it back to places that have really disappointed and this is a reminder of why I don't. It's just my personality. 

I couldn't eat one full tender here. The meat almost tastes as if it's not real. The look of it is appealing but when it goes in your mouth it just feels like something is very wrong. The blue ribbon chicken sandwich is also very bland and serves up the same tasteless piece of chicken. The mashed potatoes are bland and the hush puppies were decent. The winner was the Nutella milkshake which I thought was outstanding. I do enjoy the variety of sauces and my favorite was the wasabi honey but they weren't able to cover up that chicken.

The prices are very high in general for this type of food and you can get much cheaper items from several competitors that also taste great. 

The restaurant is very clean, pretty and in a great area but I won't find my way back here no matter what.

I've come here twice now, and I've enjoyed them both times. You order at the front, and they bring your food to you. I was being super awkward taking pictures for yelp and the employee was super accommodating. 

Food wise, I've had their loaded fries as well as drum line combo (2 drumsticks+coleslaw+shoestring fries). Their seasoning for the fried chicken reminds me of the seasoning on Taiwanese popcorn chicken -- it's salty but has a slightly spicy kick. I really liked their fries; they were really crispy and lightly salted. They also have a slew of different sauces that you can dip. The employee also offered us ranch dipping sauce.

All in all, I really like their chicken here. The only thing holding me back is their steeper price. I would definitely come back for their lunch special!!

Wing Lover!!!! 
My hubby and I went to try this new place.  I ordered my Royal chicken wings with fries and a chocolate shake!
The wings were perfect.  Crunchy and crispy in the outside.  Moist and cooked well in the inside.  Fries are the skinny fries and crispy.  Paprika and other spices are not too hot, but just perfect.

My hubby ordered 2 pieces and fries, i don't know how he thinks of it, but he finish his plate clean.  So, that means a lot to him....hehehehe!!!

Place is clean and tidy.  Love the ambiance, cool and simple.

Be back soon for more wings!!!!!!

If you're ever craving fried chicken, whether it's a sandwich or even wings, Blue Ribbon is worth the drive 
Ordered the lunchbox special (Monday-Friday 11-4pm) and it was a lot of food. The chicken wasn't too spicy, they fried it to heavenly perfection and they have a bunch of sauces for the chicken. 
The fries are thin cut and their ranch is exactly what you expect good ranch to be. 
Let's just say I loved it so much, I went back the next day to try a chicken sandwich! 

Both visits the customer service was amazing :) 
Decent seating if you plan on eating there (good lighting = amazing food photos) 

The soda machine are sweetened with cane sugar. Can't go wrong with Ginger Ale

I had a firebird sandwich combo and I found it to be pretty good. Really big juicy chicken pieces and I love shoe string fries. The coleslaw is a little on the picklely-side but that might help out in case you order something spicy.

The counter staff is always friendly. They answer all of my questions about their intriguing menu. I would definitely recommend this place to Summerlin goers. They have home made dips/sauces and natural sodas.

We were looking to try something new and I told my sister to check Yelp. She found Blue Ribbon and thought it looked interesting and she went over the menu as we drove. We found parking easily in the area of Downtown Summerlin where the restaurant was located. We walked in and they had a huge menu board overhead. There was only one person in front of us. The restaurant has a good amount of seating and is clean and fresh looking. The employees in the lobby were constantly cleaning up and checking on us which we appreciated. The menu gets a little pricey once u order your entree, sides and a drink. There were several chicken sandwich options and if you wanted to you could add French fries and coke slaw for only $2. The fries are shoe string and tasty. The had a barely sweet and salt flavoring to me. The chicken sandwiches were huge with quality toppings. The fountain sodas with cane sugar took a little getting used to. The cream side was the best! The sweet tea is made with honey so that would definitely take some getting used to as we drink ours with sugar in the south. The gender friendly restrooms (on each side of dining room) were clean and stocked. Overall great tasting lunch with large portions and large price to go with it.
The chicken had a weird flavor and the fries were eh. I'd rather have KFC. Overrated place. Not a fan.

I like this place, but not enough to drive to Summerlin or the Strip for it. I think there are better options in this city. But they do have some things going for them.

I love their gimmicky sandwiches that they come up with. It certainly is what brought me and my husband in. The crazy, themed concoctions bigger than your head on one bun; who wouldn't want to try that? 

I do think that their chicken is good. While I don't enjoy the seasoning, the quality of the meat is up there. I though their mac & cheese was okay, but nothing special (especially in this city, where there are 5 star mac & cheeses all over the place). I thought their house salad was bland and uninteresting. The house dressing was not good either. Too bitter, sour and not enough seasoning. And like all chicken restaurants I HAD to gauge their ranch. It's really great. Creamy and not that Hidden Valley crap some places carry. (How dare they btw?)

Overall, I would definitely check it out. Since they change up their sandwiches a lot, there's always something new to try. However, with Shake Shack right across the street, it's hard to pick Blue Ribbon over a Chicken Shack... just saying.

I've been to Blue Ribbon Friend Chicken twice, and each time, the food was delicious. I got the spicy chicken sandwich both times because it was that good. The honey sauces are also amazing, particularly the chipotle honey and wasabi honey. Great service and good food. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas!

I really enjoyed this restaurant. Food was delicious, service was great and fast, and the atmosphere was really nice. I got the kale salad with grilled chicken. I am really weird about grilled chicken and get grossed out easily and this grilled chicken was perfect!  So well done. And the fries are amazing.

I've been waiting a while to post a review as I wanted to give this spot a second chance. Tried out the Original Blue Ribbon Sandwich shortly after this location opened and was left feeling underwhelmed. Until Chick-fil-a opens I figured it was one of the few options for a chicken sandwich..however after my second visit, I don't think I'll be back. Although I give the place credit for offering monthly sandwich specials, I was extremely disappointed by their December sandwich (the Holiday Helper). Despite being filled to the brim with With house smoked mac & cheese, bacon and BBQ sauce...the Sandwich was bland. 
Given the high cost for a meal (+$2 for fries and slaw but no soda) and the lack of flavor...I'd recommend you walk across the street to Shake Shack as their chicken sandwich is more worth your money & calories. 

Dining area: I dined in on both locations and noticed that the dining area was consistently dirty. I Often saw new customers bus their own tables or eat next to other customer's trash. White bench tables could also use some cleaning as they were filthy and sticky. 
Utensils are also located behind the counter...which can be inconvenient to request when there is a long line of customers waiting to order.

I was surprised when my hubby & myself read the menu, LIVER & ONIONS, i got excited..
it was yummy liver & onions and to top it off their own version of soda..
awesome!
and the chicken wings & fries are yummy too..
for this place..

The fried chicken tenders were good, and I love the shoestring fries! I had ordered the side of corn not realizing it had a little bit of spice. I can't eat spicy food at all, so I asked if I could switch it for mash potatoes instead and they were super nice and switched it for me immediately! Great service as well! Gerald (sp?) was super attentive and refilled my water and brought us ranch. Hard worker!
Hands down of the best Fried Chicken in town . Tastes are so good , literally every time I go there I said I only want 2 and I ended up eating my husbands chicken .

If you're going to go heads-up against Shake Shack for the late lunch crowd, you'd better have a damn good product and Blue Ribbon delivers. Hard. 

I love their flavored batter blend and cannot wait to back again. Flavor-wise, they are most definitely ready to compete with the big boys.

Cluck yeah, fried chicken! The newest spot to hit downtown Summerlin features the Bromberg brothers' take on your favorite fried feathered friend, available in tenders, wings, and sandwiches, with sides, salads, and sodas. That's a lot of alliteration.

SANDWICHES: The classic Blue Ribbon sandwich is a solid offering with special sauce, while the Bluebird kicks it up with blue cheese, red onion, and bacon. The chicken for both was super-juicy without being greasy, but the breading didn't adhere very well and the chicken itself didn't have much flavor. I appreciate that the blue cheese on the Bluebird is more of a sauce than crumbles, allowing for more even distribution of flavor.

SIDES: A small is just under $4, while a large is just over $7. Steep. Mashed potatoes didn't taste instant but also weren't worth the price. The small fry is a huge portion of skinny-cut seasoned spuds, great for sampling all of their dipping sauces!

DIPPING SAUCES: BRBQ (bourbon-tinged barbecue), Chipotle honey (possibly my favorite), habanero hot (is hot), wasabi honey (very slight wasabi flavor), and a couple of others. I felt that the sauces were a nice touch, but wish the chicken itself had more flavor. The multitude of sauces seem to be compensating.

SODAS: Their fountain drink station features cane-sugar sodas. I'm not generally a soda fan, but there was no button for water so I sampled a few and was surprised to really enjoy them. The ginger ale, crme soda, lemon-lime, and black cherry, in that order, were my top picks. There were a few I didn't try.

SERVICE. Here's where I'm torn on what to rate this place. I understand I went on their second day, but I experienced a few hiccups (charged incorrectly, then brought the wrong order). However, management was quick to apologize and fix the issues, and the service from one employee in the dining room in particular was awesome. Rounding up for that dude.

Overall, this spot is a bit overpriced for what you get, but it's in downtown Summerlin so no one's really surprised. Recommend the wing lunchbox combo (5 wings, fries, and a drink for $8) for a better value, only available 11-3PM, Mon-Fri.

EDIT: Dropping a star. Returned for another visit, still had issues with my order. This time I didn't bother bringing it to their attention. You've been open two months and the kitchen still doesn't know the menu? Retrain your staff or hire new people who care.

Fast food style fried chicken with a fairly large menu, but a little pricey for the portion size.

Overall impression: 3.5/5

Menu was big, they get props for having a "chefs selection" that includes necks, gizzards, all the offal that isn't always offered. Variety of sandwich options as well.

Food was good, I got the Rancher sandwich which is the basic sandwich (fried chicken breast, lettuce, pickle, tomato) plus bacon and ranch. I loaded up with the habanero sauce as well, don't fear, it's very mild. I wish it was a bigger piece of meat tho, definitely more toppings than meat. Fries and cole slaw were good, they're the thin crispy fries which I prefer to the thick cut steak fries. Cole slaw was more vinegar than mayo which was a nice balance. While tasty, I feel that the he chicken took a back seat due to portion size, had to knock down a star.

Atmosphere was cool, place was clean, people were nice. There were a variety of honey dipping sauces on a sauce bar by the drinks, I only briefly tried them since I got the sandwich, the wasabi honey was interesting.

Would I go back? If I lived in the area maybe, but I can't justify a return trip unless they open up in Henderson.

First of all, why is this place serving non- name soda?  The "diet cola" is absolutely undrinkable, it has some sort of funky spice in it...horrible.  Next:  the mashed potatoes & gravy were served room temperature, and the gravy is terrible...you're better off with the taters at KFC.  The cole  slaw was passable but nothing to write home about.  The fries come with a very salty coating yet still taste bland.  The chicken tenders are pretty good, but everything else we ordered was so bad it ruined the chicken for us.  We spent $33 for the two of us to dine here...it costs half that for both of us to eat the same meal at Cane's , plus Cane's is really good.  We won't return to this overpriced, disappointing place.
Great greet and atmosphere! Thoroughly enjoyed my visit and food! All associates were easy to speak to engagable. Clean restrooms too!
I'm a fried chicken/wings lover!!! I can eat chicken all day, everyday!!! Love this place.

We went on a saturday afternoon and it was surprisngly slow. I tried a sandwich and wifey had a two piece. The chicken was a little bland. The sauces they have availble are good to add some flavor. Even though the chicken wasent that great i would try this place again. They had a lot of cool sandwiches and the fries were awesome.

We ate at Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken in Downtown Summerlin last Saturday for lunch with a big group of friends. 

This place is perfect for a large group. You pay at the front, so you don't have to worry about splitting checks and they have lots of seating with 2 long tables able to accommodate up to 12 each. 

They also have smaller booths around the perimeter of the eating area so smaller groups would be comfortable too.

As a vegetarian I had the mac and cheese with cole slaw and fries. The fries were super crispy but overall the coke slaw and Mac and cheese by its self were nothing to write home about. I understand this is a fried chicken restaurant, but it was definitely lacking in hearty vegetarian entrees in that they had none, the only entrees I saw were salads.

Everyone else ate the chicken and were very happy with what they had. Apparently the first rule of eating fried chicken is to add honey as was posted on the table.  As such they have 3 types of honey (wildflower, chipotle, and wasabi) and one barbecue (BRBBQ) sauce.  

My husband got the August sandwich special "BRFC Red Hot" which was a double breaded fried cutlet with Sriracha chili sauce, Creamy ranch, and pickled cucumbers. He ate it before I could snap a photo. He said the chicken was juicy and crispy and had delicious flavor. He liked this better than the Blue Ribbon sandwich that he usually gets here. Last weekend all of our friends seemed to enjoy what they had.

Way overpriced fast food, would rather have Chick Fil A. Also my wife and I both had a touch of food poisoning immediately after eating there and sore stomachs for the rest of the night. Won't go back!

I absolutely love this place! By far the best chicken in town. I came in from Idaho looking for a place to eat and was referred to blue ribbon. Excellent staff , food , and service! Ask for Sam! I recommend the gravy fries and boneless thighs!!

The perfect combination of great food and great service!! Add a fresh, clean, open/airy atmosphere, and you have Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken.

They just opened a few days ago but you wouldn't know it by the ease of operations. Our meal was on point. I had the Blue Ribbon Special and my hubby and I shared the loaded fries (bacon, cheese, sour cream - need I say more?). Chicken was cooked perfectly, moist, flavorful. When ordering, we talked about getting a side of mashed potatoes and gravy, but changed our mind. Imagine our surprise when our order came with a small side of mashed potatoes and gravy! So nice of them to do and completely unexpected (and appreciated).

It's a casual place so there aren't "servers" but a few staff members stopped by our table to check on us, see if we needed anything. One person, Alex, kindly offered to refill our drinks.

It's not often that I find a new place that I can give 5 stars to. But they completely deserve it! We'll definitely be going back (and spreading the word for others to give them a try too)!

Very surprised that we didn't like this place. Nice location, clean, very good service.  It positions itself as better than fast food chicken like a Cane's but more casual than dinner out at a sit down restaurant.

For us, it was pricier than expected and lacking seasoning. Ketchup was my favorite sauce on the table. The wildflower honey had an overpowering taste and none of the other honeys were any better. The barbeque sauce was better than honey but had a strong smoke taste and not very balanced.  The ranch was pure buttermilk and missing all seasoning.

The chicken tenders which we split has nice seasoning on the outside but needed a good sauce or more spice to stand out. Fries were great, thin and crispy. Cole slaw was pleasant but very mild flavored.

Everything is listed as fresh made and nothing was greasy but overall lacking in flavor especially with price being higher than typical fried chicken joints.

Best fried chicken in Vegas. It's not greasy and heavy. We had the fire bird and Kerry's classic. Both were delicious and they are very generous with the fries. We also had a Nutella milk shake which was amazing. The service here was impeccable. Will definitely be going back!

My favorite chicken! Crispy, crunchy, moist deliciousness. Always fast and friendly service, this beats "fast food" joints by far! Add $1 pints to that and you have a winning combination for a casual lunch or dinner.
The fried chicken here is just toooooo damn good!! The sauces make it even better and the walk up bar that's part of it restaurant is just dope. Just go and order the whole menu. You won't regret it.

Had this a few times now - excellent fried chicken.

REAL CHICKEN!

Hot- juicy - seasoned chicken - both the sandwiches AND the yummy strips. Best I've had yet in Vegas. 

Well worth it - try this and never eat fast food chic fil A, KFC, or aany other tastleless, fake chicken being served

Best of fried chicken. Only Popeyes comes close...

This place has been on my "want to try" list for a while now and after reading some of the reviews on here, I became a bit weary.  Let me tell you, I am glad I tried it!  Not the best chicken I have had but definitely good.  I really wanted to try their monthly sandwich, the Chicken de Mayo, a fried chicken sandwich with chicken nachos, salsa, chili lime sour cream, cilantro and more on top.  It was a mess but also delicious.  I did take my time eating It though which made the chips go soggy but that didn't bother me too much though.  The meal came with fries which were great, a tiny thing of ok coleslaw, and a drink.  All of their pops are apparently homemade which is pretty cool.  I tried the black cherry, a personal favorite of mine and it was top notch, the ginger ale which was just ok, and the cream which was darn good.  I also got two wings on the side.  Although they were $2 a pop, I believe they were worth it because they are "whole" wings, with three sections.  I honestly found these better than the sandwich and didn't feel like they needed any sauce or flavored honey.  The meal was relatively cheap but when you go a la carte it gets pricey.  I was super full after eating everything and was completely satisfied.  If it were closer to me I would definitely come here more!

This is just another chicken place in Vegas. Whatever you can think of to add to honey then that's your sauce. I'll stick with Canes or go to one of the new chick fil a. This place is practically empty but none of the tables are clean. All with crumbs or with sandwich toppings. I couldn't even get my ice tea. The guy told me it was just about done brewing and still 20 minutes later still no tea. 

Pick another place to eat.

Excellent location in the downtown summerlin area. The fried Chicken was amazing! With the different sauce pairings to use. There's something for everyone. We also got the cheesy burger and the blue ribbon burger and they both great. Definitely a change from the Blue Ribbom sushi bar and grill in the cosmopolitan hotel with open windows that let in a lot of light and a more bright, refreshing atmosphere. Absolutely going to come back here with friends!

The Skinny: did not enjoy the flavor of the seasoning on the fried chicken and the tenders. The tenders were also dry. Sauces were largely one note and uninteresting (2.5) service:it is counter service but on the slower side (3) value: meh.... I've had better. Pass on this place. (2.5)

Coming off of restaurant week where we had some very good fried chicken,  we headed to Blue Ribbon to see what the fuss is all about. 

The hubs ordered the chicken tenders and the lunch box with wings. The lunch box comes with fries and coleslaw.

The coating on the chicken is a bit weird. It is a bit too thick and is served overzealously with their poorly balanced spice blend (the paprika I think is overwhelming). Not a huge fan of this. The tenders were a trifle dry and the wings (mutantly large) fared better. 

The sauces seemed very interesting but in reality they are all one note... Honey. I could not eat much of the wasabi/chipotle/straight up honey because I did not want to eat candied chicken. They are all way too sweet with the exception BRBBQ sauce which was acceptable but not exceptional. The containers for dipping sauce had such a narrow lip that it was hard to really dip anything in there. We ended up squeezing the sauce directly on the chicken making for very messy eating. 

The shoestring fries are okay -  nothing to write home about. The coleslaw was too sweet for my tastes. 

He also ordered some gourmet soda and tried all the flavors while we waited. All of them were way too sweet in for both our tastes (the hubs likes sweet too!). That didn't help with the entres we ordered.

Overall,  we really wanted to be impressed by this place but it all fell flat. Eh... Would rather pay more for something better. 2.5 starred review.

Stumbled across this place while in the area and was glad I did. The people were so very friendly and welcoming. The chicken is very good. Love the spices they use, it has a bit of a kick (maybe a little cayenne) but not enough to drive you away. Maybe Louisiana style I think. So very tasty and perfectly cooked. You can eat in there or take it out. It is so hard to find good friend chicken these days. This place is a bit of a drive for me as I live by the strip but I would def come back here to eat because it was that good. They also offer side dishes (had the coleslaw and I liked it). 

As I am writing this review, I realize I am now craving this chicken so bad and cant wait to get my mouth back there! I highly recommend this place.

The firebird was  really good. Definitely will be coming back soon. I think the sandwiches are reasonably priced you can do without the sides. The fries were ok. Also had the Mac and cheese didn't care for it too much.

This was on my map of places to go when we were in Vegas. I heard the chicken is good. I would agree the chicken and fries are in fact good. They are a little heavy handed on the spice on the chicken, but the chicken is perfectly cooked and tender inside. We got 6 chicken tenders, regular fries and fries with cheese bacon and sour cream on them. I would definitely go back!

It's nothing to shout out about. The chicken was over seasoned. The sandwich with everything on it was messy. They do make a good Nutella shake. But overall, you're better of checking out the Shake Shack across the street.

It was ok... nothing impressive. You can add as many sauces or dressings to their Fried Chicken, but if the actual integrity, flavor, and texture of it is not great then no amount of sauces, dressings, or fillers will hide its mediocrity. The chicken in Chick-Fil-A is still way better, and it doesn't need to be accompanied by so many ingredients or sauces to enjoy it.

It was okay. I definitely want to go back to Blue Ribbon sushi and order the chicken there as I heard it is much better. It was normal fried chicken and fries but to be honest I have some other fast food favorites for fried chicken.

Solid four stars for me. Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken has always been spot that been on my radar. I was in fried chicken kind of mood and decided it was time come get me some Blue Ribbon style. I heard mostly good things about the place and one general debate hearing is the fried chicken at Brooklyn Bowl (rumors heard is the kitchen is changing ownership) or Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken some of the best you can get in Vegas. I have had Brooklyn Bowl fried chicken talk about tasty fried chicken. Blue Ribbon is just as good!!

On my first visit went with the original The Blue Ribbon Sandwich. I figure probably good idea start with something that been stable on the menu for years?? It was awesome! Not often I rave about simple fried chicken sandwich. There nothing ordinary about this chicken sandwich. Sure your paying more then your mass market cheap chicken sandwich. Always one that believe you get what your pay for comes too food. Sure it not cheap sandwich but then again not going take you to the bank. It filling sandwich. The fried chicken is nice size, the breading and batter was amazing (fried chicken only good as the breading in my mind), the bread solid, and the dressing brought it all together. The breading. I love it! Not heavy, breading is well seasoned, nice crispy, light, and perfect balance cause the chicken pieces are full pieces. The gravy fries was the only thing that not a fan. Maybe not use Jersey style gravy fries. The gravy not thick brown gravy lighter gravy. They kick it up notch with paprika or cayenne or some seasoning give it kick. Put it this way the second visit made sure got regular fries. 

My second visit went for the 2 piece tenders. Talk about two huge tenders. Maybe cause am use to Raising Cane style chicken tenders. These tenders look like they were on steroids. Seriously! They were delicious. Talk about fries. The fries dwarfed the chicken tenders hard to believe but really had that much fries. The coleslaw thought was ok. Nothing that stood out came to the flavor. 

The sauces......I really enjoy that on every table have all sauces at your disposal. The only one never tried was the barbecue. It eating fried chicken need to stick too the stable different honey or hot sauce. Wasabi honey was my least favorite. I never tasted hint of wasabi. The chipotle honey was awesome and the hibiscus honey that was the star for me. The habanero hot sauce was solid. 

The menu selection has a nice diversity. Plus not often see fast food kind of look that serves beer on draft. More less can order by the pitcher if you want either PBR or Fat Tire. Also offer red and white wine. The soda fountain is different with cane based sodas. If looking for your coke or pepsi not going get it. I enjoy the fact had cream soda from fountain station. 

The service was awesome both times.

My BF loves fried chicken, whereas I'm not too big on peeling meat off bones for dinner. He had 3-4 coworkers tell him we had to try this place out and we finally made it this past weekend.  He ordered a 2 white piece meal with fries and cole slaw, I had the blue ribbon sandwich, their original and we split the smokey mac & cheese.  Order at the counter, and have a seat, they'll call you when it's ready and deliver to where ever you're seated.  They have cane sugar sodas too!   His review on the fried chicken was just so juicy and tasty!  I thought my sandwich was good, but not overwhelmingly WOW!  I didn't really taste their signature sauce on the sandwich. The fries are the really skinny fries (smaller than McDonald's) but they give you a lot of them. The mac & cheese was meh....needed some salt imo.  Cole slaw was fresh and good.  They have a variety of squirt bottle sauces at the table to appease everyone's taste buds. Chipotle Honey, Wasabi Honey, Wildflower Honey, Traditional BBQ, Habanero, etc.  The Chipotle honey was my favorite.  We will probably come back again, but with the amount of food we ordered this go round, we'll elimnate the shared side next time as it was way too much food.

It was awful....

So awful we had to eat it all!
The fries tasted super fresh with a dash of sea salt. The chicken was tender and the sodas were refreshing. 
Staff was friendly, place was clean. Trash contractors were cool.

Delicious! I will admit I was a bit skeptical coming in, but having ordered ahead online for takeout, I can say that I was pleasantly satisfied with the results:

- It's a good fried chicken, not too heavily breaded, around juicy tenders.
- Dipping sauces are plentiful and varied, as well as delicious.
- Location feels modern and clean inside, and service is prompt.
- Fries are great: to be honest, I LOVE shoestring fries.

First things first- it is expensive fried chicken.  My friend and I ordered the two chicken tender combo (upgraded fries to be loaded) and the BBQ chicken sandwich.  Our bill totaled around $25, which is ridiculous.  Our food was good, but not $25 good.  The chicken is juicy and flavorful, but my tenders were a little chewy.  The fries are pretty good, but not really worth the $2 upgrade for loaded fries.  If you care, the bacon they use is much better quality than fast food restaurants!  Probably could have used more cheese, though.

The sandwich has their fried chicken, cheese, bacon, and sauce- pretty standard.  The bun is super soft, which I think rounds out the sandwich and makes up for the price (around eight bucks).  I added just a little more BBQ sauce because I like a messy BBQ sandwich.  This is what I would order if I returned.

I love the soda options (mmm... creme soda!) but again, expensive!!!

Long story short: way too expensive to frequently visit, but the chicken sandwich I had was great.  I would visit again if a friend really wanted to go because they hadn't visited yet.

Checked out Blue Ribbon for the first time and was very happy with the chicken. Only improvement I would enjoy is table service rather than standing in line with those ordering to go. But loved the chicken and will definitely return.

I was really really not a fan
chicken was basically burnt
seasoning/batter is wayyyy too salty felt like a salt glove to the face....yuck 
was really not a fan
idk if I went on a slow day & maybe that was why? but I'm never going back

So I'm a huge raisin Canes fan so was kinda reluctant to come here. I came here since this is literally my backyard instead of driving 30 mins round trip to canes.

First of all I applaud this place for trying to be different with its dry run seasoning and unique cane sugar only soda pop... 

The chicken was cooked well and tasted great. The fries are awesome. Your tradition skinny fries you'd find in a bar. The cole slaw is different and sour style.

In short, it's good but growing up with Canes, this places doesn't compete. The chicken needed a sauce (canes sauces would've been great). The worst part is the price. Two orders of 2 piece tenders and two drinks was $28.

You get more at canes and $10 less plus better slaw, sauce, drinks, and toast bread.

The man that was cleaning tables is why I gave this place a 4 star. He alone gave best (only) service and was very attentive. Brought me ranch dressing, grabbed my forks, brought me my food, and cleaned my table when I was done. 

Once again, good food but I'll drive to Canes next time.

Food wasn't bad but it was kind of pricey in my opinion for fried chicken.  Didn't really stand out or anything.  Guess I'm just not that big into fried chicken.  I would have been fine with the fried chicken from a super market deli.

OMG!!! I thought I knew who had the best fried chicken until this place came along! I placed an office order through PostMates and we were all amazed. I do prefer the chicken on the bone over the strips just due to the juiciness factor. The mashed potatoes are the best I've had and , though, they have since removed it from their menu, they had an amazing adobo corn.
DELISH....... but on the pricier side.
Really juicy chicken very flavorful.  Lots of shoestring fries and great sauces.  Also had the natural which was also delicious.   Cane sugar sodas.  Very good meal!

This was the worst experience ever.  We wanted the fries and gravy, they didn't have any gravy. The cole slaw sucked.  The no brand sodas sucked and it was over 80 degrees in the place.  We asked if  they could turn the a/c down and they were only able to turn it down to a whopping 79.  Fries were th e best thing. I'm from the south so I wasn't pleased with this breadcrumb coating.  They wings were  not bad, but KFCs breading is way better.
