Needless to say, I will not be returning to this restaurant again.   Take you own chance on this place?

Tasty fries, but a serious lack of seasoning or any flavor in the chicken. The homemade pickles helped, but not enough. Hush puppies were slightly over cooked which led to them being a little dry, but had a nice oniony flavor. Chicken on the bone had better seasoning. Cole slaw was nice with a vinegary tang. I wanted to like this place. Hopefully they will find some salt.
The sodas require a special palette, however, the chicken sandwiches are really good!

This was such a huge disappoint! We went last night and first of all the lady at the register was not very helpful as it was our first time. Ordered the chicken tender meal with Mac and cheese. Went and used the bathroom and it was filthy! Toilet paper all over the floor. Didn't want to wash my hands because of how dirty it was. The dining room was a complete disaster. Not one table was cleaned and there were only two other tables being used. I couldn't understand why this place was so filthy. The food gets here and that did it for me. It was disgusting!! The spices overpowered the chicken and the hush puppies were like eating cardboard. Mac and cheese tasted like liquid smoke.  Can't believe I actually spent $45 on horrible food!! Don't waste your time going here. Go spend your money on something better!!

The fried chicken and fries were pretty good. The place was very clean. The staff very friendly. BUT the explicit, blaring Rap music was terrible. How do u play music with "bitch, n-----, s--- and the F bomb" in a public restaurant? The same 3 songs played over and over. Does Jay-Z own this place? The manager said its a tape that is pre-loaded and they are just instructed to play it. They have no control over content. IF I go back there I will get it to go. Couldn't even
finish my meal, it was that bad.

This is honestly some of the best fried chicken I've had in a long time! The chicken was moist on the inside, crispy and perfectly seasoned. I'm usually not a fan of Cole slaw but theirs were really good. I suggest mixing honey and the habanero sauce for dipping.

I was excited to try this new place in Downtown Summerlin The restaurant was clean and visually appealing. The staff was competent especially the bussers. The food was well....OK. I thought it was overly expensive and I didn't love the seasoning on the chicken. It was edible but not anything I will be rushing back for.

Don't expect to walk into the Wynn and you'll be great. It's a great place for football viewing and casual afternoons, as the seating area offers many windows that give a great view.

Fries are thin with a crispy, sugary goodness. Sauces are a lot of fun alone or mixed together. Macaroni and cheese is a delightful punch, whether you order the small or large.

Encountered friendly service during our visit.

Again, not the place for you if you want ritzy. Otherwise, it gets the job done.

Where do I begin? Every time I enter this fabulous establishment, i can't help but smile. The atmosphere is so light and friendly, and all of the employees are very polite. They have come to recognize me which is something i really appreciate when i become a regular somewhere. And i haven't even gotten to the most important part- the food! While i'm not the biggest fan of their chicken tenders, the chicken sandwiches have got to be some of the best i've ever eaten. The Kerrys classic has grilled pineapple and their delicious blue ribbon sauce on it- a timeless classic. The fries are thin, crispy, and plentiful. They have their own habanero sauce, along with flavored HONEYS for your chicken and fries. My favorite is the chipotle honey. Overall, i can't recommend this place enough. My experiences there have always been extraordinary.

Interesting casual dining concept. Overall the fried chicken is good, the sides are ok. Restaurant is nice, time from order to service is slow but perhaps that's just opening pains. The menu is however a little expensive for fast casual food. Party of 3 adults, only 2 sides and 3 soft drinks was $60, seems disproportionately high. Chicken portions were good, large sides are small for the price paid.

Great place to get a quick bite to eat in Downtown Summerlin, especially if you're craving fried chicken.  I had the wings supreme, which included four fried chicken wings, fries, and coleslaw.  The wings were crispy and juicy, the fries were scrumptious, and the coleslaw was alright.

I always wanted to try the place finally did it! It was ok nothing really special and for the price like everyone said its a bit pricey when you get your money spend to a different restaurant that will worth your $$$

Good chicken, great fries and huge portions for modest prices make this worth another visit. The fries were the best part of my meal, which shouldn't be the case for a restaurant with chicken in the name. The chicken was cooked well, but not a lot of flavor. It looked seasoned and smelled seasoned, but I couldn't taste much seasoning in the breading. The chicken itself was good though. There were honey and sauces to add some flavor, but I didn't love any of them. I'd eat here again, but it might not be my first choice for a meal.

The food is good. The chicken is well seasoned, the shakes are delicious, real cane sugar soda from the fountains, and the service is average. However, the price just doesn't match the quality. You can get just as good if not better meals for less elsewhere. The real highlight is the cream soda and root beer from the fountain.

Chicken came out nice and hot with very delicious crispy skin. Meat was very tender and juicy especially the dark meats. I loved the honey sweetened tea! So good! Fries and thin and crispy the sweet potatoe fries are a must. I love how it comes with all the dipping sauces and variety of honey. We all agreed the coleslaw was not good. Portions are generous

....Nothing more than an "overly priced" fast food joint! 

My Hub and I where so looking forward to eating here after hearing all the hype, what a complete letdown! 

Dry, bland tasteless chicken. Side dishes that where subpar. A variety of dipping sauces that ALL tasted to sweet and icky.
Boasting about offering real cane sugar fountain drinks that tasted weird. 
I really wanted to try their milkshake, but for $6 in what would be considered a small size cup,  I said forget it! 

The prices are absolutely ridiculous!...like I already mentioned above^^^
$18.50 for 6 chicken tenders?!?! 
$14 for 10 wings?!?
$8 for large sides?!? 

The only thing that was decent was the gravy fries! 
which I would eat again....

....that is until I got home and couple hours later have been in bed doubled over with cramps running back and forth to the bathroom doing you know what! 

Forget this place...I will never go back!
Excellent absolutely wonderful way better fried chicken sandwich then  honey salt this is my new found place and parking is very easy out front
Food is fantastic. Crispy! The French fries are the best. It's a bit pricey, but worth it.

This is probably the 4th or 5th time I eat take out from this place. I always have their tender supreme meal, corn, mash, & collard greens. The tenders are well seasoned, not too much or too little. Mine are always moist & fresh. Their fries are alright. Their corn is good, so are their collards and mash. Overall, it's not something I absolutely have to have & I feel they are overpriced though. Just my opinion!

Great experience all around!! The restaurant was spotless and in order. The service was incredible for a fast food joint, very unexpected. Jay was especially helpful and attentive to all guests, as he refilled drinks and cleared tables constantly!! Well done, Jay!

We had the Chicken Wings, Mashed Potatoes with Gravy and French Fries. All were delicious!! Highly recommend the Wings they were huge and juicy and cooked just right.

Customer service was incredible. It was my friend's birthday and Mike gave us a significant discount- we were very surprised and grateful for that.

We ordered the 2 Original Blue Ribbons (one with spicy peppers), small mashed potatoes and macaroni and cheese, 2 drinks. First off, they give electronic buzzers but brought our meal to us anyways since it wasn't very busy. The soda is great- non brand, unique flavors, they even have creme soda which is a serious rarity. 

Our meals arrive and they are picturesque! But we quickly found out they were very difficult to eat like regular burgers due to their size. The chicken tasted incredible, great crisp, very fresh, not overly juicy like Canes but just right. The spicy peppers do have a bite to them so be careful. The special sauce is similar to In N Out's, still very good. The pickled cucumbers are just as stated, definitely still have the cucumber taste over that of a pickle- unique! 

The sides are pricey considering their size. The mashed potatoes and macaroni were good but nothing to rave about. The gravy certainly has the chicken taste that pairs with the meal. 

Debated between 3 and 4 stars but due to Mike's customer service I'm going with 4 stars.

I stopped into Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken after a few drinks at Downtown Summerlin. Let's just start with that it is extremely modern inside. However, I then saw the prices. The food is WAY overpriced, even for the area. I paid $12 for a sandwich. It came with sides, but that did not come with a drink. The portions are average. You're not paying for more. 

Overall, the food was okay. It wasn't at the McDonalds level. But, it was not something that I would keep coming back for. Service saved this review.

First time here and wasn't disappointed on the fried chicken. It was so moist and non greasy it was unbelievable. We will definitely be back for some real fried chicken. 

Only thing is bring your own soda if you want that name brand "coke" product. Wasn't thrilled on there non soda brands.

Best fried chicken in the entire world! The shoe string fries were also bomb. Staff was nice and accommodating, especially the homie Sam, he's one cool cat.  Can't wait to return and explore the rest of the menu.
The fries were good. The chicken was not fresh as requested and very heavy with grease...not what I expected after reading the other reviews. Also, the menu has changed and no more boneless thighs.

A more expensive version of raising cane... the tender are the same except they sprinkle some dry seasoning on top and the same goes for their fried chicken .  

Their fries  are SOO good, sweet potatoes  are thin cut and crunchy.. these two are my fav. 

I don't like the spicy coleslaw, no spice and no mayo. The pickles are way too sour for my taste..

They have 5-6 different sauces and I don't even like one.  I do like the tender sandwich, it's a good size for the price.  I'm only coming here once and not planning on coming back, I rather eat at raising cane(love the sauce) or if I'm in the area and wanted sweet potato ..

This place is pretty good! 

I ordered the "2 Piece Tenders" combo ($9.95 before tax) which was two boneless tenders with fries and coleslaw. 
- The chicken was tender, crispy, and flavorful. It was delicious!
- The fries were shoestring fries and there was a generous amount given! The fries were good but towards the bottom of the fries, it started tasting saltier and saltier.
- The coleslaw, which consisted of cabbage and carrot, was okay. Towards the bottom of the coleslaw, it was really watery.

Overall, the meal was good and filling. I would come back.

Decided to try this place since I've heard a lot of hype about it.  Honestly it was decent but nothing mind blowing.  Not sure if I would be back since there is shake shack as another option a across the street. But I will say I'm glad we tried and it's worth a try but not running or craving to go back.  

Service was good.  Place is clean and staff is friendly. 

Food is just ok for me.  Gravy fries were 4/5 and was worth the calories. Adobo corn 3/5 something different but nothing special. Kerry's classic 3.5/5 enjoyed the sweet bun.  I did add the wasabi honey which I loved.  

Overall if I'm going to blow my calories for a cheat meal there are better options in the area. Solid 3.5/5 for me but make your own judgement and try for yourself.

Honestly it is a highlight!

The fried chicken itself tastes crunchy on the outside with a succulent meat on the inside. All the sauces they have available on the table are fun to mix and match and try out with the chicken. They all taste great so you can't go wrong.

The staff are super friendly to the point where they randomly asked us to try out their new recipes they were working on in return for a opinion. Who am I to refuse! So we got 8 pieces of free chicken wings!

Love it! Definitely thinking about this fried chicken all the time

We were staying at the nearby rock resort and walked over here. The space is beautiful clean and modern with a slight Cape Cod feeling. Chicken was piping hot, a little bit spicy and absolutely delicious! The breading  was finer than I'm used to but still crispy. They have lots of sauces and flavored honeys to try on your chicken. The french fries were thin, crispy, and perfectly salted. Everything we had was delicious. The service was quick and friendly. We had shakes too, very thick and flavorful.

The sodas are from Boylan, so if you are used to Coke and Pepsi products , Boylan is a real step up. I had cream soda and black cherry soda.
Apparently you can order ahead and drive up to the door and they run your food out. But the dining room is so nice it would be a shame not to eat in  there.

Despite the ridiculous prices we decided to give this place a try thinking maybe it would be really good. It wasn't. $37 for a 12 piece chicken tender with no sides? The chicken strips were too dry and almost chewy, stringy. They shredded as you bit into them. I'm assuming that's overdone. The breading was overdone and the flavor wasn't great. The hush puppies were awful, dry, no flavor. The sandwiches were nothing special and neither was their house sauce which they don't give you as a side for dipping the chicken, it's just on the sandwiches and with the hush puppies. They have a "dip bar" that consists of horribly sweet bbq sauce, honey and a couple spicy honey sauces. The ranch, that's not out on the dip bar, was decent. The mashed potatoes and gravy were mediocre, slightly better than a KFC. The fries, while some may like, weren't my thing. They are a shoe string fry that seem to be dusted in a coating and maybe double fried, not sure. Overall for the price and the fact that we didn't try anything that would make us want to come back, we won't be back. Nothing we had was disgusting, just not good and overpriced. If you want chicken tenders, stick with Canes.
Amazing delicious chicken!!! Definitely worth the dinner choice. And they have a fabulous staff. Gonna be my new place to eat at in Downtown Summerlin! Love love love.

The chicken was delicious, the soda fountain is great. They don't Coke or Pepsi and their tea is wonderful. The best thing about this restaurant is the service, the people are extraordinarily kind. Great location, and I'm definitely going back!
This place has a great vibe the staff is excellent, I saw the manager out sweeping floors and picking up garbage. The staff always has a smile! I strongly recommend this for some solid comfort food!

I've stayed away from this place like the plague because of the not-so-flattering Yelp photo of the under-cooked chicken displayed prominently on their yelp page. When Shake Shack finally opened up and I saw the infamous restaurant right across the street, the smell of fried chicken and happy patrons lured me over. My husband and I finally went in (I never told him about the raw chicken so he could go in unbiased), and we were greeted warmly by the cashier. I didn't catch his name, but this guy was on top of his stuff - greeting, taking orders, serving orders, cleaning up tables, checking in on customers, all without a hitch IMO. He gave us great recommendations - he said get the wings and get the creme soda, and that's exactly what I'm going to do now every time I come here (I've been dying to come back since my first visit). The BBQ chicken sandwich we got was just okay and kind of soggy, so I really do think the wings are the best way to enjoy the chicken here. I loved the chipotle honey sauce and the wildflower honey. It reminds me of the chicken and honey at Brooklyn Bowl, without having to drive down to the Strip. Their thin cut fries are addicting and I liked dipping them in the chipotle honey sauce as well. My husband opted for the gravy fries - which I thought were good, but soggy, but he loved them. I don't even like creme soda, but the brand they use here is a must-have! They also have TVs if you'd like to catch a game here. Not the ideal set-up for game watching, but it does the job. 

My advice - give this place a chance, you might be pleasantly surprised.
We tried to salvage the chicken the next day by chopping it up and putting it into a salad and we came across an undercooked piece of chicken,  glad we didn't get sick.

This was ok. Sangys r small. Fries r decent. Soda is weird. Good service and friendly people. My wife got a chicken wing box. The breading on it has a unique flavor so dipping it in sauces makes it akward

Honestly the chicken looks better then it tastes, I got the firebird and there was wayyy too much going on in the sand which. It was littered with chili peppers and could barely taste the chicken. Some times less is more but in this case more was just too much! The fries were pretty good but definitely would still stick to raising Cane's or chik fil a for chicken.

So the place is immaculate. The food is so good. But the service tips it all. I have worked in restaurants and live in the Summerlin area and any restaurant would be lucky to hire the boy Sam they have working the floor. He is just engaging enough and is doing such an amazing job. As I sit here waiting for my to go I wrote this. It's nice to see around here

Good stuff!  As I suspected, any negative comments here must be from those who don't like fried foods period. This chicken is very crisp and not greasy at all. It's a little non traditional in its style, i.e. the thighs are filleted, but I like that because it gives more crispy surface area. The wings are not traditional as they are not coated in sauce, but they provide a nice assortment of sauces at the table. Service was very good. Bright airy environment, I will definitely be back many times.

Always anxious to try another recipe for fried chicken. I would say that this recipe is excellent.  I ordered the two white meat combo. That means you get a chicken wing and a chicken breast served with shoestring fries and a cup of their coleslaw.  A beverage is not included in the price of the combo which is a $2.50 add-on so for a meal and beverage you expect to pay about $16. You are given a buzzer while your meal is being prepared. The beverage bar is pretty simple and I tried their sweet tea which was sweetened with honey which could be an odd taste for those who are used to sugar cane sweet tea. The wait for the food was about 15 minutes and since it was fresh it's worth the wait. The chicken indeed is good. It has a matzo crust with very aggressive seasoning. That means it could be a little Snappy spice. The chicken was very moist as if it was brined before cooking.  The french fries were seasoned well and crispy. The coleslaw is a deli style not a kfc creamy kind. A word to the diet conscious person definitely loaded with sodium so watch out. You could blow your head off with too many of these delicious morsels.  The bathrooms were kind of clean in some of the tables had food on them. They have painted white benches as booths but yet it looks like they're dirty it could be a wrong choice to paint a bench white with feet marks you get a sense you're sitting on a dirty seat. They have a variety of sauces for the chicken and fries which are excellent. Maybe I missed it but all they need is to come up with some waffles with that chicken. I would go back for sure and would have to be conscious of what pieces I chose because of so much salt. The associates are very nice and efficient for a Sunday afternoon. Try it you might like it but Popeyes is cheaper and I think you get more for the dollar but it is something different to try.

After paintball shooting at Combat Paintball LV on LV Blvd/St. Rose my girls wanted to get some good old fried chicken & beer.  Was it worth the drive?  So so, if you're in the area. 

The good:  The kale salad was fresh & tasty.  The chicken was perfectly seasoned & fried (not overly greasy).  The sweet potatoes were just right.  The Coke slaw wasn't too mayo-eee & had a nice acidity to it from the vinegar.

The average:  The French fries were a little to salty for my taste but luckily the beer helped wash down the saltiness.  

Overall I would come back if I was in the mood for some fried chicken.

I had read an article about the best fried chicken restaurants and this was on the list so when we were in Downtown Summerlin we decided to go. I have been searching for a restaurant that serves real southern fried chicken, not one that fries a chicken breast and calls it fried chicken.  Although this was not the fried chicken I was looking for it was good.  It was seasoned and a bit spicy but tasty.  Fries were also good and there were a lot of them.  The coleslaw was good but it was warm and when the manager walked by I mentioned it to him.  He said it was probably because they put it on top of the hot chicken when they serve it and he brought over a big container for me to see if it was cold which I thought was very nice.  Don't know if I will be back there anytime soon as I am still looking for a restaurant that serves good "southern fried chicken".

My wife and i wanted something good  to eat but we were not in the mood to be repetitive. So we came to the summerlin mall  to try somewhere new.  She found this place on yelp.  The chicken burgers are so good and the skinny fries are the best I've ever had! The workers were nice and explained the menu items and brought the food to our table. We should be here again within the next few weeks again.

Hands down, one of my all-time favorite places to eat - anywhere. Excellent chicken, tremendous variety, and a laid-back comfortable environment... what else could you ask for? You can get fried chicken in many different configurations; dark meat, white meat, wings, sandwiches. Large meals, individual meals - they have it all. Shakes, custom sodas, and lots of hot sides. The people that work here are very friendly and full of good suggestions. But it's the chicken that keeps bringing me back! Awesome!

Was super stoked to try this place after seeing pictures of it allover Instagram.  Overall experience was kinda lame.  We ordered 2 Chicken Sandwiches (Holiday Helper and Something BBQ) and the Nacho Fries.  Fries were excellent.  Chicken was not amazing.  Very brown fatty meat.  One sandwich had a leg in there, with a bone in it.  A little dangerous in a Sandwich.   

Overall the food presentation was great but when it came down to taste, not so much.

Best chicken I've ever had! Great friendly staff. The pickled cucumbers and Raising Kane's style chicken sauce are great too. The fries are decent but nothing special, but everything else is outstanding.

Accidentally saw this restaurant while looking for a parking spot in the Downtown Summerlin area and being the chicken lover that I am I couldn't pass up trying this restaurant. 

I tried their Blue Ribbon Chicken Sandwich and it was ok. Maybe I has quite an expectation coming in since they seem to have a Zagat rating. Probably the best thing was the chicken fillet cause it had a good ratio of breading and meat plus it wasn't so oily. Their fried chicken looked good and I love how they all have these different sauces from mild to spicy you can use. 

First time trying gravy fries which was good but after a few bites it gets salty. Their all natural fountain drinks was a nice a touch and the staff was nice and their manager even checked on us. 

Nonetheless I'd probably come back to try their fried chicken next time and use all those wonderful sauce they have.

We had a really delicious dinner. Saw the Smorgasbird sandwich in the paper on Friday. It was enormous. Two chicken cutlets, fries, pineapple, cheese, and a bunch of other stuff. Delicious. Got a free tshirt for ordering the sandwich plus they make a $5 donation to MS. The others had the bluebird and they liked it a lot. Fries and slaw were yummy. The Nutella shake was unbelievably creamy. Beer was cold. How could you ask for more. A little pricey. You aren't eating at KFC.

This place hasn't disappointed me so far.  Well, I wouldn't recommend the coleslaw,  other than that this place is pretty good.  

I always start with service,  and they have excellent service.  Manager always gets the food out quickly. 

Almost like a bar,  it has a few TVs where you can eat and watch some games.  

Drinks.  Only thing they have is water or house made soda such as cream,  lemonade,  and more.  I don't like to drink soda but the cream soda was recommended so I tried it and ended up taking some home. It's a must try. 

Food is good.  I haven't had the chicken on its own,  only the burgers and they are good.  Favorite so far is the bbq pulled chicken.  It has great sauce but if you need more,  they have sauce all on the tables.  Will be back. Go to spot in downtown Summerlin right now.

Been here twice now. I so desperately want to like this place. But there's just something off...

Menu: It seems that they've changed it recently...  Previously, you were able to order the usual 'wings' (drumsticks and flats mixed). Now they only do full wings (both pieces together) and tenders. The menu is a bit overwhelming. The wing combos are a little expensive and don't even include a drink. If you're already paying $10-$15 for a combo meal without the drink, I can't imagine shelling out even more for one of their sides. It just seems a little overpriced for where you are and what you get. 

Food: Prior to the menu change, I had wings and fries. I wasn't impressed by either. The wings were just too fleshy. And the fries were bland. Nothing special. I wasn't impressed by ANY of the sauces they offer but used the Habanero anyway for an extra kick. On my most recent visit, I decided to try a chicken sandwich. I got the Classic. It was decent. Also had some of the same bland fries. But for $8.50, I could have gotten 8 Hot N Spicy chicken sandwiches from McDonalds. They honestly taste better. However, my girlfriend had their special truffle chicken sandwich, and it was pretty good. It had cheese, truffle mayo, and sweet potato fries on the sandwich. Hers was totally worth it. Nothing I ate was BAD. Just not memorable or something I will crave. 

Drinks: Hate the natural sodas they offer. They all taste like ginger. The Freestyle Coke machines at Five Guys are awesome. Get rid of the natural sodas and put in one of those machines. The drink is important to the overall experience! However, the lemonade and sweet tea were both tasty. 

Ambience: Friendly staff and clean dining areas.  It is a welcoming place to eat. 

Overall, I feel like this place is still trying to figure itself out. They give you a buzzer but then try and hunt you down to deliver your food...  Maybe they just do this when its not too busy. But makes no sense. Why not give out numbers so they aren't taking food table to table. Simplify the menu. There is too much going on. You can easily cut costs by simplifying everything and then expand once you succeed with a more limited menu. Swap out the natural sodas for a freestyle machine or just regular soda. People are CRAZY about their favorite sodas. My girlfriend literally almost didn't want to eat here because she remembered they don't have Coke Zero. I want this place to succeed but have a feeling it will be gone at some point in the next year if it doesn't figure out what it wants to be.

I love chicken, and this place knows how to make it! I came in with a friend in the middle of the day so it wasn't crowded and upon entering you see a register and the kitchen with the menu above. The cashier was friendly and helpful we ordered the lunch special (3 wings fries and a drink) under 9 dollars and a Cheesy Chicken Sandwhich which came with lettuce tomato blue Ribbon sauce and pickled cucumbers. The food was hot and fresh and tasted so good. The chicken has a fair amount of seasoning  and it's super crispy! I loved that sauce , and the ones they had on the table. Try dipping your chicken into the wasabi honey or chipotle honey those were my two favorites! I also prefer the smoked Mac and Cheese as a side and it was really good! I felt like the smoked flavor was bacon but that might just be me.The dining area is really bright and it reminds me of a farmhouse. Definitley stop by this place you will not be dissapointed.

Heard quite a bit of hype around this spot so I threw it on my 'to-do' list as soon as it opened. I always hear about Blue Ribbon's Fried Chicken but can't bring myself to ordering Chicken at a pricey sushi joint. 

Came in on 7/13 and honestly, I was a bit disappointed. 

Overall the food, while overpriced, was pretty tasty. They've got a nice mix of sandwiches vs. your standard Fried Chicken offerings. Some pretty solid sides round out the mix. I'm a big fan of homemade pickles and theirs didn't disappoint. 

The two ladies taking orders could throw a smile into the mix every now and then though as there was quite a bit of attitude coming from their end. I saw there was no Buffalo Sauce on the tables, but there was a sign touting the 'Homemade Buffalo Sauce.' When I asked, the girl stared at me and said "every sauce we have is on the table. thanks." Weird, but that's ok. I headed back to my table to chow down.  

Suddenly the guy busing tables came over with my sought-after Buffalo Sauce. "I heard you asked for this, so I grabbed some for you." What a champ. It was delicious. Honestly, its probably the best Buffalo Sauce I've had. This guy was actually the star of the show in regards to service. He was nice, attentive, and definitely going the extra mile. Even offered to refill my water for me. 

***Hey Management - This kid deserves some kudos!***

All in all, I'd rather make the trek to Chicken Shack in Henderson than return to BRFC. With that being said, if I was in the neighborhood and wanting some fried chicken love, I'd make another stop. Ladies, share the love and stop hoarding that Buffalo Sauce! :)

Not a big fan of this place. I've tried it twice so far and I just don't like it. 
If you like heavily battered chicken fried really hard that lacks flavor, then this may be the place for you. Nice modern set up and good service both visits but a tad bit over priced for fried chicken and fries if you ask me. 
I wouldn't recommend to anyone I know.

Ridiculous deliciousness awaits those who venture way out west to this Downtown Summerlin establishment. 

I had the Kerry's Classic ($7.50) which comes topped with caramelized pineapple and special sauce. 

Nice super crispy, super skinny shoestring fries (similar to Steak n Shake) complement the sammich ($2.75). All the sauces are available on the table...I preferred the chipotle honey best. 

Because fried chicken is their speciality, I also got a wing ($1.99) on the side (which actually came out as two wings). Overall a fantastic meal and one I highly recommend.

So ridiculously good. I'm not huge on fried chicken but damn this is some bomb ass food! I got the pit and the firebird and I was so pleasantly surprised by the flavors. This is no Canes chicken by any means!! Also got the fries with bacon, cheese and sour cream. To die for. As far as sauces go, the wasabi honey and BBQ were really good. Habanero hot sauce wasn't really my style, but I get it. All in all, great experience great food. Will definitely be back!
The service was great but I wasn't the biggest fan of the BBQ pulled pork burger. I wished it had more BBQ sauce than what it did but it wasn't too bad.
Ten minutes for a sandwich? And there's hardly any customers? And it's overpriced? And it's tastes mediocre? First and last trip.

I have had Blue Ribbon Chicken on the radar for quite a while. Finally checked it out after reading a description of their January sandwich of the month, "The Resolution". This sandwich special is a grilled chicken breast with shredded kale, green bell pepper, pickled cucumbers, avocado and vinaigrette dressing on a bun. The sandwich was tasty combination of veggies and the chicken was juicy and tender. The other items ordered was a fried chicken breast and french fries. The fried chicken was tender inside with a crispy skin. The taste of the crispy skin was different than other places and was not my preference. The skinny fries were hot and tasty. The portion size was large enough for two people although the small size was ordered. 

The restaurant has a bright and comfortable feeling. Seating is choice of tables or booths. Orders are placed at the counter and the food is delivered to you. Except for the fountain sodas that are self serve. A server continuously makes the rounds checking your satisfaction and removing finished items.

There are many choices for chicken just like burgers. At Blue Ribbon it's all about the taste of the fried chicken. It's just different to what I prefer. I will keep them on radar for the sandwich of the month.

I was looking forward to trying this place. Service was good. Chicken breast was nice and moist. Sweet potato fries were grossly over salted as was the liver and onions. Chocolate shake was average.  Overall, I would give them a C. Prices were high but their overhead is probably quite high. I liked MTO a lot better and it's a few steps away.

I heard rave things about this place (originally started in New York), but unfortunately, it did not meet my expectations. My wife and I ordered the Wing Man combo (which comes with 2 whole wings, fries, and coleslaw) and the blue ribbon chicken sandwich. The chicken sandwich tasted bland, and we didn't taste nor see any of the special sauce that was advertised in the menu. The wings were also really dry and flavorless. We ended up dipping all our chicken in one of their bottled sauces (the wasabi honey and habanero hot sauce were ok). The fries were actually really crispy and good, but that was the only positive with this meal. 

Will I be back? Cluck no.
Excellent fried chicken and sides.  Interesting fountain soda with unique flavors.  Really good service.  Very pricey.

I had the blue ribbon sandwich and very much enjoyed it!  The sandwich was very tasty and the ingredients were very fresh.  There are some great honey sauces that are offered at the restaurant that go great with the chicken. The staff was impeccable especially for this style restaurant.  I would definitely go back!

The chicken is good don't get me wrong. But this place is wayyyy too over priced . Two wings with fries and a small mini cup of cole slaw for almost 10 bucks I don't agree with. I feel three ways nags at least will be sufficient. The chicken was very flavorful and juicy and the fries too but I can't pay that much again I was still hungry.
Totally did not disappoint me at all. Tried your ranch chicken sandwich and one with blue ribbon sauce. DELICIOUS!!! lucky me y'all are right down the street! Thank you.

I legitimately can't think of a better place for chicken than Blue Ribbon. I mean, DAMN this chicken is good! I never been happier to spend $13 on four chicken wings than at Blue Ribbon. They have mastered the art of frying crispy chicken that's moist and juicy inside. The seasoning on the batter they use is so good, I found myself licking my fingers after every bite to ensure I got every bit of flavor to my taste buds. Now let me tell you about the soda machine.

The soda machine has regular flavors, but every flavor is made w/cane sugar. What that means is this soda is sweet, full of flavor, and the carbonation packs a punch. The root beer, and black cherry are my favorite flavors, but I noticed a lot of people were getting the cream soda. 

Back to the chicken. So the key w/the chicken is to use some of the honey as a dipping sauce for the chicken. Don't drizzle so much honey that you wipe out the seasoning on the chicken, but rather use the honey to compliment the seasoning. I love the chipotle honey, and my fiancee was mixing the wasabi honey w/the wildflower honey for a honey concoction of her dipping delight. If you eat chicken at Blue Ribbon w/out honey, I think you're cheating yourself out of a better experience. 

And Blue Ribbon has $1 PBR drafts. One dollar. All day. All night. I love $1 beers! Plus I noticed the two times I've been there, soccer was playing on the flatscreens. I'm a huge soccer fan. Especially with a $1 beer in my hand!

Been here a couple times and their chicken is amazing! Something about their seasoning is addicting. Its crispy on the outside and also juicy on the inside. Portion of their food is worth its price. 

The place is pretty modern, pretty spacious. And service is pretty good. Nothing to complain about.

When I saw this open  I was really excited. Growing up in the south I love a good fried chicken. Blue ribbon uses a less is more approach. The breading is really light but definitely gives it a great crunch while letting the actual chicken shine thru. They also dust the freshly fried chicken with a spice rub of sorts and it definitely adds to it. I have to say I knew that I was in good hands when I saw the most of their sauces where honey based. And the wasabi honey was a welcomed surprise. Also the service was great. They where fast and really welcoming and.
So why the 4 instead of the 5? 2 things. The sandwich was pretty hard to eat and it really just fell apart. Plus the other parts of the sandwich aside from the chicken itself where pretty standard. Iceberg lettuce and a tomato. Mehh. The sauce was great though. 

Overall nicely done blue ribbon. Will I be back? Absolutely. I just won't get the sandwich.

Such a great place to eat in the Summerlin area!
My girlfriend and I went here because we tried this place out at Life is Beautiful and their chicken drew me towards them. The sauce was out of this world and I had to have more! So we finally got some time to drive over there (since I live in BFE from them) and it was totally worth it! We came in close to closing but all the workers there didn't mind at all and were still very helpful. They came around to the table to ask if we needed anything like a refill or to throw away things and I thought that was a great way to keep the relationship with the customers fresh and friendly. The sugar cane soda there always a sight for sore eyes! Actual sugar in these sodas and I loved it. Cream soda and root beer were the best for me. Lastly the food was just as I expected, beautifully hand crafted chicken made from the blue ribbon gods. The selection of sauce made it even better. Chipotle honey sauce was hands down my favorite. The shoe string fries on TOP OF THAT is beautiful! My favorite shoe string fries ANYWHERE! The only drawback I can think of is it's a bit pricey when it comes to getting meals for families. If you buy a burger alone, its worth it. But for a family, the ball park range is $50. So I suggest coming here for yourself and 1 other person, unless you eat as much of a 3 person family then I recommend somewhere a bit cheaper for this price. 
If you are in the mood for some great chicken at a reasonable price, I highly recommend it. The chicken is worth it alone, IMO (in my opinion)

My wife and I had been wanting to try this place and since we were at Ikea we knew what we had to do. We called our order in and the guy on the other end of the phone listened intently and repeated our order back and everything checked out. When I arrived we had a brief conversation about the Raiders coming to vegas (I was wearing my Raider gear) as he rung me up. He gave me my receipt as well as my food and I was on my way. It was weird, it was like I went to a friends place and picked up some food. The atmosphere was welcoming, the place was clean & I will definitely be back.

Love this place! We both got sandwiches-my husband got The Pit and I got Cheesy Supreme with cheddar and American. We got an order of Fries with the Works to share and a drink. The fries are super thin and crispy; ours had plenty of cheese and bacon, but I'll ask for extra sour cream in the future. My sandwich was perfect; the chicken was crispy and the cheese was melted. My husband enjoyed his sandwich as well. My husband wasn't a fan of the soda; we got diet (husband is Type 1 diabetes and we don't do regular soda, it spikes his sugar) and the taste wasn't great. We'll stick to water in the future.

I can say, that this has the best french fries textures and flavors! The burgers are pretty good too, specially with their special honey sauce! The chicken is awesome, its a non greasy feeling after or while youre eating it. Its amazing coz i usually get a bad feeling in my stomach after eating comfort foods. But this one, is not one of them! I'll definitely coming back. One of the reason i drove up from LA to Vegas.
Amazing, food was awesome, very fresh sodas, mashed potatoes, all was great!!! The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Will be back for sure!!!

Long time fried chicken lover...

1st time Blue Ribbon eater.

Ordered the 2 piece chicken finger plate. It came with fries and a 1oz cup if coleslaw. Was told it's decent size fingers. And they were right they were fairly large Chicken fingers. I only needed 2. It came with a crapload of fries. I would prefer more fingers and less fries. 

Anyway, I digress. Back to the review. The chicken fingers were somewhat chewy and seemed overcooked. The lightly dusted seasoning on the fried breading was pretty good. I also got a nice big chciken vein in one of the fingers. It was pretty gross. 
The fries are shoestring fries and trust me u get plenty of em with your meal. They should sprinkle them with the same spices they use on the chicken.

They have real cane sodas and plenty of sauces to choose from. Also there are no salt n pepper shakers on the table. You have to get the tiny packets from the condiment counter.

I like chicken yes I do...I like chicken how about you?

Would I come back? Maybe if you're buying.

I stopped by this place after leaving red rock canyon. I had a bacon chicken sandwich and fries. The chicken was nice and crispy. I love the pickles and even though I don't eat coleslaw I thought it was a nice touch. The decor is lovely and the prices were decent. I would definitely recommend this place.

The fries were too salty and the chicken can use more salt. Service however was really great. They kept checking on us to see if we needed anything and offered to get refills for us.  

I love the fact that the chicken thighs were deboned. The texture of the batter on chicken was also great. It just needs more seasoning or simply salt.

The highlight for me was the Boylan soda fountain. I love cane sugar soda. You can try all the flavors and get refills. What's not to like?

Back here again. This is truly the best fried chicken! The batter is just right with a touch of spice. Every bite is crispy on the outside and juicy in the inside. The fries are also well prepared. Freshly cooked food as you order. The different dipping sauces are a must. Try this place and I guarantee that you'll keep coming back. To top it all, Alex provides excellent service.

Even though the reviews for this place were scattered, I decided to check this place out for myself after work. Unfortunately, simply put, I didn't like the food.  I walked in and was greeted immediately. I didn't know what I wanted to order so I let the people behind me order first. I settled for chicken strips and fries. Since I don't care for slaw, I was able to get more fries. After placing the order, I was handed a pager and told to take a seat.  About 10 minutes later, the food was delivered to my table.  The food was hot and the portion size was more than adequate. However, I didn't like the taste of the chicken. The seasoning / rub that was put on the chicken had some weird after taste. I was not even able to finish the 3 strips. The fries, were ok but not great like other reviews state. Freddy's Steakburger fries and Smashburger fries are way better. Too bad, I will not be returning here.

Good food but most of all GREAT service, the manager is awesome, really professional nice guy, while waiting i even witnessed him take an order out to someones car out front. They go above and beyond here

The service was outstanding. ..The food is way overpriced for wings is what we ordered. ..sorry to say, it is going to be impossible to stay afloat in Vegas for wings n things with those ridiculous prices. Who wants to pay that much for junk food. If you want to save your business I would suggest a price adjustment otherwise you will be disappointed very quickly.

Beautiful space and delicious fried chicken. I loved the minimalist design, white walls and huge windows letting in tons of light. 

The fried chicken is breaded with matzo meal I believe, which gives it its unique texture. The meat is juicy. I highly recommend the thighs out of the three types of fried chicken. The sauces are all made in house which is crazy! 

We tried a variety of other dishes besides the fried chicken...including collard greens and milkshakes. I highly recommend the strawberry milkshake. Fries were okay, next time I'll get them plain instead of loaded. Alcohol offerings are a bit limited, but since it's a fast casual restaurant I will forgive them.

The Bluebird sandwich is this location's exclusive sandwich. My friend liked it, but I'm not a fan of blue cheese so I stayed away.

If you love fried chicken and from scratch ingredients, come here!
This place is amazing! The sandwiches are huge and for a reasonable price! The coleslaw is great! It's nice and tangy from the vinegar and has a little kick at the end! The service is super quick!

Excellent service, got my order in minutes. Food brought to the table, everything look perfect. Tossed the hot sauce and some BBQ sauce together with the fries, best decision ever made. Their chicken wings were very crispy and tender, how fried wings should. Will be back for a third time !

This place looks good but waaaaay overpriced.
Went in on July 4th, ordered 2 sandwiches, 1 order of fries and 2 fountain drinks.....OVER $31.00!!!!
There isn't a chicken sandwich on the face of the earth that's worth $31.00. Sorry.

With a little fine tuning this spot could be excellent. The first time I stopped by the tenders were soggy and oily. But on subsequent visits the wings have been crispy and the Blue Bird sandwich has become one of my favorite chicken sandwiches around. I like the seasoning on the tenders and wings, but remember the crust being thicker and crunchier at Brooklyn Bowl, which is also owned by the Bromberg brothers. A kid's meal only comes with one tender. I wish they used a more mild seasoning for the kid's meals. My guy didn't care for the spices. While I do like this place, prices are too high for a fast casual spot to make me a frequent visitor. The 2 piece tender meal didn't fill me up and that was around $12 for the meal plus a drink. I understand the quality is higher than fast food spots, but I can't spend $15 or more on lunch on a regular basis. If I bring the family the price triples. The best bargain is the lunchbox special (available M-F 11am-4pm) which includes 5 wings, fries, and a drink.

Each time I have Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken, I fall a bit more in love! I was hesitant to try this place at first because of the mixed reviews, but am so glad that I did give them a try because the chicken sandwiches here are legit. Everything is made fresh to order and they can get really busy in here, so remember that when you attempt waiting patiently for your order and know the end result will be delicious! Inside is very clean and the staff has always been friendly and helpful at answering questions I have about  the menu. I appreciate that I see them double checking orders before taking them to a customer to ensure the order is correct. They have about 8 sandwiches to chose from or you can customize your own. Sides range from smoked mac and cheese, coleslaw and spicy slaw, mashed potatoes and gravy, hush puppies, fries to corn and bacon. 

Smoked Mac and Cheese ($3.25 for small and $6.75 for large) - If it's just me, I get a small size. If my hubby is with me we have to get a large because the both of us need a fix. Yep, fix! This mac and cheese is addicting and worth stopping by for alone in my opinion. It's cheesy, creamy and tastes damn good.  

Cheesy Supreme ($7.50) - Crispy fried chicken, lettuce, tomato, pickled cucumber, blue ribbon special sauce and your choice of 2 cheeses on a toasted bun. The chicken was moist and flavorful and the pickled cucumber added a nice flavor I didn't think I'd like. For sure something I'd order again. 

Sandwich of the Month ($8.95) - This changes each month and isn't a sandwich that's regularly on the menu any other time besides its designated month. Some of my favorites are the Black and Blue and Lovebird, both of which I highly recommend checking out when their months rolls back around! Seriously, these sandwiches are big and I could not fit my mouth around the Lovebird to take a bite lol. Excellent flavor with surprising topping combinations that all compliment each other well. 

You can buy chicken by the piece or in a combo. They have whole wing, drumstick, tender, thigh and breast to chose from and they have a 4 piece mix option under the combos if you want to try a variety. Don't forget to check out their sauces and they have to-go containers also. Sauces are Wildflower Honey, Chipotle Honey, Wasabi Honey, Habanero Hot Sauce and BRBBQ. I like sweet sauces and their Wildflower Honey tastes great, so I have been drizzling that on my drumsticks and tenders.

They have Boylan's cane sugar fountain soda for $2.50 and freshly brewed tea, wine, beer and shakes. It's a bummer that the combos don't include a fountain drink, but if you are dining inside the refills are free at least. You can also choose from a couple salads and they have a kid-o combo. Monday thru Friday there is a Lunchbox Special for $8 that will get you 3 whole wings, fries and a drink. If you really have a hankering for livers and onions and crispy necks and heart gizzards they got that also lol.

Really cute inside, but wasn't really impressed with food.  Bought the chicken tenders.  Seasoning was good, but the chicken itself wasn't good, texture was off.  Macaroni was super dry.   The mashed potatoes were very tasty.   Was way overpriced for food that wasn't amazing.  I see a lot of great reviews and wish that was the same quality I saw, but unfortunately I didn't.

I had heard good things about Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken for a long time but now I finally got around to trying it and those good things are all true. It is a fast casual restaurant and the service was very quick. Rather than having traditional Coke or Pepsi fountain drinks, they offer the Boylan fountain drinks which are harder to find and better than most of the coke or Pepsi products. The cream soda was my favorite. I ordered the cheesy supreme, which came with American cheese, Swiss cheese, chicken, lettuce, tomato, and pickles and the Blue Ribbon Special Sauce. The bun was fresh and crispy and the sandwich was perfection. The Blue Ribbon Special Sauce and their ranch has a little bit of a pickle taste to it which was not great, but it complimented the sandwich well. It comes with a side of thin crispy fries and coleslaw, but I substituted the cole slaw with extra fries. Overall, the restaurant has great service, is clean, and has amazing food. I will definitely be back!

Hands down the best fried chicken out there! 

Hot, crispy and full of flavor. 

Fries need a little work but still delicious. 

Condiments that come with the chicken (bbq and ranch) went brilliantly.

Definitely a must if you are a foodie

I'm so happy that this fried chicken place is close by to my house. Crispy outside and juicy inside. We love good fried chicken and I think it's the best fried chicken we ever had here in Vegas. My husband enjoyed his chicken sandwich and he said he enjoyed the food here more than Yardbird restaurant at the strip. Definitely coming back for comfort food cravings!

We decided to take a drive and find something that we hadn't tried before.  Yes I know  it's just chicken, but it seemed like a nice easy chotice.  And we had never been to Downtown Summerlin.  So after driving around, seemed liked forever, because DTS, is huge!  We finally found it.  As we were driving around we also saw alot of other things that peaked our interest.  So I guess it wasn't a waste of time.  So they were fast and efficient.  We just ordered the chicken wing combos.   They were good, I like how they season the outside of the chicken, seems like once it's out of the fryer, they shake it in there seasoning mix.  And they give you so many fries, you can share it with someone.  Yes, it was good, but I wouldn't take a 30 min ride just to go and get it again. But, if your in the area, give it a shot!  It's not bad at all.

I'd give it less if I could. The chicken has very little flavor. The prices are ridiculous. A large side of mashed potatoes almost 9$ isn't even two servings. The fries are also way to high priced. These are just potatoes. Summerlin or not the prices are ridiculous and the chicken itself isn't worth buying even if the prices were reasonable. 

There are good places in downtown summerlin. This isn't one.

Went here on a Sunday to try their Sandwich of the Month, the Chicken Gobbler! Its like the Bobbi at Cap's but with chicken and mashed potatoes instead of turkey and mayo. The sandwich was yummy, everything works well together. My only criticism is that the sandwich was very messy to eat even after slicing it in half and I think a big reason why is because they put mashed potatoes w/gravy both on top of the chicken strips and underneath. 

I didn't order any fries, but one of the managers was kind enough to bring some with my meal which I greatly appreciated! I forgot what brand of soda they use but I like the change from Pepsi and Coke and that they use cane sugar vs corn syrup. 

Another thing I liked was their silver trash compactors although when I put my food in it it didn't seem to compact. Either way, it impressed me as trash is usually an afterthought and companies will get the same designs we see over and over.

Not your typical Southern fried chicken. It reminded me of Korean fried chicken with a salty, spicy coating. Saying all that it was tasty, moist inside,very crispy and flavorful. The shoestring fries are a great compliment. Choice of interesting sodas is a fresh change. I will be back.
Really good fried chicken. I had the  $8 lunch special, 3 wings, fries and a soda, the chicken was great but the fries were just OK.

Have been here a dozen times... Food is consistently good and service is always great. My only complaint is the cost - it's ridiculously overpriced. Two of us usually have a chicken sandwich, fries and salad with a soda and it's over $30. But there's a reason we keep going back.
Very yummy blue ribbon beer. I love the area and the people working here are nice also they accept apple pay ;)

Not going to lie, this place is pricey...
With that said, I have gone back THREE times since I first tried them last month! They are DELICIOUS. The crispy fried goodness is also seasoned well and the meat is juicy and tender.

Absolutely would recommend for someone to try. The sandwiches are the right way to go if you're on a budget, and if you're STARVING, you can double it up and add more chicken to it!

I have been waiting to try this place out for a while. Menu looks very appetizing and thought out as well as side options. I ordered the blue ribbon. Couldn't stop salivating. Really good and got some condiments to add on. Went here on a weekend with my brother. I loved the interior and vibe of the place.

First time here, great concept. Picture sports bar without noise and sports . Great fresh food prepared as needed. Beer on tap and unusual offerings. Homemade jalapeo 's. I really wish these folks the best . Nice people, great service. More visits and this could earn 5 stars in my book.
Honestly best food especially the tenders and fries and the liver and onions! My first time and I m surprised! 'll def come back!!!!! 100/100

I want to say first off,  the staff at Blue Ribbon was very nice. However, the prices are way out of touch with Summerlin reality. I mentioned it to the register clerk.  He told me they're trying to keep the prices at the same price they have them back east. The bill for my two young kids in me came to almost $50. I gave him $100 bill. He told me they do not take hundred dollar bills. This is also ridiculous. If you charge that much you better expect to take larger bills. Also, I learned at an early age, never refuse money. If you have a problem with forgeries, have systems in place to prevent it. Such as monetary scan mechanisms or those pens that you use to verify that the bill is real.   We sat down. The seats are white. So they showed the dirt off beautifully.  The food came. Delivered by a very nice server.  The food really was mediocre. All the food seemed to have a flavor of paprika on it. I have not had KFC in years but I remember KFC being much better than what we had for lunch, and considerably less expensive.  

OK, my suggestion to Blue Ribbon, is to reduce your price by at least 25% and except larger bills. A clean seat is also not a bad idea.
A little pricey, but mmmmmmm.........it's DELICIOUS!! I've liked everything I've ever ordered there, and so will you.
All you hoes leavin 3 star ratings must not know about chicken. This place is the shit. Good ass chicken.

BRFC is a solid place to try some really good chicken. I've been very happy on my recent visits to BRFC. Our chicken combos were tender, juicy, crispy, and flavorful. We like to order their chicken tender combos and dip them in all their different sauces. My husband and I really enjoy it and plan on returning. 

Pros: 

* Friendly & efficient service when you order at the counter 
* Clean and modern decor with plenty of seating/table options and large windows
* Large TVs (we watched football during one of our visits) 
* Combos include their shoestring fries and small cup of coleslaw
   Fries: skinny, crispy, salty, and plentiful | Coleslaw: a bit bland for my taste
* Their juicy chicken has a nice crisp crunch with a tasty and flavorful seasoning. 
  Their chicken is delicious with a slight spicy dry coating (a hint of cajun) 
  We do not find it to be greasy and the breading was light and not overwhelming 
* Their Boylan pop is served at a soda fountain and is sweetened with cane sugar and refillable
* Their iced tea is sweetened with honey or unsweetened and refillable
* Milkshakes are thick and creamy and my husband always orders one with his chicken
* Honey Dipping Sauce options: wildflower, chipotle and wasabi honey flavors 
  I LOVE all their honey options for my chicken tenders 
* Other Dipping Sauce options: habanero hot sauce and their own BRBBQ barbecue dip
* Lunch Box Special Deal:  M-F |  11am - 4pm  | 3 whole wings, fries, and a drink = 8 bucks 

Cons: 

* It seems a bit pricey for what it is. Essentially, it is priced a little higher than what you would expect for a chicken joint. You're looking at $10 - $15 a person for combos. However, I do find it to be a higher quality than most chicken joints. It's an upscale atmosphere for a 'fast casual' restaurant.  

Review 1 for 2017

Hesitant to try another fried chicken spot after cane's opened up, but it's sooooo different... tenders are so large, and make you feel less guilty. Their sandwiches are amazing and their gravy shoestring fries are really tasty. They have a nice selection of sauces at the table, but I'm the end, they all end up tasting like honey which is somewhat annoying. They have a great honey tea which is brewed fresh each day. The only major drawback is the price... a combo meal is going to set you back about $13.

Food is terrific. The chicken is awesome, I got the blue ribbon sandwich, and added red onion. Killer. The sweet honey tea sucked though. Taste like honey water. I didnt get any sweet tea vibe. The fries are dope though, both the sweet potatoes and the regular fries. Also, drinks dont come in a combo which is lame.

Amazingly good chicken! I'm not a fried chicken fan, normally, but this is so good! It's all skinless and lightly breaded. Huge portions, their own signature sodas and sauces really set this place apart. Great vibe inside! And the fries are to die for! Must try!!

My coworker who usually shows zero emotion showed so much emotion and raved about how delicious the fried chicken was at Blue Ribbon on the Strip, so I was stoked when this place opened! I really wanted to love this place since I LOVE fried chicken, but the bf and I were sorely disappointed after eating there last night. 

The menu had plenty of options with tenders, boneless thighs, wings, sandwiches, salads, sides, 3 draft beers, and cane sugar sodas. We each decided to go with the 2 pc tender meal ($9.75), a boneless thigh ($3.75), and a cane sugar soda ($2.75). The 2 pc tender meal came with a side of cole slaw and shoestring fries. Each table was stocked with a variety of sauces: Bahhhbq, Chipotle Honey, Wasabi Honey, Habanero Hot Sauce (their house hot sauce though personally I prefer buffalo), and... I feel like there was one more besides plain ketchup but I can't remember.

We were pretty excited and did our fair share of taking pictures of our food (we're THOSE ppl, I know) before diving in. Everything was alright - started with the fries which were pretty good, tenders had great breading and seasoning but were a little on the dry side in both orders, cole slaw was fresh and vinegary, and the ginger ale soda was refreshing. The seasoning on the chicken is already delicious itself so I didn't think there was much need for the sauces unless you were using the sauce to make the dry tenders more juicy. Overall, the above mentioned were good though I'd swap out the tenders to try the wings.

Here comes the big disappointment and my primary reason for dropping it from a 3 star to a 1: our boneless fried chicken thigh was UNCOOKED in the center!! It looked perfectly fried on the outside and we had started to peel off some of the chicken skin to eat and were excited because it was seasoned well and crispy, but upon tearing the thigh open we noticed the entire center was uncooked! Thank goodness neither of us jumped the gun and bit straight into the chicken thigh. It would be understandable (though still unacceptable) if maybe a tiny bit of the chicken was UNDERcooked, but we literally had an UNcooked center. 

It took us a moment to process the raw chicken we were staring at before bringing it to the counter to show them. The cashier that helped us said sorry and said they would redo the 2 boneless thighs. A few mins later we got back up to ask when they would be done and requested it to go since we had lost our appetites already. The gentleman that spoke with us seemed to be one of the supervisors but showed less apologetic emotion than the cashier. Meh. Our thighs were finally ready and was brought to our table boxed up with fries, a bottle of their habanero hot sauce, and a chocolate shake. The manager (I'm assuming) apologized and was very courteous. It was nice of them to throw in the extras along with our new order of thighs, but it wasn't able to erase our disappointment. 

When we walked out, there was a guy standing outside texting that sorta looked like Bruce Bromberg? but maybe not... Couldn't really tell because it was dark and he had glasses on. Anyway, he said, "sorry again guys. They pulled the wrong piece out of the fryer too early."  Ah, so that's why... Yikes?!?!

Maybe I'll give this place another chance eventually, but definitely not for a really really long time. I understand they just opened and may experience hiccups, but what a rookie, gross, and dangerous mistake to make on chicken when you're a fried chicken restaurant. There's too many other dining options in Downtown Summerlin for them to risk making a mistake this big. 

Overall- 
Service could improve to be more consistent from all employees. Dining room was clean and had TVs. I recommend taking a close gander at your chicken to make sure it's edible before consuming.

I had the chicken sandwich with the carmelized pineapple, and special sauce. My husband had the 2 piece dark. We thought it was yummy delicious! I consider myself to be a cole slaw expert, and the slaw here is one of the best that I have tried. Not too sweet, and the perfect blend of celery seed. 
The service was great, however I think we could have been greeted with a little more enthusiasm. 
It was nice that they accept tips, but we didn't know until we looked at our receipt. Certainly the employees deserve this.
We are definately going to return. I want to try the blue chicken sandwich.

So nice to have a grilled chicken option at a friend chicken restaurant. The sandwich was so delicious with a tangy sauce and fresh pickles. The fries were crispy and had the right amount of seasoning. The only negative would be their sodas are not a chain brand, and seem like they have too much carbonation. The honey-flavored sweet tea was excellent and a good alternative to the soda.

This is the best fried chicken you will get at a fast food place, really. Compared to Canes of KFC, this place blow them out of the water. I mean, the food isn't incredible, but it's pretty good. All of the combos are great deals, with plenty of good, crispy, flavorful chicken and so many fries. Another great part about it is the sauce. They are all pretty good, but that chipotle honey is just incredible. It is great for both the fries and the chicken, and has a good smoky flavor. All in all, one of the best places for a quick lunch in DTS.

It was a hit and miss. The chicken tenders were fresh and crispy but the spices were a bit bland. However the homemade ranch sauce and other dipping sauce was great.  My sister had the Kerry's Classic Chicken Sandwich said it was fresh but didn't like the flavor of the sauce. Fries were seasoned, hot and fresh but probably would've been better if we made it into nacho or gravy fries. But what really stood out was the great customer service we experienced. During our meal a few of the severs came around to check on us and ask if we needed anything else. The place was clean and organized with huge windows that are great for people watching. Will be back to give this place a second chance.

I'm not a huge fan of fried chicken but the pictures of the crust and the seasoning on this chicken looked too good to pass up.
 It's located right off the 215 and the W Charleston Blvd off ramp in a trendy outdoor mall called Downtown Summerlin.  It's location is really accessible because they are located on the outer region of the mall.  S Pavilion Center Dr is the street you need to be on.  Plenty of parking on that side.
 I really suggest you order the 2 Piece White, which is a breast and a whole wing.  Let me start with the wing.  This was so good and so juicy that I'm really glad no one was in there watching me eat this.  I promise you I left no meat on the bone.  
 I left the breast for last because this is the order I ate it in.  After the delicious'ness of the wing, I dug into this thing with my fingers.  The meat was falling off the bone with little or no problems.  The juices were flowing out of this every time I touched it. It wasn't greasy and my friend, who didn't order the breast, actually finished his meal and went back to order one...I DID TOO!  I really couldn't get enough of it.  
 The meal comes with fries and coleslaw.  I'm not a fan of coleslaw, except mine, so I ordered double fries.  Glad I did!  If you are looking for great skinny fries, then you just found it.  The seasoning makes the fry and they have it.  
 I just wish I came here at the beginning of the week I was there, so I could have reviewed more.  Tons more on the menu other than what I reviewed but trust me on this one.  I have so many places in Vegas that are a must for me to hit up while I'm there...this one just made the list.  Planning my trip and drooling now!

Unfortunately the reviews are right, this place is a bit underwhelming. My friend came here a few weeks ago and despite the mixed reviews, the pictures looked pretty delicious so I had to try it out for myself. I came here this past Sunday and ordered the 2 boneless thighs meal which also came with shoestring fries and coleslaw. At first the pieces of chicken looked ginormous, but as I started eating I could tell the chicken was flattened and it consisted of mainly breading. The breading was good, but I thought it was kind of inconsistent considering the color of the seasoning was darker it some parts than in others. Is that suppose to be like that or are they still trying to get the grove of making this chicken since they are still fairly new? The coleslaw was pretty standard so that was good. I do like shoestring fries and they did a pretty good good. Just as another review said the sauces were nothing spectacular, but when you're here for the first time you feel obliged to try them. Although I did like the hot sauce and used that the most, actually it was hot at all but did add extra flavor when I dipped the chicken into it. The inside is nice and is your modern take on country-farm like. They keep this place clean and the service was good considering an employee stopped by our table and offered to refill my drink. To save money (because their prices are kind of ridiculous)  I just had a water, but their fountain drinks and ice teas weren't from your typical major soda beverage supplier. I think I will be back but only for the lunch special for $8 because I think that's more of an accurate price for the food.

The onslaught of ridiculous chicken sandwich pictures on social media finally brought me to try Blue Ribbon. Although a new location just opened on The Strip, I found the parking situation to be much easier to navigate in Summerlin. My intrigue began almost a month ago when Blue Ribbon promoted a sandwich called The Smorgasbird - a double decker chicken sandwich stuffed with fries, barbecue chicken, grilled pineapple and sauce at a nice price point of $15. 

The challenge was to finish the bird within 5 minutes and to challenge other friends to do the same to be entered to win a free Hail Mary platter (that's 25 whole wings, 25 tenders, and a side). To sweeten the dean, $5 of that goes to the National MS Society, plus you get your choice of a free shirt or hat. It was win, win win, so I went for it. 

I skipped out on the actual binging challenge and split it with my sister. The chicken itself was good, but in the hodgepodge of different types of food all mixed together, individual flavors were difficult to discern. I did enjoy the skinny cut fries that they had. If you're feeling adventurous, try the chef's choice, beak to butt. While it wasn't for me, it's nice to see that no part of the bird is wasted and you can enjoy parts that some may see as delicacies such as the heart or gizzard. 

Overall, I found the chicken to be tender and juicy, but I'll have to try the original sandwich as well as the individual pieces. I love that they have different types of honey including spicy wasabi, which gives it an extra kick. I found the prices to be very reasonable, especially if you're coming for lunch and can grab lunchbox special for $8. The sweet honey tea is great, without being overly sweetened.

The Blue Ribbon Sauce is absolutely delicious!  Breaded or grilled the chicken is fantastic.  You can even eat healthy if you order a salad with grilled chicken.  The grilled chicken tenders are great too.  

There are many sauces to choose from in addition the Blue Ribbon Sauce.  The habanero sauce is our sons favorite.

Flavors were ok but just like everyone's gripe is the price, be prepared to break the bank with this hidden chicken joint!

Came in to an empty restaurant around 4pm, caught off guard as I would've thought that would be their big rush? I guess this worked out well in my favor seeing how the time for order to eating would probably be greatly increased if it were packed.

I and the girlfriend ordered the 2 piece dark combo and the blue ribbon chicken sandwich with sweet tea.

The girl behind the cash register said $25 dollars with a straight face and said it would take about 15 minutes. I swiped my card and proceeded to grab a seat in the desolate dining area. When my buzzer finally rang after what had seemed a lifetime, I walked up to the counter.

I ordered dine in yet I still received a nicely designed paper bag with their logo, I guess to advertise the 10 foot walk from counter to table? I sat down opened up the bag yet to pull out another paper bag containing my food and soaked in grease. The portions were delightfully small in terms of the actual chicken and cole slaw, yet swamped with skinny fries screaming too much salt. The chicken had a decent seasoning (bit salty) and crunch yet was just lacking proper amount for price. All the sauces offered were horrendous besides the habanero sauce(this was oh so good). Read my tip on the sweet tea, it's over priced and falsely advertised. Also I didn't order this but I did notice $5 pints of PBR! Seriously? I can buy a lifetime supply of PBR for that price.

All in all the flavors were just "ok" nothing that screamed come back for more, specially from a place specializing in chicken? Step your game up Blue Ribbon and maybe we will come back!  I see why the place is so empty now. I'll walk next door to Public School instead.

Used to love this place!! Why not great food super service! From NY so it's like wow they have Boylan's Real Cane Soda on Tap. In the past few months to many bad ideas.... Horrible Menu Changes no more Boneless Dark Thighs OMG so good. No more party packs on the wings! What's going on over there!! I was in a few weeks ago 2 families got up after waiting 40 minutes plus for there food and demanded a refund and left! My wife went tonight to get me party wings and yup another change I'm unfortunately done w Blue Ribbon Chicken I'm from the old school if it's not broke don't fix it! It's not just me quite a few people have mentioned to me that it's just going down hill quick!
The chicken was great moist crispy and juicy. Not greasy at all. Pickled cucumbers are so good. Great skinny fries and so many sauces to choose from

Just tried it for the 1st time this last weekend- sooooo good! Chicken was really great on a sandwich & the drumsticks  were superb!! I will definitely be back! Also I called it in & was ready for pick up 10 minutes later! Amazing!!
Downtown Summerlin is not on my normal path, but wow!! If I'm ever in the area and crave an excellent meal I will come back here again!!! Loved the slaw too!!

I am a huge fried chicken fan, so when I saw this restaurant I was very excited to try it. The mainstays of their menu are chicken tenders and chicken sandwiches. I opted for the "blue Ribbon" sandwich, their mainstay sandwich, a side of fries, and a soda (free refills). The total came out to about $16.

The sandwich was good. I didn't think the chicken dry or greasy, enjoyed the seasoning on the breading, and enjoyed the fresh (and cool) lettuce, tomatoes, and pickles against the warmer chicken. Several different sauces are offered, all sweet. I tried them all, none of them wowed me. The fries are shoestring, not my favorite. The soda was...soda. Overall, I enjoyed the food and the service was above average. Being new, the restaurant itself was spotless. What really brought this place down were the prices. I guess I can understand the rents are pretty high at Downtown Summerlin, but close to $16 for a smallish chicken sandwich, shoestring fries and a soda is a lot!

Although there are a few higher priced eateries in Downtown Summerlin than Blue Ribbon, there are a lot of less expensive/better value choices too. On a plus note, all the packaging was biodegradable and able to be recycled!

Went here because heard people raving about it personally the chicken is very juicy but has too much seasoning on the skin but loved the fries with the works. The fries with the works is just like eating a baked potato.

To the owners of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken, I would like to offer my heartfelt apologies just in case the spirit of my dearly departed grandmother appears and hits you with her cast iron skillet.  Yes...your chicken is that good.

As a transplant from the Great American Southeast, I am somewhat of a chicken snob, and have been continually amazed at the lack of quality fried fowl west of the Mississippi.  One of my fondest childhood memories is of grandma's cast iron skillet fried chicken.  Every Thursday night was chicken night, and man could she fricassee a bird.   It wasn't a meal as much as it was an event.

After joining the Navy in the 80's (yeah I'm and old dude) and moving to San Diego, I realized that the only easily attainable fried chicken was from the Colonel.  It may have been good stuff a long time ago when he was fryin' it up himself at his roadside diner, but in the decades that have followed Pepsi Co. has done an excellent job of turning it into an over-salted, polymer-laced, fast food facsimile of a bone-in Chicken McNugget.  Put another way...yuck.

Having recently moved to Summerlin Las Vegas, my wife and I have spent our weekends exploring the Valley's ample food scene.  To my chagrin however, all the highly touted chicken joints in town have fallen flat.  It seemed as if we were doomed to seek what pleasure we could from a greasy bucket of corporate squab emblazoned with the Colonel's evil grinning face.  I can almost see him in his secret control room under Mount Charleston, laughing maniacally as he watches us on the mini-cam inserted in one of our thighs by regional marketing.  Yeah, I know he is dead...or is he?

Then, just today, as I was strolling through Downtown Summerlin wondering what I would have for lunch, I stumbled upon Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken.  "How good could this possibly be," I thought to myself as I stopped to look at the menu.   After all, I am sure it is just a KFC in disguise.  Skepticism aside, I was intrigued so I threw caution to the wind, went in, and ordered their "Two Thigh" dinner.  I waited about 10 minutes for my meal, and when it arrived it was fresh and beautifully prepared.  If you are a connoisseur of chicken, you know when you see a special piece of bird, and this was one of those moments.  I had not seen such a thigh since Baywatch was cancelled. This is where Grandma starts getting mad...

The coating was crisp, well-seasoned, and created a wonderful shell for the moist and tender thigh meat inside.
