I doused my first bite with an ample portion of wildflower honey and began slip back in time.  I looked into the open kitchen and, just for a moment, thought I saw grandmother working the fryer.  This was good stuff.  

After a couple more bites of my glorious bird, I tasted my side of collard greens and was pleased to see that Blue Ribbon had gotten them right too.  It tasted just like it had come out of a South Georgia pressure cooker.  Grandma is really beside herself at this point...

Finally I took a deep swig of iced tea and was pleased to discover that Blue Ribbon knew their brew. Tea is extremely important in the south.  We drink it more than Budweiser at a NASCAR race, and it can make or break a meal.  In these days of soda fountain tea-flavored chemicals, a Pepsi Co. invention no doubt, finding an establishment that serves real tea is always refreshing. Grandma is now raising the skillet over her head...

In the final analysis, I have determined that Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken may well make some of the best fried chicken I have had the pleasure of consuming.  Grandma swings...  I am not sure if it is fast food or not but, in the words of the late Justin Wilson, it is so good you will want to stand up an' slap someone...but don't...just enjoy your meal.  Grandma's pan finds its target...sorry guys.

I had heard rave reviews of this fried chicken so we finally made it in for lunch! 

Surprisingly, it was very quiet for a Saturday afternoon at DT summerlin. We were pleasantly surprised that beers were 2 for 1 during games. We aren't sports fans but we are fans of free beer! 

I had a chicken sandwich, while hubby had a 2 piece meal and our little had a chicken tender kids meal. It was a lot of food and reasonably priced. 

Was this chicken delicious and juicy? Yes! Was it life changing? No. But tasty nonetheless. The different honey options were a fun touch. 

We had great service. They checked on us often and met our every need. Surprising for a place with counter service. 

I would certainly return for a scrumptious lunch or an ultra casual dinner.

Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken is one of those places that grew on me. I have to admit, I wasn't impressed with BRFC the first two times that I dined here.  I wasn't originally a fan of their chicken, the shoestring fries, and the sticker shock. In my opinion, a combo meal at around $15 is just too pricey.  I have been back multiple times since my first two visits.  And since then, I have tried almost everything on their menu, including their sides and the monthly chicken sandwiches.  Either BRFC stepped up their game or I came to appreciate what they had to offer.  The fried chicken is very tender, fully seasoned (BRFC doesn't miss a spot), and juicy.  The quality of their chicken is a huge plus for me.  I know I'm getting at least 6 oz. of chicken meat when I have one of their chicken sandwiches.  My favorites include February's Love Bird, May's Chicken de Mayo, the Natural (grilled chicken sandwich), some parts of the Beak-to-Butt, and Da Whole Bird.  The service is always great too.  And by the way, I'm still not a fan of their shoestring fries.

As a fan of chicken, I'm always on a lookout for some great chicken and after trying BRFC's location on the strip and totally enjoying my visit I wanted to try this location when I was at Downtown Summerlin. 

First thing I noticed and liked about this location compared to the one on the Strip was the size of it. It's very spacious on the inside with lots of seating to accommodate small or larger groups of people. I just wish this location had outdoor seating as I'm a fan out eating outside when the weather permits. 

Inside was clean with all empty tables wiped down and the floors swept. The drink and sauce stations were wiped down and stocked. The restroom was also clean and stocked with all the necessities. 

Ordering was super easy and quick. The guy at the register was very friendly and gave options when ordering, unlike the other location. I and my guest ordered the Rancher Sandwich and the Cheesy Supreme sandwich (made this a combo for an extra $2). Both sandwiches cost $8.75 each. When we ordered a combo, the guy asked if we wanted extra fries or the cole slaw. We aren't slaw fans, so we asked for extra fries. This was a very nice option for us that the Strip location didn't offer to us. 

I love their thin crispy fries. They are well seasoned and perfectly cooked without being greasy. The chicken in the sandwiches was crispy and moist which is always a plus for me. Nothing worse than a dry chicken in a sandwich. However, I was a bit disappointed with this location for the fact that there wasn't much sauce on my sandwich so it overall was dry. I'm one that loves a nice juicy and messy sandwich. Good thing that they offer some sauces on each table as I was able to add a BBQ sauce to my sandwich to make it more flavorful and not so dry. Next time I'll ask if they can put extra sauce on my sandwich. 

Look forward to coming back again and trying something else new.
The service was good which is why I gave it two stars but the chicken was just average chicken fingers. I found the sauces and the soda to be very disappointing.

So yummy!! I dont even understand the bad reviews. The cashier was really nice and helpful, he even took the time to personally talk to us about our day. Ive seen lots of hype for this place and it lived up to it! Only thing is the habanero hot sauce is pretty bland. Go with the Louisiana one instead. 
I got the firebird I think it was called, added swiss cheese and smoked bacon. So delicious.

This wasn't like your typical fried chicken restuarant. It was better than your typical fried chicken! The fried chicken was super crispy which made the burger tasted really well. They have a variety of different burgers with the fried chicken but I got the spicy one&i loved it! 10/10 would recommend

I'd heard from trusted advisors that Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken was absolutely not to be missed were I in the Las Vegas area, so it was on a very hot Monday that I found myself rolling up to their sole Nevada location.

Of course, I went with the The Blue Ribbon (Crispy chicken with shredded lettuce, tomato, pickled cucumbers, and Blue Ribbon Special Sauce on a toasted bun). And I'll be honest, this enormous sandwich did not disappoint. The chicken itself was fried perfectly and was still super moist and juicy. It was accompanied by a strong selection of condiments, although, if I have one complaint, it's that the Blue Ribbon Special Sauce was applied perhaps a little too generously, as the middle of the sandwich became disappointingly soggy.

I ordered the sandwich as part of a combo, and while the accompanying fries were very tasty, we didn't receive the advertised coleslaw. What gives?
Overpriced and ain't nothing special! Don't be fooled by the pictures like I was! The only thing that okay where the fries

Is Summerlin, Nevada a town, a neighborhood, or just a giant strip mall? The world may never know. But what I can tell the world about the shopping plaza called Downtown Summerlin is that it is home to one of the best fried chicken sandwiches in the country. I had the cheesey supreme sandwich, which isn't necessary, next time I would go with the traditional blue ribbon. The sandwich is so good it doesn't need cheese. I also made it a combo with fries (fries with the works) and coleslaw. The fries had bacon, melted cheese, and sour cream...need I say more? I topped off my meal with a PBR, to keep with the blue ribbon theme. The whole meal was under $16, which is a total steal. It's definitely worth the trip out here just for the fried chicken sandwich (and don't forget the fries with the works). #cluckyeah
Great tasting chicken! I absolutely love the pickled cucumbers on the chicken sandwiches.

Best fried chicken I've ever EVER had. I'm slowly working my way through the menu. Haven't had a bad thing yet.. plus depending on the month they have a "special" which is allllllways good. Thanksgivings was the best of course.
First time there omg the food was amazing. The cashier referred me the special and it was amazing. The frys were out of this world as well. It was a na amazing experience.

SO GOOD!! Really quick service, awesome everything, and the honey sauces are great. Their honey sweet tea is fresh and just a tiny bit of sweetness is great.
The manager is really nice as well.
Hands down, this is some of the best fried chicken this side of the Mississippi!!

My boyfriend had the classic blue ribbon sandwich and loves it, fries are bomb.com

I was in Downtown Summerlin and had a huge craving for fried chicken, so instead of going to Shake Shack as I had planned, I went here instead.  I go the fried chicken sandwich combo (chicken sandwich with sides of fries and cole slaw).  The fries were my favorite part of the meal.   - thin, crispy, and plentiful.  I really disliked the cole slaw - it had so much vinegar that I couldn't even taste anything else, so I didn't finish it.

Now let's talk about the actual fried chicken sandwich.  The chicken was fresh but was very bland - it tasted as if it was unseasoned.  The breading actually peeled off, which is one of my biggest fried chicken pet peeves.  Instead of one big piece of chicken, it was two chicken tenders, as a result, eating the sandwich was a very messy ordeal that resulted in the sandwich contents falling out all over the place.  The bun was tasty, but was not warm enough.  All of the BBQ sauces on the side were far too sweet for my taste.  

I had high expectations of this place, but was sadly disappointed.  I will not be returning.
I am a big gizzards fan! The main reason I tried this place was because they had chicken gizzards with onions! I really enjoyed that! The fried chicken was so tender, not bad at all!

Very, very good fried chicken.  They have a spicy close slaw that is the bomb as well.  The fries are not my thing as they are the thin cut ones.  They have several sauces that are good as well.  My favorite being the habenero one.  They are a little pricey for what you get and that's what kept them from getting 5 stars from me.

My favorite place to eat in Downtown Summerlin because the food is always great and the price is very reasonable.  

The breading they use on the chicken is incredible and the meat has never been dried out.  The fries are skinny and crunchy, they give you a lot but I always eat them all.  They have sauces on all the tables and I recommend trying them all, my favorite is the chipotle honey.

They also have the best drink fountain, all sodas have the superior cane sugar and lots of flavors from classic to lime.  the drink selection is probably my favorite thing about the place.

The staff is also amazing.  They are patient and go the extra mile to make sure you get exactly what you want.  I love it when you know the staff loves their jobs.
#chickfila please come and save #lasvegas . The food looked better than it tasted . Just a personal opinion . Clean cool store
It wasn't anything special. My kids had never had fried chicken so we went there on national fried chicken day. It was soggy. I always imagine fried chicken crispy.

This place was extremely good. The monthly special gives enough variety to the menu. The drinks had a great taste to them and there was a difference you could feel compared to typical sodas. The chicken was moist and was extremely flavorful. The loaded fries were great. It was like eating a baked potato out of fries. The slaw was vinegar based and came in a little cup on the side. The honey sauces were great and gave a lot of variety with the sweetness and different flavors. While it was a bit pricey, this is something that you could treat yourself to at least once a month. The staff was friendly and were willing to give advice to first timers. If you are around Summerlin you should stop by and give this place a try!
I thought it was a great sandwich for the price. To be fair I got the naked sandwich which is the only grilled chicken on the menu. I'd for sure come back here!

Not impressed with this place. I've always been excited to try here because it smells so good passing by. I was disappointed that the fragrance didn't match the flavor.  The skin was nice and crispy,  and the meat was juicy,  but flavorless. The honey sauces were different, but didn't really add much flavor either. The shoestring fries were my favorite part of the meal, but they were nothing special.
Fried chicken is amazing!! Best place to cure the fried chicken craving if you want something more than churches or Popeyes. Don't let the $8 lunch fool you, it's a lot of a food!!

Blue Ribbon gets 3 stars for the cleanliness of the restaurant, the amazing customer service and because they serve beer . 

I was greeted with a smile upon entry into the restaurant and I was able to take as much time as I needed to look over the menu. There are a lot of food options so it may take a first timer a while  I decide.

The restaurant fell short with the taste of the food. One there was entirely too much seasoning on my chicken and fries. I also ordered the works fries and they were yuck. I should have just ate the regular fries that came with the chicken strip meal. 

I love all the sauces at the table but why should a customer have to add them to your meal to make the food taste good. 

Honestly, I would rather eat at shake shack, or Canes than come back to BRFC.

Soooo I've been wanting to try this place for awhile now. You know me and fried chicken/French fries. There was no better opportunity then when I was shopping at Downtown Summerlin with my family. We walked in and I thought it would be packed at 11:45 am. There was no one there and I wasn't sure if it was even opened until I tried the door. I decided to try the tenders with the loaded fries. One star for their sauces...I think it's a great idea to have a variety of sauces like they do and they have a to go station where people can take sauces home in small containers. Another star for their service. I had my two kids and they brought out everything to me and even asked me if I wanted ranch. Another star for the food being just ok. The tenders were not tasty at all without the sauces and even then it was a bit bland. The tenders were seasoned unevenly and my tot wouldn't even eat it. However, the fries were good. I actually liked the regular fries over the loaded fries surprisingly. I definitely want to try a sandwich and see what happens next time.
Ah-maze-ing! I cannot wait until next November to have the sandwich of the month. It's was Thanksgiving in a sandwich. I LOVED it. I wish there was more locations. Closer to me too.

Not bad. Not bad at all. Got the 2 piece dark combo (approx $10). Chicken had good crisp, good flavor all around. I am a fan of chipotle honey sauce and I drenched it all over and I feel like it improved the taste.  Wasabi honey wasn't for me.  I would come here again especially if I was with someone that's never had it and I happened to be in the area. Would I seek it out when I'm at home? Probably not. Overall decent chicken, check it out if you've never been.
I ordered beak to butt and I was surprised for the big serving  but at the same time was happy. They are delicious still! Next time probably try their sandwich

AMAZING. so delicious, I still can't believe the size of the chicken wings. The service was perfect as well, our waiter checked in frequently to ensure customer satisfaction. Also, they don't use peanut oil, they use soy! I really appreciated that due to allergies.

First time here and will be returning. Everyone was so friendly and willing to make sure you had a great experience. I ordered the wing man. 2 whole wings served with fries and cole slaw. I substituted for spicy cole slaw. The chicken was so delicious, the oil they fry in is clean so it didn't taste like greasy chicken. It has a seasoning on the outside and seems like it would be salty but it wasn't at all. The fries and chicken both stayed crispy throughout the meal. The spicy cole slaw was actually spicy, I loved it. The bf ordered the 2 piece dark and instead of cole slaw got the pickles. The pickles were so fresh I highly recommend them, goes well with the chicken. The fountain sodas seemed like it was made in house, I tried the cola and I also had the unsweetened tea, both very good. They have a few draught beers too.

This place had major stars a while back when it first opened, and it's gone down over time. I walked in here after eating at shake shack, saving room to give it a shot. 

2 chicken strips combo- 2 stars. It came with coleslaw which you can get as a spicy version. The chicken was soggy, not crispy at all, and had too much Cajun or some type of dry rub flavor that didn't taste good. The best part of this dish were the frozen shoestring fries. 

Hush puppies- 1 star. Can I give zero? it was the worst hush puppies I've tasted to date. There was nothing good going on with the flavors. 

As I mentioned, the best part of the meal were the shoe-string fries, which is the only non-restaurant-made item. The sauce that came with the chicken strip was really good, but all the honey sauces that are available at the table were okay. 

Cool soda fountain and trash cans. One star for that.

2 stars for good food, it was alright I guess if you're a slow eater like I am the breading around the chicken will get soggy lol.  This place is way over priced. I agree with it being similar to a pricier raising canes. Cool things are the trash cans and those loaded fries are pretty good.

I've been always wanting to try this place! Finally did, and didn't know what to get at first.. I ended up getting a chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries and my boyfriend got the chicken tenders with Mac n Cheese. The reason I gave it a 4 and not a 3 star is that they have the different types of flavored honey, sooo good with the chicken! My boyfriend did like it with out without honey. The wildflower and the chipotle honey were my favorite! 
As you'll see in my pics, my sweet potato fries were too dry and over cooked.

Wow! $16.75 for a three chicken tender lunch and a soda???  The tenders were tasty, tender and juicy and the service / staff were absolutely spectacular cruising the dining area and checking in.  I don't mind pricey lunches but I have to say this meal was about $4-$5 over priced especially for a counter service joint.  The same meal at BJs with four tenders is about $12 max.  Too bad for their hard working staff and customers.
Today was first visit and the chicken was beyond belief. Best ever and fresh chicken. The service was good and the place clean.

If you are a fan of cheap, sitting under the heat lamp fast food chicken...you are out of luck. Quality and flavor are top notch and that comes with a price. If your deal is quantity over quality, try KFC or one of the other bargain fast food joints.The chicken tenders are very flavorful, moist and made to order. Not sure what the seasoning is but the flavor is great. The sauces are unique and flavorful. Thin type French fries and cole slaw that isn't buried in sauce or mayo. I'll be back. Wonderful food and location.

Cool place, average food, below average value. 

Original Blue Ribbon sandwich: 4 stars. This is a good sandwich. It won't change your life, but it's delicious. 

Fire Chicken: 3 Stars. Similar to the original with some spicy, chipotle notes.  Not particularly good. 

Regular fries: 3 stars. Shoestring, salty, kinda not great. Pass

Sweet Potato Fries: 4 stars. These are a tasty side. Perfect size, nicely cooked, we'll seasoned. A winner. 

Value: 2 stars. Across the street is a great joint from the east coast. For my money, I'd much rather go there.

This place was straight trash. Horrible service expensive chicken. Smallest chicken pieces I've seen in my life.and will screw up your order and not even care afterwards. I will not be returning to this FN place again
For some reason the chicken here was NOT like what I've had at Blue Ribbon the restaurant. Crazy expensive and underwhelming. This is my first negative review on Yelp.

This restaurant really hit the spot for my fried chicken craving after a trip to Red Rock. 

The menu has two main options, chicken combinations and chicken sandwiches. Then there are sides, shakes, beer, wine, and sodas. We were all in the mood for chicken sandwiches and immediately narrowed in on that section of the menu. Oddly missing from the sandwich options was anything with a Buffalo breading. They do offer a variety of sauces to create your own spicy sandwich though.

I had the Cheesy Supreme Chicken Sandwich and a side of Corn & Bacon. The sandwich was very tasty. I really liked the flavor of the seasoning used in the breading on the chicken. The flavors all seemed fresh. The BR special sauce has a nice flavor that went well with the chicken. The sandwich held together nicely so I was able to enjoy it without a mess. The Corn & Bacon was as described, nothing special. I tried my husband's mashed potatoes and didn't enjoy this at all as they didn't seem freshly made to me. I also snagged French Fries from my brother and found these to be quite delicious. Each table had a variety of sauces that could be used to customize the flavor of your chicken.

The line to order took a minute and it took longer than expected for our food to arrive. I did like that food is delivered to the table instead of making people wait by the counter for food. The dining room was clean and employees were constantly coming around to help clear trash. It also seems like the restaurant cares about the environment and invests in compostable packaging for food and drink.

My cardiologist advised me not to eat here so much in a week. I told him to give me a prescription so that I can. Half a dose of Lipitor later, life's never better! At least with medication, I feel less guilty about loving this place so much!

This place is quite a drive from the Strip! It's located in the Red Rock Shopping Center with a variety of things to do before and/or after. I ordered the 2 piece chicken wings which came with crisp, thin and perfectly seasoned fries and coleslaw. The chicken was nicely seasoned with a mild Cajun seasoning! There wasn't anything special about the coleslaw; the star of the show was definitely the chicken! 

My only complaint was that they didn't allow me to substitute any of the sides.
Really great fried chicken. You can buy by the piece or in a combo. Tenders are not bad. Great variety of sauces.

YUCK. Honestly with worst chicken I've ever eaten.  Had absolutely NO taste.  What in the world is that breading supposed to be on the chicken strips?  Who charges $10 for three chicken strips?  Shake was more expensive than some locations on the Strip.   Expensive and tasteless.

Had afternoon lunch with the family. Ordered the classic chicken sandwiches with fries and soda. I agree with my son when he said it was the best chicken sandwich he's ever had. Nice size, nicely seasoned, very filling sandwiches. Fries are thin and crispy. They have a good variety of house brand sodas, my favorite was the black cherry coke. Very clean and cool establishment. Would definitely recommend to friends and family.

Blue Ribbon Chicken, Ordered their two piece thigh meal, with a soda,  first impression $14.59 is expensive,   Then I got two of the largest boneless thighs I have ever seen with copious amounts of fries.  Second impression,  it's a good value   One of these thighs may have more meet than 4 bone in thighs at other joints 
Quality food starts with quality meat, they got it.  
This is a thumbs up

Simple things like asking for hot peppers on the side. Being charged for them. And finding them all over your sandwich and none on the side ruined our meal here. The employees didn't care at all. What a joke. The corn is over priced for what it is. No flavor and small portion for $8 with rubbery cheap bacon mixed in. Awful just AWFUL.

As stated in the other reviews, BRFC has great service and is a casual comfortable dining area. The food is decent, but not worth the trip from Silverado Ranch. The fried chicken was decent at best. Chicken was bland, sauces were too sweet...or right in to hot. Breading was either too thick or fatty, if that make sense. The tenders were really good as were the fries with gravy!

Biggest set back was the pricing. Although it's a fast food style, be ready to spend full-service prices.

I had heard that Blue Ribbon had a Chicken Parmigiana sandwich reminiscent of Burger King's chicken sandwich that they served back in the 90's. It turns out that this is a special that is only being served during the month of September so I'm glad I came here on time. I started with the loaded shoe string fries that had cheese and bits of bacon on top. I dipped it in ranch sauce because it was a little salty but it tasted good.
My sandwich was pretty big and messy. There was a slice of melted cheese and sauce under the bun so I ate it with a fork and knife. I ate most of it except for the bread with their specialty honey selection. The Honey Wasabi had a little bit of kick to it but if you want something more spicy I would go with the Chipotle Honey. In the future I would just order the chicken because I don't like eating messy foods. I would come back because their cole slaw was surprisingly good! ( I typically don't like cole slaw) and their cola made from cane sugar tasted like vanilla. ( It's the little things ).

I feel like this restaurant concept has the potential to be epic. Who doesn't love a fried chicken sandwich? Unfortunately, every time I've been here I'm disappointed. The food is just OK. Not bad...just not great.

On my most recent visit we tried the Gobbler which is their special sandwich for Thanksgiving. Fried chicken, mashed potatoes, stuffing, and cranberry sauce. Every single component of this sandwich was from a can or a box. Not one single bit was from scratch. Canned cranberry sauce, potatoes from a box, and Stove Top stuffing. Don't get me wrong, Stove Top stuffing has a time and a place, but when I pay $15 for a sandwich with fries this is not that time or place.

There are places that serve a much better chicken sandwich for the same or less money, like Bruxie on the Strip. And, there are too many dining options in Downtown Summerlin that are great, for you to waste good money here.

I had the firebird chicken sandwich, it was good, not great, but pretty tasty.  It is a crispy chicken sandwich with lettuce, tomato, pickled cucumbers, pickled peppers, and chipotle mayo. I didn't 'cheese it up' for an additional dollar, but maybe I should have. The toppings  were actually the best part of the sandwich. The cucumbers and peppers were very good, and added a nice tangy crunch. 
I have a favorite chicken sandwich spot across town (chick - something or other) that unfortunately to me Blue Ribbon didn't measure up to. Maybe next time I will just order their regular chicken dinner. 
Anyway, if you are in Downtown Summerlin it is worth stopping in and checking out for yourself.
Blue ribbon is wonderful. It's quick, affordable, with great service. The chicken tenders were moist and well seasoned! Their sauces are also all amazing! I highly reccomend this place.

This is seriously the most disgusting fried chicken I have ever eaten.  The only thing I could taste was grease. You want to take off that horrid crust or wring it out, but even that would not help the taste...it just looks and smells like old grease.  

My entire group of 6 concurred that the outer layer was inedible...if you order chicken wings, the entire thing is like a mouth full of crunchy grease, you can feel the grease squirt in your mouth with every bite.   

The barbecue chicken sandwiches are slightly better, but there is no spice to the sauce and  it's too sweet.  

The atmosphere is nice enough for this type of place. They offer self serve drinks, but the root beer was not working.

They could have had dancing clowns and french waiters and my review would not change because: The bottom line is that every restaurant is about the quality of the food and we all left here wishing we could go back in time and choose somewhere else. We threw away some of it, it was just that bad and it has to be an assault on your health.

Very unique tasting fried chicken. Not bad for the price but I always get a chicken breast so I can have more white meat. Their seasoning is flavorful and meat ratio is not too bad. They have a lot of sides you can choose from but I went with the mashed potatoes and pickled cucumbers (delicious sweet and sour). The best thing is the soda machine since all their soda is made with cane sugar. You feel a lot healthier drinking them than regular sodas. Overall, this place is decent.

Pros

1. There are so many choices for sauces when it comes to dipping your chicken tenders! I would definitely recommend the barbecue honey and the ranch!

2. Their fries are skinny cut, but not too skinny. And they achieve the perfect crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.

3. Even their plain fries have yummy flavor all on their own and are seasoned very well.

4. But why would you get the fries plain when you can get them loaded?! Loaded with cheddar cheese, sour cream and bacon! So amazing! You gotta get it!

5. The chicken is moist and tender.

6. Awesome sodas at the fountain! I would strongly recommend the black cherry or the ginger ale. 

Cons

1. I was too full from everything else to try the sweet potato fries. Fail. I must return soon.
I'm so torn because the sandwich I got here was the shizzzz!! Blew Cane's chicken out of the water...but the fries didn't come close to Cane's. Way to salty. Ugh life is so confusing.

TL;DR version: good restaurant with nothing particularly amazing. 

Longer version: This is a pretty good restaurant. I liked it and I thought the food was good, but I am not sure I'd be dying to go back. It's not that anything was poorly made or tasted bad or was too expensive or something --- no, it was all about right, it was just a bit bland. I mean, the chicken was good and the sauces were good, but not where I am dying to return. That said, they do serve the food pretty quick. I like that about it because if you're in a hurry, speed is super important.

I'll start out with that your in DTS, so your gonna pay a little more than usual. This place is worth it though. The chicken was excellent. It did not taste like pre-made frozen chicken strips. This chicken tasted like they just breaded it and dropped it in the fryer. The chicken wings were also very good. There is a variety of different sauces and honey available on the tables. The only thing I did not care for was the fresh garlic in the hot sauce. I love garlic, but not in my hot sauce.

You definitely have to stop by and give this place a try. Good food!!

The service buoyed my rating to a three as everyone was very friendly and helpful. Food though was just so so. The breading is the same for all the chicken with lots of paprika, chili, and others spices EXCEPT salt. The breading itself is not super crispy which in by book is a minus. The slaw was a bit dry. I did think the fries were good though. They are a shoestring cut. 

The price totaled over $32 for lunch which was fairly pricey however the potions were huge and we could have gotten by with sharing one meal which would have made it reasonable. 

I agree with others, Raising Canes is much better.

This place is really pricy for the amount of food you get. Got the two piece thigh combo which includes fries and cole slaw, extra drink, and a large side of mashed potato. Total came out to be more than $20. I find it odd that a combo does not come with a drink. They also make their own soda but I thought they all tasted weird. The "large" mashed potato was actually really small and cost $6.75!! The two pieces of chicken were small and dry and the seasoning tasted really weird again. I tried to eat it with some of their sauces but that did not help. Fries were really good though. For $20 you can practically feed a family of four at Church's or Popeye's with better tasting chickens. Not worth.

(1 star is for the fries)

De-licious! Delicious! Delicious! DELICIOUS! My friend introduced me to this spot a few months ago and I've been hooked. The chicken is juicy, tender and had so much flavor. Pair it with the BBQ sauce and I. Am. In. Love. I'm not a big chicken sandwich person, but I will be here! Lol. The only thing not as amazing as everything else is the price. Seems a little bit more expensive for chicken, but the quality seems better than fast food places and the flavor is definitely better than fast food places. 

Will be a returning customer so I can try everything on the menu a few times!

This place is good. I like the different choices of sauces (my fave wasabi honey, but they're all good) AND their fountain drinks. CREAMSODA!!!! OK, not drinks but drink. A bit pricey 2 tenders with fries and cole slaw 9.95.  I prefer the chicken tenders over the wings. I don't like to get my face and fingers dirty in public.  The chicken is juicy and the breading is tasty.  They serve alcohol and wine, but not a wide variety but they've got it.

The chicken tender in the "Kid-O meal" was delicious and juicy so 5 stars for that. The cheesy supreme sandwich however was sub-par (in my honest opinion). I did take the meal to-go so maybe it just doesn't travel well... Would have preferred the chicken more crispy and the bun just wasn't for me. The skinny fries also left something to be desired (maybe I am biased because I love steak fries?? and again it was take-out so we all know how fried items lose their umph during travel). I did use the Postmates service and got my food in a timely manner. Good pricing for what you get. I would definitely give the place a shot again but eat in the restaurant to make a clear judgement.

Blue Ribbon chicken brings downtown New York City to Downtown Summerlin. In the northernmost reaches of downtown Summerlin, this infamous downtown New York City restaurant opened its first location West of the Hudson River. 

   After a day of hiking in the rural Desert Wildlife Refuge it was time to hit up downtown Summerlin for my post-hike supper. It was also time to erase another mental bookmark. 

   Just like any downtown, parking can be inconvenient in a faux downtown. When I patronize downtown Summerlin, I usually park by Macy's. After hours hiking up in the Refuge, I partook in another hike to reach Blue Ribbon chicken. If you are in a hurry or tired, this is not a place I would recommend. 

   When I walked into Blue Ribbon, it was relatively busy. The window menu expedited the ordering process. At the counter, I exchanged $13.78 for a two piece white breast and thigh that included fries and cole slaw. After the transaction, the young guy handed me a buzzer that would buzz when my food was ready. Immediately he presented me with a plastic cup to fill up my beverage. Blue Ribbon stands out from the competition by featuring Boylan soda fountain beverage. Boylan is a New York based soda company known for using cane sugar in lieu of high fructose corn syrup. During the course of the post hike dinner, I'd savour the creme and black cherry soda. Say if I didn't have a sweet tooth and wanted a post hike beer with dinner? If that were the case, I could of ordered from a few choices of draft beer including PBR, and Fat Tire. By the time I was half done with the Black cherry soda, the buzzer went off. When the buzzer vibrated with the flashing red lights, there was zero need to leave my booth. A staff member delivered the food. 

   How would I compare this fried chicken to the typical fried chicken place? Technically I couldn't on account of the fact that it is a uniquely prepared fried chicken. Blue Ribbon chicken is made from a special recipe where the cook dips it in egg whites, coated with matzo meal and fried. The downtown Summerlin location adds a twist to the recipe with the following additional seasonings: dried parsley, basil, thyme, garlic, cayenne, paprika, and salt. The upshot was that my nose and taste buds were on the same page. Both of these organs took in a flavorful seasoned chicken breast and thigh. My taste buds communicated with my brain that the skin was better tasting than the white meat. Say if the chicken was plain tasting. If that was the case, on my table were a variety of sauces. The sauces on my table and every table were habanero hot, wasabi honey, barbecue, and chipotle honey. Between bites of the chicken, I'd devour the fries. Just like many of my chicken dinners, I saved the Cole slaw for last. 

    The chicken meat on my table wasn't the only white that stood out. The restaurant interior incorporated  bright white walls interspersed with plate glass windows overlooking the streetscapes of downtown Summerlin. The primary furnishings were the brown tables and the multitude HD TVs that were playing professional sports. The Boylan fountain also stands out as a shout out that Blue Ribbon is New York made. 

   Blue Ribbon served as an appropriate post-hike dinner. I wouldn't hike out of my way to eat in Blue Ribbon. The price is slightly high for fried chicken, that regardless of recipe is nothing extraordinary tasting. In conclusion, I settle on the opinion that Blue Ribbon is a good restaurant that is a nice addition to downtown Summerlin.

The fried chicken is delicious. The breading is relatively light while achieving a maximum crispy exterior. It's also seasoned really well with tasty spices allowing the chicken to be eaten without the necessity of sauces. I've tried all of the pieces of the bird: breast, whole wing, thigh (bone-in or boneless), and drumstick, plus tenders. The white meat (breast and tenders) has the tendency to be a tad dry, but the other pieces are really moist and juicy. The boneless thigh is a favorite since you get a lot of meat and it's easy to eat. The chicken can be purchased by the piece ($1.99-$4.95), combo meals served with fries and coleslaw ($6.75-$15.50), family style ($33.95-$41.50), or party platters (starting at $140).

I'm equally in awe of their sauces and the variety. BRBBQ, Wildflower Honey, Wasabi Honey, Chipotle Honey, and Habanero Hot Sauce. My favorite combination is their hot sauce and the wildflower honey; yum! 

The sides are decent. I really like the Pickled Cucumbers, Hush Puppies, and Mashed Potatoes with Gravy. They used to have Collard Greens that I enjoyed, but it's been removed off the menu recently. I haven't tried either salads or the Spicy Slaw. The fries aren't my favorite, but still tasty. The Fries With The Works ($6.50/$12.50) is heavily loaded with aged cheddar, bacon, and sour cream; good stuff. I added some gravy and it was amazing (too bad that isn't an option on the menu, but I'm sure you can ask for gravy with your "works").

I've only had one of their sandwiches, The Blue Bird (blue cheese, red onion, and smoked bacon), which is unique to the Las Vegas location. A good sandwich, but mine was heavy on blue cheese and it overwhelmed the sandwich. I definitely want to try the original sandwich to compare it to other chicken sandwiches in town.

I love that they have Boylan's Fountain Soda. A soda company from New York that was previously offered via bottle only can now be found at BRFC. I love their Ginger Ale and Black Cherry sodas! ($2.50 unlimited refills)

They have three beers (Maui Brewing Co. Mana Wheat, PBR, and Basin Brewing Co. Icky IPA) on tap and red, white, and sparkling wines on tap.

Nutella Milkshake ($4.95): SO GOOD. Thick, tasty, and not too sweet.

So this isn't your KFC, Popeyes, or Church's chicken. BUT it's pretty dang good. 

Yes, it's a little bit more expensive. Yes, their French fries are skinny, crispy, and delicious and no, the chicken isn't dry or tasteless. 

I've had a drumstick and thigh which were actually really good since it was fresh.
Today, I had the Blue Ribbon sandwich and it was great, but, I thought it was a little dry and could go for more of that sauce. I also probably should've asked for more so that is also my own fault. But seriously, the sauce is like a thousand island type of deal but really pulls the sandwich together. 

The loaded fries were great and reminded me of toppings on a baked potato. Bomb but heavy. Hush puppies were also pretty good - crispy & corny 

The pickles they use/make were really good and I don't even like pickles. 

So basically, get dark meat for fried chicken, fries are bomb if you love them skinny & crispy. Lastly, if you get a chicken sandwich - get extra sauce.

I'm
Shocked at the reviews- this chicken was SOO GOOD and the location was just as great. It's a clean, open space that's very pretty inside. Their staff was extremely helpful with ordering, preparing and delivering. They even had someone help us clean up! It wasn't what I expected, it was better than expected. I tried the black and blue burger for January and it was BOMB DOT COM. Can't wait to go back for the February love bird sand which!

Tried for first time on Monday, Chicken was excellent but insanely overpriced, probably to pay for snob appeal of being in Summerlin, enclave of the yuppie nouveau riche. C'mon  4 bucks a thigh? and gut basket of necks and backs, $8 WTF! Despite all that my wife loved it and I drove all the way again from Henderson and got a blue ribbon, half a chicken, liver and onions....$40 for that what was I thinkin'??? Anyway that order was bland and KFC had more flavor and livers were bland! How do you get bland livers!?!?!?!? I called the mgr. and She said she didn't know and could be a different batch of seasoning and said she would call me back but never did with her "Oh well" attitude. So glad there is Popeyes' , Churches and KFC that I don't have to decide  to either buy chicken or make a house payment  Between the  insane prices and inconsistent flavor quality, I should have gotten a side of Astroglide $10 for 2 drumsticks!?!?!? $8 for 2 wings!?!?!? I can only guess I ate a Cosby pudding cup before I went there and ordered.
Extra star is for decor. Mediocore taste in chicken. Ok tasting fries, overpriced overall due to location. No soap in restroom, also not spotless clean. Average tasting soda
Chicken wing and thigh is very tasty and juicy, very crispy.  We like chipotle honey and wasabi honey sauce.  I m not a big fan for fried stuff but really enjoy the fries and fried chicken.
Overpriced, tasteless food! It seems like all reviews are fake. Eg: five-star review with the phrase, "always cooked to perfection?!" Mediocre about covers it.

This place gets 5 stars for each category.  5 stars for food, 5 stars for ambiance, 5 stars for customer service. This place rocks. 

Walk in to a bright, clean, inviting area.  We place our order with a very nice, young guy (the one with the long hair), he was very polite and paid attention to us while we were ordering.  

We go and sit down in the spacious eating area.  Every table has bottles of different sauces, you can use.  I fell in love with the Honey Wasabi.  Who would have thought they go together, huh!  

The food is brought over to the table by another nice young guy.  The food is huge portions and delicious.  Not one thing we ordered was bad.  FYI:  The pickled peppers are smokin' hot.... I would definitely come back and order another Blue cheese sandwich.  I also want to try the BBQ sauce sandwich.  

After we ate we went back up to the counter to order a dark chocolate shake.  A different young guy was at the counter, and he was just as polite as the other 2.  It is very rare to find younger crowd of guys all in one establishment that offer good customer service. 

The dark chocolate shake tastes like the fudge Popsicle's you buy at the grocery store.  They are really, really good, and I recommend this flavor. 

Another hint they have Pabst on draft for $1.00.....

What a treat. My first visit here abd I'm thrilled with the food AND the service. 
Mike was AWESOME explained all the sauces,  options, etc

FSNTASTIC

Meh....I liked that the tenders I had received were decent in size but it lacked in flavor. My boyfriend also said that the chicken he got was too oily to enjoy. It didn't look that way but I guess looks can really be deceiving! The sauces were okay the real winner in my opinion was the BBQ which is pretty universal if you ask me. Can't ever go wrong there lol 

Honestly the strawberry shake is what bumped this review up a star!

Their chicken sandwich photographs so well. It's too bad it doesn't taste as good as it looks.

Chicken was chewy and dry and even the bun was dry and old....

I only ate half and threw the rest away.

Their BBQ sauce tasted good. I liked their honey tea too.

Great chicken - amazingly crispy but not greasy!

Great chicken - amazingly crispy but not greasy!

Let me start by saying  I got AMAZING service from beginning to end at this location.It is set up in a fast food sense where you order at the counter . The lady helping us order was named Ronita. I was having a hard time deciding on what sides I wanted to try out and she was super friendly and did her best to advise me on what to try. I sadly am not a fan of mashed potatoes but she said those were her fav!.. I decided to go with a leg and thigh with a side of Corn & Bacon, my Mom ordered a chicken Sandwhich with fries ... The way its set up you get food delivered to your table... Be sure to remember some cash to leave a tip if you get the quality of service like I did. My drinks were filled any time they got low  and table cleared off  the whole time by an awesome dude named Sam.  After reading the reviews of this place I was not expecting to be blown away which might be why I was pleasantly surprised but I really did have an enjoyable experience here. I tried this place at lunch time on a Friday with my Mother. I opted to skip out on the soda offerings because as much as I am not picky concerning my chicken.. I am very picking when it comes to spending 2.50 a soda and cane sugar machine is awesome but had potential to be a toss up.. Next time I may give it a shot to see if I enjoy any of it. As you may have read in prior reviews they do put a seasoning on their chicken. It has a bit of a kick but for me it was the right balance of spice without being over powering. The chicken was cooked perfectly and I love the fact they offer HONEY  and hot sauce. The french fries weren't something I was in love with but they had a nice enough taste. I loved the Corn with Bacon it was delicious and helped balance out my meal. The sandwich that came with my Mothers meal was HUGE she couldn't eat all of it so I was able to take a bite and the Bun was really yummy and the pickled cucumbers helped give it an extra kick. I really loved this place. I know the price point isn't that great considering but if you are like me and love fried chicken and get sick of the quality offered by any of the fast food chains this place is worth the extra money. Just keep in mind you may get a better deal if you go ala carte. For us it was a little over $20 for my two pieces of chicken and small side plus my Mom's sandwich meal. We opted as stated to just go with water but they still were great about keeping that full and they offer wipes for your hands . I was BLOWN away by how attentive Sam was making sure we had everything we needed , not to mention making sure we were enjoying our food and had enough water. He was friendly and managing at least 6 other tables which all appeared to be taken care of. I can't wait to come back and try more things but if you keep in mind the location of this place and most things come at a higher price point for food its worth checking out. The quality of the food was all amazing and for me it was great service. I will wait till I try it this place out again to go full five stars but I could not let the great experience go undocumented. I love Fried Chicken and so far this is one of my favorite places in the Vegas area to get my fix without a MSG headache following..

Well I use to love this place. But I think they might be going out of business.. it must be a Sign in every wing place. If the wings start out huge and now get super small. They are going down hill.. I normally get a 4 piece and had to eat it in 2 days. So I get a 2 pc and folks the wings are so small now. My thumb is bigger I was disappointed I spent 15 bucks.

First meal of the day. First time here. 
Omg. 
The fries are amazing and the chicken is superb! 
Omg. Great experience

I work in Downtown Summerlin & have passed this place more than a few times so I decided to try it out. I got The Pit combo. Fried chicken sandwich with cheddar, bacon, & bbq sauce with fries & coleslaw. The sandwich was really good! The chicken was moist & flavorful. Good bun & crisp veggies. The shoestring fries were nice & salty. The coleslaw was the only thing I didn't care for. Incredibly bland, but you only get a little portion of it anyways. I'll definitely be back again!
Great, tasty, crispy chicken strips. Plenty of sauces to choose from. Excellent location, plenty of parking, clean place & excellent service.

Not sure what the bad reviews are about. I'm here on a Monday afternoon for lunch and had a great experience. The staff is super friendly, the prices are cheap, it was really clean when I went. The chicken is good but better with the wildflower honey and the shoe string fries were hot and fresh. I  like that they have a cane sugar soda fountain! The black cherry is tasty!
4 cutie wings for $10.95 for me is not worth it but i can't say anything bad about the seasoning of the chicken it's good. What I really enjoyed the most the root beer!

Best fried chicken I've ever had! I like my skin crispy and theirs was super! My mom says it reminds her of chicharone. It was well seasoned and very flavorful. My wife and I both agree that it tastes similar to the Mexican seasoning Taijin. As long as I eat it fresh out the fryer, I don't even need the sauces that they have, which there are a few intersting ones to choose from, all honey based. My favorite one is not honey based (I believe) and it's the habenero. I got the 2 boneless thighs and it came with so much fries that I still have left overs from Saturday. They were skinny and seasoned just right. The soda fountain wasn't typical. They had flavors like black cherry and cream soda. Reminds me of my younger days. It wasn't  the normal sit-down, but the attendant there gave excellent service. He already knew what we needed, sometimes even before we knew it, lol! As long as this place is consistent and  with no more incidents like on the picture of another yelper  here, then I would highly recommend this place and stay a loyal patron.

In case you didnt notice the trend of my restaurant reviews, im in the middle of a fried chicken thing. 

I mean, you have the meal of a lifetime at Roscoes in L.A. and and left thinking about memories of how damn good it was. 

So we decide to sample the chicken here. No waffles and syrup here so i opt for the "March chicken Madness" So glad i did. This sandwich rocked it! 

Below are pics of the sandwich topped off with what else?  A basketball! The skinny fries came out hot and seasoned perfect. The side of slaw is so small, it hardly got noticed. About 3 bites worth.

 You order the food and they bring it to your table. I really do not care for their home made sodas.... way too sweet. 

The prices are on the steep side but its Downtown Summerlin so what else would you expect? $27 bucks for 2 people. The mac n cheese was good.

Wow! This place is so damn good! I love the fried chicken & fries. Too bad it is so far from home. Great customer service, friendly staff, mellow/chill environment. Haven't had any issues with this place.

Let me start off by saying the staff here seemed very nice and the actual place itself is well designed. Also, I understand they just opened but this wasn't really a quality issue as much as a quantity issue. However, the food or should I say the lack there of, was actually quite insulting. Charging $8+ for a small chicken finger on a bun and trying to pass it off as a chicken sandwich is downright criminal. Worse? How about $7 for a large fries. Yup... $7 for fries with no toppings or anything. Just fries. Plain fries. $7. For a portion size no bigger than you get in a large fries at McDonalds. Back to the sandwich... ordered "The Rancher" which states bacon & ranch dressing. Received "0" bacon. Also had asked for no cucumbers but they were on there. This is OK actually as I mentioned they just opened and these are kinks that need to work out... I'm OK with that. Not part of why I gave two stars... it only added to the frustration of the portion sizes and pricing.

The taste was pretty good... enjoyed the fries more than the sandwich but that also may have been out of pure anger with the size of the sandwich. Actually enjoyed the sauce options that I tried as well. The Chipolte Honey had a nice kick. 

Maybe I was over-hyped for this place? I see some folks enjoyed their meals. I felt robbed and won't be back until they fix the portion sizes. I have never been still hungry after an $8+ sandwich and fries. Wish them luck and hope they can fix these issues. They are in a great spot but will get smoked by Shake Shack opening up across the street if they do not fix some things and fix them soon.

I really really liked the seasoning on my chicken, and I do plan on coming back to give it a second chance.

Reasons why it needed a second chance:
The sweet honey iced tea wasn't sweet
They ran out of mashed potatoes and gravy
They ran out of Mac and Cheese
...it was like 12 noon on a Saturday

I was a bit worried that this place was gonna be over hyped but.. it did not disappoint. Whenever you're craving some chicken I would like to recommend this spot. Located in Summerlin downtown right across from shake shack, blue ribbon offers not only great chicken but spacious restaurant with beautiful view of the outside overlooking the parking lot and the downtown. I think I would be a good spot for a quick fun causal dinner out before a movie or something.

Food: I personally tried the firebird sandwich and with additional $2 they throw in fries and a side of cold slaw. The sandwich in itself was pretty solid with juicy chicken. Their fries are those thin fries just an FYI. Although their chicken sandwich was great, their chicken really stole the show. I recommend their tenders and the wing! If it's your first time, they give a free fountain drink. 

Restaurant: They had servers always making sure the restaurant was neat and clean overall which was great to see.

Having a hard time loving this place, been here three times and still can't make this a go to place for fried chicken since my son loves his chicken strips. The problem is with the spice that they have on their batter (too much for my taste), some people may like it, but I don't really care for it. The last time we were here we had the chicken burger with blue cheese dressing, chicken wings lunch pack, tender supreme (3 strips with fries) and milkshakes. The shakes were definitely too sweet and it came in a pretty small size. I really like their french fries and the nice clean environment, the service was also very good and accommodating. Lunch for the three of us came to over $50+.

Went for lunch with friends on Sunday and turned out to be a terrible choice.  This place is overpriced and has terrible chicken.  The fries are really good but that is the only item that is decent.  Chicken was overcooked and had too much spice on the coating.  I asked the counter person if the chicken was fresh cooked ( I noticed a bunch in the slide)?  The young lady said yes it was cooked an hour ago.  I asked for fresh cooked chicken but was served semi warm pieces.  Will not return again.  Popeyes is a much better choice and value.

This place is awesome!
Everything ordered was very good. I recommend sharing things here as things can be a tad too greasy after a while.
We ordered the fried chicken liver and onions, hush puppies, the firebird sandwich, and their fries with the words.

What's cool about this place I thought were the different honey sauces they have. There was chipotle, wasabi, and wild flour honey. Each was distinctly good it its own ways

I love these chicken tenders and the great flavor! Great service and friendly staff.

Plenty of space in here for a large group

Winner, winner, chicken dinner! I have read reviews from other Yelpers about Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken. Their wings, iced tea and (sweet potato and regular) french fries hit the spot. I was walking around Downtown Summerlin with my niece and she was craving for fried chicken that day. For big groups/families, I recommend "The Bird" that comes with 2 breasts, 2 thighs, 2 wings, 2 drumsticks and 2 sides of coleslaw and fries.

Had food delivered. Tender meal, 2 piece dark meal, Mac and cheese, corn, hush puppies. The tenders have an undercooked texture and the seasoning was soggy. The fries that came with are soggy. The Mac and cheese is gritty. The hush puppies too salty. Only good thing is the bacon corn but even the bacon appears undercooked. Will not be eating from this business again.

Simple. Easy. Tasty

I ordered the 2 piece chicken tenders, came with fries and coleslaw. 
I added a $1.00 PBR to wash it down. (Cheap beer, super cold)

Chicken was seasoned perfectly and the breading wasn't too thick.
Fries were shoestring style, perfectly crispy and just the right amount amount of salt. If you want to treat yourself get the homemade ranch to dip them in. 

Coleslaw was a cream with a vinaigrette zing, very good. 


Great place, I will be back again. The $1.00 beers are fabulous.

Chicken is freaking DELISH! I've eaten a lot of fried chicken in my time and honestly didn't have my expectation level set all that high - so it was to my BEYOND PLEASANT SURPRISE when we walked in and MIKE greeted us in the most welcoming, friendly, and food bearing way I could have ever wanted to be lured into a new establishment! Our sample was phenomenal, so we took some advice from Mike & ended up with two full trays! 
4 THUMBS UP! 

MIKE MADE THE ENTIRE EXPERIENCE (& the chicken was great too!)

The Mrs. And I decided to try this place last night. She got a Downtown Summerlin gift card for Xmas and what better way to try a new place than on someone else's dime? Anyhoo, here's the breakdown: wife had 2 wing combo, I had whole breast and wing combo, plus one more item I'll get to in a minute. 

Let me start by saying that as chicken joints go, it is somewhat pricier than KFC etc. But you know what? You'll pay more for a burger at 5 guys than Mac's too, and anyone who's been to both will tell you there's no comparison. Which is the case here. This is simply the BEST fried chicken I have ever eaten. Crunchy, well seasoned coating, meat was moist and flavorful. Combos come with HUGE pile o'fries as well as coleslaw (if you can handle spicy, opt for the spicy slaw). Well worth the price, IMO.

Now for that other item. I am a big fan of chicken livers, and you can get an order of fried chicken livers with fried caramelized onions. Not for everyone, but definitely for me. Absolutely amazing! 

In brief, GO! Don't let the prices scare you, it's well worth it.

Recently visited this location this last week and was very impressed with the customer service as well as the food. I had previously visited this location back when it opened and was not impressed, but I figured I'd give it another shot! Upon entering the restaurant I was promptly greeted by Alex. He was very inviting and explained a few options on the menu. I ended up ordering the holiday sandwich, which I might add was amazing good and filling as well! After ordering our food he informed us about where the sauces were and gave us a table number. After the food was delivered and we finished, the manager came around and asked us how everything was and offered to take our trays to the trash. I would give the food 5 stars but I wish I could give the customer service 6 stars! I will defiantly be revisiting this place soon!

My classmate and I usually share when we eat out and ordered the 6 wings combo, which included coleslaw and fries, a Nutella shake, and lemonade. Everything, even the various sauces, go so perfect together. The staff provided exceptional customer service and the place was clean. One thing we didn't like were the bathrooms...it needed some cleaning done. Other than that, we'll be back soon! :)

Items Selected:
Nutella, Vanilla, and Caramel Shakes
Hush Puppies
Smorgasbird - Lettuce, Cucumbers, Tomatoes, Chicken Cutlets, Pineapple Slices, Pickles, Fries, Sour Cream, Cheddar Cheese, Bacon, Sauteed BBQ Chicken, Pickled Peppers
2 Strips, 2 Wings
Adobo Corn
Collards & Bacon

Founded by the Bromberg Brothers and featuring the duo's first foray into the 'burbs, Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken arrived in Downtown Summerlin by way of New York earlier this summer and although the quick casual concept has been questioned for high prices as well as uneven cooking ever since opening it was with a friend and his child that I sat down for lunch on Saturday, almost every off-putting rumor soon confirmed.

Nicely lit and well adorned with amenities including motion sensing trash compactors, LCD televisions, housemade sauces, plus a fountain featuring artisan sodas from Boylan's, a visit to Blue Ribbon begins at a counter with smiling servers - the dining decisions largely sandwiches, combos, and sides with additional options for shakes or salads, plus single tenders, wings, or thighs.

Taking note of a few specials, the August-only "Smorgasbird" with a portion of the proceeds benefiting  Multiple Sclerosis offered in addition to perplexingly priced hush puppies - $3.75 for a half-dozen or $7.95 for ten - it was after some perusal that an order soon completed, the fifteen minute wait with one of those vibrating flashy buzzers spent sitting in one of several unpadded booths.

Certainly not a cheap meal, the total before tax and tip north of $55 for what would prove less than enough to sate a family of four were it not for the three excellent pieces of egg bread wrapped around the charitable sandwich, it was largely a matter of principle that the Smorgasbird was ordered and with two boneless cutlets spiced quite unlike the Bromberg chicken at Blue Ribbon or Brooklyn Bowl suffice it to say that each piece was almost too dry on its own to be enjoyable, the better bites found in barbequed bits serve atop cheesy fries tinged in peppers while anemic looking tomatoes made one question sourcing during the ingredients peak time of year.

Finding the tenders to be as oddly spiced and devoid of moisture as the cutlets while wings at least maintained their texture thanks to the presence of a bone, it was onward to sides that the meal progressed and although the hushpuppies were each quite small the flavors of sweet corn were thankfully prominent, the same not to be said of soft collards barely bolstered by pork let alone the 'adobo corn' which certainly would have benefited greatly from some salt.

At this point seeing the emperor for his lack of clothes while wondering why the duo opts to change their chicken at each venue when the original version is the one that earned them such acclaim, it was in a trio of shakes that the meal concluded and although none were particularly innovative each was clearly crafted of good ice cream, the vanilla trending a bit thin and mellow while the Nutella and caramel were decidedly sweet and thick enough to stick a spoon up straight.

Overpriced and overseasoned with little more than a 'name' to justify the hype Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken joins the likes of most of Downtown Summerlin's imported eateries, a situation that makes one wonder just how long the public will continue to bite.

Ordered the "Firebird" since I like spicey food. It's a sandwich. If you make it a combo it come with fries and coleslaw...Food came pretty fast... They had sauces on the table 5 to choose from. I will be honest the chicken HAS NO FLAVOR...I mean if you have eaten at Raising Canes they have a cane sauce that makes their chicken very flavorful. These guys breaded chicken, their regular chicken just has no flavor at all. Not my kinda place. It's pretty pricey for a sandwich place. 2 of us ate here around $30...

Gave it 3 stars because I wasn't too impressed. The food was pretty good but came out just warm not hot. I mainly wanted to come here to eat the "smorgasbird" a double decker chicken sandwich with basically every topping they have haha.
I got a side of loaded large fries, the staff was really friendly but I just thought the food would be better.

My family and I just ate here, I  must say it was great. Service was great the fried chicken has a great flavor and the crisp is yummy,will definitely be returning. also very nice and clean. Thank you.

This place was great! Food was really good and the service was maybe even better. Food was prepared fresh. Loved the fries and their bbq sauce. Fountain sodas were also really good. The staff was very attentive even though you aren't being waited on at the tables. Portions were pretty decently sized so plenty of leftovers between our two meals. Tried this place on a whim but would definitely go back! Love Downtown Summerlin so always looking for new favorites...this made my list.

I'm glad we gave this place a second shot. We ordered family meal and I couldn't believe my tastebuds! The skin on the fried chicken had such a unique, tangy taste to it. Everything was cooked to perfection and the fries were better even when we got home. Don't forget to go inside and try the "saucy bar!l". Smaller appetite, no worries.. try the wing combo!

During a conversation about fried chicken at work (what can I say? I'm a fried chicken enthusiast), my coworker recommended Blue Ribbon to me. It's on the opposite side of Las Vegas for us, but it was worth the commute. 

Location - It's on the North end of Downtown Summerlin. There's easy parking and entertainment if you want to walk or shop off the calories after lunch or dinner. The restaurant has plenty of seats and lots of natural lights. I love sitting by the window and watching dogs walk by. 

Food - Best fried chicken in Vegas! We ordered the chicken tenders and wings during our first visit. The seasoning gives a little kick to the typical fried chicken dish. The French fries are just the right amount of crispy and there's so, so many different sauces to choose from. We also ordered the Mac n' cheese. It wasn't the most memorable dish compared to the rest but chicken and macaroni and cheese just feels right together. During our second visit we ordered the Firebird sandwich and the Rancher sandwich. The Firebird sandwich was so spicy (just the way I like it, hehe) and my boyfriend seemed to really enjoy his lunch as well. The sandwich is a pretty hefty size and I could only eat about half of it. On top of that, there's special sodas and iced teas. 

Service - The cashier was really nice. He offered his recommendations and made conversation - something that a lot of people falter to do. It progressively got busier as we ate and everyone was still getting helped. 

After eating the best fried chicken of my life when vacationing, fried chicken didn't taste good anymore anywhere else but shout out to Blue Ribbon for being 10/10 and existing in Vegas!

We came here for lunch and the food was pretty decent. The chicken was very well seasoned and very juicy. The coke slaw was tangy and crunchy. The fries were thin and crunchy and not too salty. Just the way I enjoy them. 

If the food was amazing fried chicken, the price also reflects that. For a four piece of breast, thigh, drumsticks and a wing with fries and coleslaw was 17.95. I got the blue ribbon chicken sandwich and it was about 11$. 

While the food was great.. if I'm going to pay 35$ for fried chicken I'd rather go to Buffalo Wild Wings and order for 3-4 servings easily.

I came here a couple weeks ago after work one night before thanksgiving. It was a great little spot. I got the monthly special, the gobbler, I think it was called. It was really good. My wife got a salad and liked that as well. The Nutella shake was awesome. 
The manager came out and got us a little plate of mashed potatoes for our 1 year old son. Super nice people there.

Came by on noon on a Saturday after perusing the farmers market nearby. Had the whole family so got the kids a single tender combo each. Hubs got the bbq pulled chicken, and I got a tender combo as well with a side of hush puppies. I was so excited to eat here and maybe I went wrong in ordering tenders instead of bone in chicken. Or maybe my time living in the Deep South have me impossibly high standards when it comes to fried chicken. But honestly the chickens just ok, especially given the steep prices. One kid devoured the fries and left the chicken while the other did the opposite. My tenders were nice and juicy but the breading wasn't crispy,, albeit it wasn't soggy either. Just no crunch and all the seasons on the breading and kinda lift a powdery peppery coating. Fries were nice and crispy, hot, and well seasoned. Hush puppies came out hot, were moist and had whole pieces of corn in the middle. The coke slaw was dry and I couldn't discern any real dressing or flavor, just cold cabbage. Hubby did not even eat half his sandwich, which is quite impressive for him. He usually eats everything. Maybe it was an off day, I don't know but with their prices o don't think we'll be back.
I honestly didn't expect the chicken to be so delish. Right price and superb customer service. I will definitely return.

So I've been back a lot and still really like this place. Not happy about the menu changes but found somethings new to like. They are awesome with take out and super quick. The people who work here and super friendly and always wanting to help and bring you things.

It was a toss up between here and Shake Shack across the street. Once we found out this place is only in New York and Vegas, we decided we out to give it a try! 

I love that I'm not confused the minute I walk in. The menus clearly show you how to order, and the descriptions are fool-proof. We went with the classic Blue Ribbon chicken sandwich, and the tenders for the kids. I also got 2 extra pieces of chicken leg and their house salad. 

Don't waste your time with a salad at this place! I should've gotten 2 more pieces of chicken and skipped the salad. Not sure what I was thinking ordering a salad from a place known for their fried chicken, but that was my mistake. It's not that the salad was horrible, just nothing amazing. All of the attention should have been on the chicken, and whatever fantastic seasoning they put on it. The fries are fantastic! Not too salty, just right and they have a crunch to them... so delicious but frustrating as it's easy to just sit there and devour waaaay too many. 

We want to give this place another try in the near future. My husband loved their sauce but was very intrigued by the mix of other sauces on the table, there was just no more room in our bellies for more. Only other thing we didn't care for was the coleslaw, would like to sub that out for something else next time around.

Fried Chicken here is worth it's price but you would think, that consumers paying good money on their products that the establishment would not be cheap and get a real drink dispensary?  For the price of that chicken, they can afford Coke products or if they want to be cheap go with Pepsi.  Other than that, customer service was great, they brought our food to our table and it was really clean. 

So BYO REFRESHMENT here or just drink plain ol' water.

Fried chicken anyone?! Yes, Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken please! Came here for dinner with my parents and we loved it soo much. We ordered "The Bird" a family meal which is pretty much equals to a whole chicken. It comes with 2 breasts, 2 thighs, 2 wings, 2 drumsticks and 2 large sides of coleslaw and fries. Also got "The Pit"sandwich; crisp chicken with aged cheddar, bacon, slaw, and bbq sauce on bun.

Their fried chicken was super crispy, juicy, and flavorful! Doesn't compare to KFC, POPEYES, ETC... It's a bit pricier but your pretty much paying a gourmet fried chicken and you'll be wanting more.. trust me! 

The sandwich bun can be better though. It starts with its quality, plain and dry. It seems like an ordinary packaged bun store bought lol. Unlike other buns, they are a tad thicker and moist. So I'd rather order their chicken instead of sandwiches when coming here. Coleslaw I ain't to hyped for but can be improved by not being too plain.. add more color to it, more purple lettuce and carrots. 

Many dipping sauces to choose from. Wasabi honey is pretty good, like sweet horseradish. Chipotle BBQ honey, sweet with a little kick. I love spicy so ketchup and louisiana hot sauce will do for my chicken! 

Staff were great, seating area were clean except condiments. Those bottles need to be wiped after guests leave. We don't wanna touch greasy bottles and eat. Needed to wipe them myself. Other than that, I will be back for their chicken and fries!

For the chicken sandwich alone, I would give this place 4 stars for taste to price ratio (~$8 sandwich). The chicken is juicy on the inside, and has a really good crunch on the outside. The sandwich is garnished with cucumber, lettuce, and isn't over saturated with seasoning/sauces. For add-ins, the wasabi honey is my favorite. It's just a hint of heat and sweetness, although the sandwich is good alone. Also, I am a fan of their fries and coleslaw. The fries are thin, shoe-string type and they are crispy on the outside and mashed potato-y on the inside, and not so greasy. I am usually not a fan of coleslaw mostly because I do not like mayo, but this coleslaw was pretty good! It is vinegary and not very creamy at all, which might not appeal to some people but was good for me. They also have their own recipe sodas and sweet and ice tea. The root beer is bomb.

Ate here last night. Attractive place and friendly staff. However the food was disappointing. It was not the "crispy crunchy " chicken described on their website home page. We had the tenders and there was no crunch at all. The seasoning is interesting but not anything I'd want again. The choices of only tenders wings and thighs was surprising. What about breasts and drumsticks?  When I got back on line I discovered that the NYC location has these plus several other sides not offered here. I feel cheated as maybe it's better at their NYC location but I won't come back to this one.  As others have said, way too expensive for what you get.

All I ever hear is, "blue ribbon chicken, gotta check blue ribbon chicken". So we finally made the venture out to try some infamous blue ribbon chicken. Food is moderately priced, not cheap and not too expensive. One thing I can say is the service is on par and the establishment is super clean. The food on the other hand I was not too thrilled and did not live up to the hype. Great selection of bbq sauces and they serve alcohol. I mixed the bbq & chipotle honey together, the chipotle is a lighter sauce with a bit of smoke flavor to it. Order the wing supreme, lot of clumpy batter & Cancun, not cooked to the crisp I usually like. The breading on the chicken was a bit heavy. The Blue ribbon sandwich was pretty good. The fries are thin and salty. Corn and bacon smalls are usually my two favorite things but in this combination it was too salty for my liking. The mac & cheese you can never go wrong. After eating here, I felt that I had a huge sodium spike and left super thirsty. I can say I refilled my water cup at least 3x's before I left. Cluck cluck.

As far as crispy chicken sandwiches go, this place turns out a very solid one. Buns are great, breading is light and the sauces are great. Loved that each table has squeeze bottles of flavored honey -the wasabi honey was a surprise favorite- and BBQ sauce. 

I got the original Blue Ribbon sandwich ($6.50, I think). You can make it a combo with fries & coleslaw for an additional $2.50. The serving of fries is very generous and they were shoestring cut and very crispy. The coleslaw had quite a bit of vinegar in it. I love slaw but it wasn't my personal fav. 

The dining room was nice, inviting and really clean. There was a young guy,who brought us silverware and offered to refill out sodas, who was a 5 star employee.  Cool trashing compacting garbage cans were something I have yet to see elsewhere. A solid 4 stars.

Not sure what it is about this place.. I now have a craving for this every week at some point.

I started off with the basic chicken sandwich on my first time but now have diversified my options buy exploring the other offerings they have, and my they are tasty.

Looks like every month they have a new sandwich. 

Everything here is tasty and will aim to please. Bring the family or go solo you won't be dissatisfied

The chicken is tasteless. The fries were better than the chicken for sure. The macaroni and cheese was probably the box kind you can find at Walmart. The shakes should be better for the price. Overall the prices don't match the quality of the food nor taste.

I don't get the bad reviews. The fried chicken here is phenomenal.
The normal chicken sandwich was great too.

Love the seasoning, plus the chicken is moist and tender. 
The fries are great as well. Was my first time and I will be back for more. Highly recommend!

Overpriced. Nothing special. 
No fireworks.
Staff was sloooowww.
If they put Filipinos and Mexicans behind the counter, they'd only need 3 staff members coz they can handle it, instead of 5 white boys and a token black dude who get stressed serving chicken.

I know other people have been raving about this place, but I don't really get it. AND I LOVE FRIED CHICKEN!  I'll get straight to the food, we got the 5 wing combo and the 2 boneless thigh combo.  The chicken was moist and the skin was crispy at least on the wings.  But there was a consistent lack of flavor in both the wings and the thighs.  I saw the famous seasoning dusted on the chicken, but it still lacked flavor.  The thigh and wing meat was also flavorless.  The wings are a better idea than the thighs.  The thighs are thick, meaning lots of flavorless chicken in between the fried coating.  And my thighs had a nice coating of oil/grease at the bottom that soaked through the brown tray, leaving the skin on the bottom of the thighs soggy.  We did not have this problem with the wings.  A positive is the portion size, very generous portion of chicken and fries.  The fries were nice and crispy shoe string fries, but the cole slaw side was forgettable.  The saving grace for the chicken is the dipping sauces available at the table (chipotle honey, bbq, wasabi honey, honey, etc.)  But I feel like good fried chicken should be able to stand alone and that was not the case.  I might give this place another shot later on, but I was sorely disappointed on my first visit.

I got the lunchbox special. Five wings and a mess of shoestring fries. The chicken was the typical 2-parter with the drumette. Small but not tiny. Crispy without being greasy, and nicely seasoned. The fries were also tasty- and they give you a ton. I like that they sell Boyland sodas- (although they are missing the birch beer). Definitely a nice lunch for under $10.
