Never seen their menu which was posted above the registers. This place is order then sit and the deliver to your table. I ordered fried chicken thigh and leg dinner that comes with French fries and coleslaw. 
After ordering we sat ourselves in wood booth that turned out very uncomfortable. Food was delivered quickly. Chicken just ok. Fries thin and crunchy which I liked very much. Coleslaw tasteless. My friend ordered the macaroni and cheese with her chicken and couldn't eat that either. Wouldn't go back. The service was very good!

I love fried chicken. We were waiting for an appointment and decided to give this place a try. Their chicken is all chicken tenders. Lots of different flavor a to dunk chicken tenders in to, so that is a bonus. Chicken wasn't anything special. Not really juicy. Not really crispy. Fries were overly seasoned. The kid working the counter wasn't happy to be on his shift. We asked for a chicken meal and I wanted to sub out the coleslaw for something else; not really an option, but they could give me more fries as a replacement. Ok. Music was loud and strangely off-putting. My daughter ordered a wedge salad that was more bleu cheese than lettuce. Disappointing first visit.

Decided to try this place because I've been to all of the other restaurants in downtown Summerlin. 
It took about 20 minutes to get the food which is pretty long for a fast food place. I ordered the blue ribbon sandwich and my mom ordered the 2 tender combo which comes with fries and Cole slaw. When we got the food I was really surprised by the heavily seasoned chicken. Very strong seasoning on it was like a Cajun seasoning but I did not like it at all. Neither did my mother. The fries however were really good. But the Cole slaw was bland. I wouldn't recommend this place. If your in the area try Shake Shack which is directly across the street.

Chicken sandwich - 4/5
Tenders - 3/5 (Dry, lacked in flavor)
Loaded fries - 4/5 (Have improved since first time)
Service - 3/5

Decided to try this place out awhile ago when they first opened. The service was alright, but the fries were terribly burnt. The chicken sandwich was the best part of the meal, but the price for the meal was a little outrageous. 

The second time coming here: service went down, food improved. The girl at the register looked away and got distracted while I was ordering, so she missed half of what I ordered. I didn't realize until we got the food and were missing half of the chicken tenders. Went back up to ask about the other tenders I ordered, she said I never ordered them. Gave me an attitude. The tenders are alright. I had to smother them in sauce to get a good flavor. 

May come back for a third and (possible) final time. Maybe the service will improve. Three stars because I was nice and got a sassy, teenage eye-roll in return.

Compared to Rib's and Burger's it deserves 3 michelin stars. Compared to an actually decent restaurant? Skip!

I've never eaten in the restaurant, I have postmated it in the past and I will likely not let my laziness lead to another mediocre meal. 

The food is forgettable. Heres why:

-Sandwiches. I've had a few of these. I've had the blue ribbon, the rancher, and the pit. All of them are just pretty bleh. The piece of chicken is huge and doesnt fit (one time I had two pieces of chicken so they would just fall right out). It tastes fine I guess. Basically the whole thing is a soggy mess. Doesn't work.

-Hush Puppies. Dry and bland.

-Smoked mac n cheese. Meh I guess this is fine but velveeta mac n cheese you make at home would even be better than this.

-Corn. It looks like the corn on the menu is different than it used to be but it used to be pretty pretty pretty bad.

Fries. Totally forgettable. Especially the loaded with the works fries and the gravy fries. Just kinda gross.

Maybe this place will have a redemption at some point. But this isn't a one and done review. I have, for lack of better judgement, eaten this food 5 times. And it is always disappointing. Take your money to KFC....it's honestly better and I hate KFC.
Really good chicken  reminds me of back home in NYC.  Thank God they have this here in Vegas when I get homesick

Nothing to get excited about. The food was a bit over priced, chicken was dry with the meat it's self being tasteless, the breading and seasons were not very good to begin with and over cooked on top of that (I think only seasoned with paprika). I ordered the bacon cheese French fries. I had a few but ultimately wished I had just not ordered them. 
What is sad is that we saw this place on the directory and were pretty excited to have some good fried chicken. We walked a way wishing that we had eaten ANYWHERE ELSE. like 7- Eleven for a hot dog now sounds better to me.

I've been here back to back the last two days. And brought more of my coworkers each time.

1. Chicken is hot. Juicy and yummy. 
2. The chicken is not over breaded. 
3. The dry rub is amazing.
4. If you like crispy but not soggy or over burnt fries. ALSO THEY AREN'T OVERLY GREASY. You need to come here.
5. The price is well worth the amount of food you get.
6. Last but not least. There is a server named Sam. Nicest and most attentive server I have ever encountered in the many times I have ever ate at downtown summerlin. And he not only cleans the tables. He also keeps an eye out on ALL the customers and makes sure their dining experience is top notch. I pay a lot of attention to servers and it's a big part of whether or not I go back to a place. Everything from helping you refill your drinks. To grabbing more to-go containers and asking at the most appropriate times before I need anything. The most impressive part was how he handled the situation as he was the only server and there were many tables filled. I went to tell my coworkers he was the poster child of what the service industry should be!

Went above and beyond my expectations of a server at this restaurant. Service was 10 STARS!

I went to speak to his manager today 07/01/15 - and told him. Manager was also a very kind man - you can see his eyes light up when I told him about Sam.

Sam is outstanding - I even asked for his photo to let the world see how great service is highly appreciated.

I will be sure to come here again soon!!

Disturbingly disgusting. Chicken wings were so big and under cooked. There was no crunch to the fried chicken at all. Way too many fries which taste nothing like potatoes. This place was over priced. The best thing they have is the soda machine.

This is some REALLY good chicken, and I mean, REALLY good.

I originally came here on a date, and wasn't expecting much. I mean, it's chicken, how good can a random chicken shop possibly be?

Well, the truth slapped me in the face with delicious flavours and unique but trendy side dippings (Cough, Honey Sriracha, Cough.) 

The chicken wings are nicely sized, there's a lot of meat on each chicken, and they're always cooked to perfection. The crispy breading is undoubtedly almost on par with that of Roscoe's chicken and waffles.

Sadly, the date didn't go so well, but my fondness for this joint did, I've returned time and time again to Downtown Summerlin just for the chicken.

I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves their chicken!

Went here last weekend... was pretty good.. Decided to go back yesterday.. and it was absolutely horrible.. Not sure if its the employees... or just the inconsistent preparation..but I was not happy...I understand it is fried foods... but the amount of salt they put in the mix this time was not edible... I ordered the liver and onions.. was pretty good the first time.. but this time.. nope.. Not sure I will be going back..

My daughter and I stopped in to try this new spot in downtown Summerlin for a quick meal. This is a fairly new business and I was anxious to try as DTS posted an amazing, yummy looking photo on Instagram earlier that day made my mouth water.

I ordered the Blue Ribbon chicken sandwich (what they are known for) which I felt was really overpriced at approximately $6.79 and I made it a combo which included fries, cole slaw and a drink (add on another $2.50). My daughter ordered the kids meal which was one chicken tender with fries at over $5. We were given a pager that would tell us when our food was ready. I found their prices to be a bit high for a fast food joint.

We walked over to the soda machine which by the way they have their own soda which is "cane soda". My daughter chose the root beer, which neither of us really liked. We found a table to sit at and there were probably about three tables with people sitting and eating. I noticed the sauces on the table which I would learn I would need to use in order to give this chicken any taste.

Our food arrived in about ten minutes and was delivered by one of the staff who was very nice. I was excited to try my sandwich and decided to try the honey chipotle sauce. I took my first bite and was immediately disappointed. There was really no flavor to the chicken even with their "special sauce" and the honey chipotle. The bun was soft and the veggies were fresh but I have had better chicken sandwiches elsewhere! There was a generous serving of shoestring fries which were hot and crispy. The meal also came with cole slaw which had a weird vinegar taste....(not my style).

I would like to thank the young man who came by a couple of times to check on us and to see if we needed anything. He also promptly cleared our table when we were done. He was the highlight of our visit and deserves to be commended for providing great service.

Perhaps I picked an off day as I had planned on this meal being delicious, but instead I will stick with Popeyes or Canes for good chicken at a decent price!

We drove by a few times and felt intrigued to give it a try. The atmosphere is nice, clean. Staff was friendly. Particularly the bus-boy. I watched as he diligently worked the floor, made sure the customers had everything they needed and even stopped them from bringing their own trays to the trash. He seemed very thoughtful and even offered us some extra ranch as soon as our food was ready. They're lucky to have him!

The food was okay. Original, yes. The dry-rubbed chicken almost had that home-made touch to it and the fries were really good. I think where this place lacks is a signature sauce. While it offered plenty of Chipotle-something, Honey-something and BBQ.. It wasn't anything extraordinary or different from store bought. I felt it needed something else. It would have been okay except for the fact that for two adults, the tab was almost 30 bucks. We each had 3 pieces of chicken, fries and a drink. 30 bucks felt a bit steep for the meal. I felt for what we paid.. it just didn't match the price. Same thing at Caine's would've been half the cost and I wouldn't gotten their garlic bread. 

I do think it's a good addition to Downtown Summerlin and will fit in well with the demographic. Good, but not for me.
Their chicken are served fresh cooked, flavorful and crispy. I love their thin fries. The employees are very polite and nice as well! Will come back!

I was going to give 3 stars, but being that the Asian cashier guy decided it was in his best interest and as a representative of the company, that it was a good idea to insult his customers before their order was complete. My fiance and I are both chefs, I have been in culinary for 16 years and she has been in for 6 years. We love finding new restaurants to try and explore. Being the foodies that we are, when we get to a new location, we like to order a few items on the menu to try the food. ***It's hard to get a good impression of the restaurant by ordering a chicken sandwich and fries***  we ordered a few different items and a kids meal for our daughter (she's at that age where she like to have her own food)and the cashier just had to make the comment "do you have more people coming? That's a lot of food!!" - So he found it to be that important to insult his customers before they even had a chance to eat. Immediately from the get go, the food tasted like sht.. we will NEVER come back to this restaurant ever again. Even if the owner reached out to me and said they fired that cashier, we will never come back. Everyone of our friends that ask us about this place, we will give the negative review, to try and save our culinary friends from this sorry excuse of a "restaurant".

Went here for lunch on 8/12/16 because Fogo de Chao wasn't opened for the day yet. I didn't want to wait around an extra half hour so I headed over here to check out the menu for BR. 

If you get a drink, or a side, you're going to pay upwards of $15 per person - which is hardly affordable for non organic chicken fingers and fries.

Combos are your best value option because they come with fries and coleslaw instead of paying $3.50+ ala cart for sides. I made sure to double check that the fries weren't those disgusting crinkle cut fries ala Raising Canes before I ordered. I chose the 2 tenders & fries combo, and subbed pickled cucumbers for the coleslaw. It took maybe 10 minutes to come out, but the food tasted fresh.

The chicken has a dry rub coating - definitely needed sauce. Luckily every table has its own sauce caddy with bbq sauce, 3 types of honey and 2 hot sauces, in addition to the white sauce that the combo comes with.

I mixed the white sauce, ancho chipotle honey and wildflower honey and put it on everything. This sauce combo definitely made the chicken over the top and was incredible on the fries too.

3 stars is in no way bad. If it was more of a value, I'd bump up the stars. Maybe things are turning around for this place as my food was cooked well and tasted nice.

My friend wanted to come here bc she saw it on ig! I actually really liked it here. Its across from shake shack in downtown summerlin. Customer service was great! We told them it was our first time and they gave us wings to sample with their sauces. Wings were A1 but we ended up getting sandwiches. I got the pit and it was amazing and with their shoestring fries? supa good! I will definitely be back here. It was clean and prices were good! 
RANCH REVIEW!!! Their ranch was pretty good but it was definitely on the tangy side but tasted fresh and it was interesting. But i dont like it enough to ever go out of my way for it so  5/10 HAHAHA

Loves it! Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken is AMAZE. Located in the far end of the 'dining destination' at Downtown Summerlin. Food is fresh and Southern fabulous. Pickled cucumbers are the only vegetable LOL, but they rock, and I e asked them if they'd sub fries for a salad for me once or twice and they were very accommodating. The staff is friendly and fast. I dig it :)

Always love coming here. The best tenders in Las Vegas along with Rhino. There is a sauce for everyone. Be sure to try them all. If you are looking for something sweet and that has a bite make sure to try the Wasabi Honey! Also the sandwiches are all great

Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken was featured on MSN / Spoon University as the 10th spot for the 25 Best Places to Get Fried Chicken in America, and we decided to visit the Las Vegas/ Summerlin location.

The restaurant is located half hour outside the Strip, in the Festival Plaza in downtown Summerlin, across the street from the Red Rock Casino.The GPS wasn't quite accurate, and the restaurant said to go past the Lazy Dog Cafe, and they were located across from Shake Shack and Wolf Gang Puck. 

We found the place, with plenty of parking and at 5:30 pm on a Monday, there was also plenty of places to sit inside.  We walked up to the counter and looked at the combination of chicken you could get.  Their chicken tenders were popular, and so were the chicken pieces.  I chose to get the White combination (breast and wing) which came with cole slaw and fries, and also an order of their tenders. Stephen ordered the same but with spicy slaw, while Mom got the 2 drumsticks.  The meal for 3 with drinks came to $42.

 The food came out within 10 minutes.  The chicken wasn't what I was expecting. It was coated in like a dry rub, more than a traditional buttermilk dipped fried chicken.  The outside wasn't crunchy but it did have a spice on it instead.  I would say its like the KFC fried chicken... its fried, but not crunchy fried.

 There were sauces to use on the chicken, which were mostly made of honey.  The sauce did add great flavor to the chicken, but on its own, the chicken was just ok.  I really loved the skinny fries, but the cole slaw was sub par.. very watery and not creamy.  They carry an independent soda company, as well as sweet and non sweet teas.

I would not go out of my way to eat here. However, if I were to visit Red Rock (the hotel/ casino or the national park), I would stop by here for lunch or dinner.

Went there today 6-21-15 for lunch. Stood awkwardly at the front for about 5 minutes before anyone could be bothered to take my order. 

I got a three piece chicken tender combo. When I hear "combo" I automatically think fries and a drink....not the case here. A combo is just the tenders,  fries, and cole slaw. I thought that was weird...especially since the combo was over $12.  So I got the "combo" with a root beer and asked for my fries loaded (topped with sour cream, cheese, and bacon).  The total was almost twenty bucks...more than I want to spend for lunch.  

The place was pretty busy and there were only four open tables but they were all dirty.  I just sat down anyways...cuz' that's how I roll.  A little chicken crumbs never hurt anybody and I don't want to be "that lady" and ask to have the table wiped down.  

These tenders were not good, ya'll.  Yes they were fresh, they were hot, they were moist, but there is a weird dry rub on the outside and the inside is really bland.  I could easily make these in my kitchen.  They have many sauces to try to disguise their bland chicken:
1) Habanero hot sauce - Just gross.  No tanginess at all...just sweet and slightly spicy.  Skip it. I much prefer Frank's Red Hot or buffalo sauce. 
2) Barbecue- Standard barbecue sauce...tastes just like the kind you get at the grocery store. 
3) Wasabi honey- This is literally wasabi-flavored honey.  It is watery and disgusting and I don't know who in the world likes this. 
4) Wildflower honey- Once again....this is just plain honey.  Who is dipping their chicken in honey?  This place doesn't even have biscuits so I dunno why they have honey. 
5) Chipotle barbecue- See #2

The coleslaw was awful.  I actually spit it out.  It's just cabbage, carrots, and vinegar.  Yuck.  

The fries were delicious.  The root beer was delicious.  

Cane's is about twenty times better and half the price.  I have no reason to go back here.  If I ever did end up back here I'd try something else...like maybe the wings or a sandwich.  The tenders are not worth it.

*update* When I ate there I asked the cashier if I could substitute the cole slaw for the pickled cucumbers and I was denied but I've read a couple of yelp reviews where yelpers were allowed to do this.  Eff you, too, blue ribbon chicken.  Why wouldn't you let me?

Not that impressed first time around. This place gets an A for a solid effort.

I tried the Blue Ribbon chicken sandwich expecting it to be tasty as its their signature. I noted the bread was flaky and not as fresh as I like my bread as well as the chicken didn't have a lot of flavor to me. 

Don't know if I'll eat here again. Maybe it was because i tried a sandwich and not chicken strips.

*I also was interested in some dessert, I was curious about the shakes, asked the clerk about one that's good and she told me the machine has been down for a week!!!

Honestly if you're machine has been down for a week you don't look like you're doing well for business. Imagine how quick they get things up and running when there's enough foot traffic. 

Wondering how long this place will last. It was pretty empty for dinner time.

Oh man oh man ohhhh man! What can I say about this place? It's awesome! We walked in probably 40 minutes to closing (I know I felt bad but I wanted fried chicken to end my night of my 30th Birthday celebration lol). We were greeted and I believe he was the manager as well. We noticed there was still chicken left in the back and people were cleaning the tables. He knew it was our first time here and treated us so respectfully. Really really loved his customer service. I wish I got his name but for sure the next time I go, I'll update this post with his name! Everyone was really nice that worked there. Brought us the sauce rack for the chicken and brought our food. We instantly were wowed by the fries because they were thin and crispy. The chicken looked so crispy and seasoned to perfection. Our first bite was heaven in our mouth! The honey sauces, you will literally have to try them all. I love how flavorful the skin and meat was. Perfect! Not overly salty and just omg... I'm drooling just thinking about it haha! I got the thigh and leg combo by the way. Substitute the fries with sweet potatoe fries. Yuuummmm! It really hit the spot and made my day so much happier. The thigh and leg was a great size. I didn't finish it and took the thigh + fries home. Ate it later with rice haha! Still crunchy after a few hours. You know that's always a good sign!! Happy eating my fellow yelpers!

when you first enter, the register and the menu board is the first thing you see. you order first and then you seat yourself. 
this place is good. it's not over the top amazing and i wouldn't come back here again if i wasn't in the area. i live in henderson and this place is located in summerlin so it is a far drive; 30 minutes. i ordered a combo called the drum line ($8.50) which is two drumsticks which originally comes with french fries and coleslaw. you can substitute both. however, in order to substitute the coleslaw, they only have two options. i believe it's either spicy mayo (i forget) or extra french fries. but in order for you to have extra fries instead of coleslaw, you need to keep the first set of french fries it comes with. so you'd get double french fries. the chicken was seasoned and it was good, but like i said earlier nothing special. their french fries are normal fries that are skinny. my boyfriend ordered a sandwich called the pit ($7.50) which has lettuce, bacon, bbq sauce, cheese. the bun was cold but overall the sandwich was good but didn't make him satisfyingly full and it's not worth the 30-40 minute drive. also for the price totaling $20 isn't a fair price for the quality of food. it's not even comparable to other chicken places. 
the environment is nice, clean, and they have a self serve drink machine. they have a gender neutral bathroom. if you're local (live near the area) it's decent to go to.

We have been to Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken a few times, and we're here today for lunch. The chicken was definitely not worthy of the name.

Let's start with the positives... clean restaurant, great soda selection, awesome ranch and fries. This is why it's getting an extra star instead of one for me. But for a place that boasts its chicken, ours was horrible. We all got the tenders, and they were almost inedible. They were so tough and rubbery you had to use a fork and knife because you couldn't even bite through them.

I'm feeling a little nauseous now just thinking about it... we sadly won't be back.

The chicken sandwich was very good as was the corn. I also enjoyed the white chocolate strawberry shake. While the food was good, I thought it was pretty pricey at 23.00. It won't keep me away, just say'n.

Been at Avid honey lover I must say this place contribute greatly to my addiction!!

Each table/booth  have an assortment of squirt bottles full of honey so squirt away while you eat your chicken sandwich.
 FYI:  try a little Wasabi honey on your string fries yum

Very dry and chewy fried chicken. Overpriced. Super friendly people, great atmosphere. Raising Canes is by far superior as far as fried chicken goes. Maybe this place should change their name to Blue Ribbon French Fries. Because those were delicious.

Why did the chicken cross the road? 
To get to Blue Ribbon, of course! 

This is an order-and-pay-then-seat-yourself-and-they'll-bring-you-the-food kind of place. A cross between "fast food" and "restaurant". 

It's southern style comfort food, with lots of condiments to choose from in a casual, kid-friendly environment.

I am writing this review after waking up to find the store closed at 8:45. I mean cleaned up ready to blow out at 9:05 closed. When an operation cannot do something as simple as honor their business hours that is a message of just plain NOT CARING.  

For the sake of transparency, as in all my reviews, I will say that I have enjoyed their good numerous times.  I WAS a fan.  But seeing this crew watch me photograph them as the cleaner up after closing early, no one even made an attempt to offer an explanation.  

Since I witnessed this evident lack of caring it makes me suspect on other aspects of the operation and processes.  Needless to say Blue Ribbon can consider this customer gone.

Walked right across the street to another establishment and spent my money with them.
Came here with the family for a late dinner and it was 30 minutes to closing. Crew was great very friendly! We will def be back! Food was good for the prices and restaurant  was very clean!

I feel like a review of a fried chicken spot is immediately bias because.... DUH, it's fried chicken. The reality is, not all chicken is created equal. This is like chic fi la - on steroids, taking a vacation with its feet in the sand. That good. 
First and foremost the chicken has a unique flavor all it's own. No other place to offer a comparison. 
THEN (and this may be the most exciting part) the SAUCE!! (Yeah, they got the sauce both literally and figuratively.)
Different Honey variations - chipotle (bomb), wasabe (not a fan) and regular (which for me ended up being combined with habenero hot sauce for the most perfect balance). 
You can have a sandwich or chicken on its own. 
I am shocked I've never been here and have come to grips with the fact that I'll be back ------ A LOT.
Best fried chicken in town. The lunch special of wings, fries and a drink is under 10 bucks but today I wanted the Firebird. Delicious! And 1 dollar pint's of PBR.

The french fries!!!!! But the sandwich was good also. The pickles are good! We had the Original. 

To all complainers about the price, well, it is Summerlin. You can't omit a star because of that. 

Will be back for a crunchy piece AND fries!

Super big location, super crispy chicken.

Love all the parking that this complex has to offer and love the flavor and quality of product that this location has to offer. Their chicken is breaded to perfection and the meat is always tender and juicy. The loaded fries are a must and their milkshakes are divine. Strawberry all the way for me.Warning: They don't offer whipped cream, which I strange but you do you BRFC! 

I have yet to try a burger of the month I didn't like and I their staff has always been super friendly and helpful.

Delicious fried chicken at an affordable price, I'll take it.

They have really great fried chicken! Crunchy outside and juicy inside - I really loved it... it's exactly what fried chicken should be.  The coleslaw was OK but the mashed potatoes were really good too!  
A little high in price, but quality made up for it.

Um...this is seriously the BEST FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH I'VE EVER HAD. 
Chik-Fil-A ain't got nothing on Blue Ribbon. 
Crispy fried batter + delicious seasoning + juicy tender chicken = perfect

Also, this restaurant is super clean, service is really friendly, and they have their own soda! :)
Fries are crispy.  
Cole slaw is a light and crunchy.  
Pickles aren't overly salty. 

*Tip: get the chipotle honey!!!!*

It was my first time trying Blue Ribbon last night. Honestly I'm not impressed with the food at all. I got the 2 piece dark combo with a large mashed potato side and drink. 

Fried Chicken:
Looks heavily seasoned but can't taste anything. Have to eat it with their sauce. Their breading is very different from other fried chicken place but not in a good way. 

Mashed potato: 
For a large size it is pretty small and taste like any mashed potato. 

Cole slaw: 
Doesn't have much taste to it and I didn't finish it (which is rare because I usually finish any food that is in front of me)

Fries:
This is the best item I have for the night. I feel like this is what I'll come back for.

Soda:
They make their soda which is very interesting but I'm not a fan. 

Overall I think this place is on the pricier side for the amount of food you get. I think if I ever come back I'll probably only get their fries.

I was very underwhelmed by this place. Not sure if I just ordered the wrong thing. I wanted to like it after hearing great things about it but the only thing that I really enjoyed was the sweet potato French fries! 

My husband however thought his sandwich (the pit) was great but the spotlight of the experience was the regular French fries. 

The staff was very nice. Maybe next time I'll just try a chicken strip basket and not a sandwich.

Food was hot and fresh, the dry rub seasoning on the chicken does take a bit to get used to. The portions are good sized. Three stars are solely because the seasoning is not to my taste. 
Staff is friendly. The restaurant is clean and has several TVs to watch. 
The drink fountain is not your typical - cane sugar drinks. Again takes a bit of getting used to.  I had the ginger ale - tasty, but took a bit to get used to
The place is more expensive than expected. Maybe because it's Summerlin? Three piece with a drink , including their string fries (these were very good and plentiful) was about $12.
Love their burgers!! I got the firebird, pulled chicken and the beak butt. Very clean place and friendly staff. I will come back here again.
